title: Global HRIS Specialist
description:
Warsaw, Poland
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**
==================================================


We're on the hunt for an experienced Global HRIS Specialist. A successful candidate will be responsible for projects involving close collaboration with HR colleagues and other departments, such as IT, Finance, Quality, and Legal.


**What you’ll do at Elekta**
============================

This role is an expert in Human Resources Management Systems (HRIS), ensuring the system meets business needs through maintenance, development, and configuration. Key responsibilities include ensuring data accuracy, implementing new functionalities, generating reports, and supporting end users.


Your role will include (but not limited to):

* Customize and configure HRIS software to meet organizational needs.
* Administer and maintain HRIS databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to collect and evaluate user requirements.
* Participate in projects to implement new and improve existing functionality for HRIS.
* Provide user support and troubleshoot technical issues related to HRIS.
* Develop and conduct training sessions for users to enhance system adoption.
* Generate reports to support data-driven decision-making.
* Suggest and contribute ideas for improvement within the HRIS team.

**The right stuff**
===================

* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a focus on scalable, efficient solutions.
* High independence, proactivity, and responsibility for the tasks performed.
* Adept at managing concurrent projects and meeting their respective deadlines.

**What you’ll bring**
=====================

* Bachelor’s degree in HR, IT or Management.
* 3-5 years’ experience in supporting and troubleshooting HRIS systems.
* Strong knowledge of HRIS systems and HR processes.
* Intermediate proficiency of multiple components, features, and functions of Workday.
* Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
* Training skills for HR staff on HRIS usage.
* Adaptable and open to occasional time zone adjustments.
* Fluent in English.

**What you will get**
=====================


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, Elekta offers a range of benefits depending on the location where you apply.

**Hiring process**
==================


We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

**Your Elekta contact**
=======================


For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Sarah Elmasry at sarah.elmasry@elekta.com.

**We are an equal opportunity employer.**
=========================================


We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

**About Elekta**
================


As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.


Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.

title: Senior Software Architect
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We design and build technology used to treat cancer patients worldwide. Join us to build technology that brings hope for everyone dealing with cancer. To further invest in the innovation of tomorrow’s radiotherapy solutions, we are now recruiting a **Senior Software Architect** to our **Imaging** group. The position is located at Elekta’s head office in Stockholm, Sweden and you will report to Karin Ask who is a Manager Imaging NGL at Elekta.

**What you’ll do at Elekta**


As a Senior Software Architect your responsibilities will be (but not limited to) :


In this Software Architect position, you will be developing the new X-ray based imaging solution in our future radiation therapy products together with a skilled team, focusing on **image acquisition**. You will be designing and writing software that integrates the X-ray imaging hardware components into the system and provides the required functionality for image acquisition, safety, calibration, and diagnostics.


Your Main Responsibilities will be to:

* Define and document software architecture, together with the team
* Implement software, including unit and integration tests
* Document software detailed design
* Review requirements and test specifications


You understand that software development is more than just writing code, and you will take part in the whole development cycle from requirements, design, implementation, testing, and documentation. Since we work with future radiation therapy products, there is currently no work with maintenance or obsolescence of our existing products.


You will be part of an international and cross functional program working according to Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe). Your team works with integrated hardware and software solutions, and they love things that blink and go “blip”. We think you do too!

**What you bring**


To be a suitable candidate for this position we think you have a master's degree in engineering, specializing in computer science, electronics, physics or similar. You probably have around 10 years of working experience. It is meriting if you have prior experience of working in a regulated industry, preferably in the medical sector. You are proficient in English, both written and spoken.


You are someone who will thrive in a team that works with:

* New development with modern C/C++
* Python for test automation
* Linux, Windows, and embedded microcontroller environments


You are a true team-player, have the ability to deliver through others and enjoy coaching and mentoring more junior colleagues.

**Why should you join Elekta?**


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays)
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week)

**Hiring process**


We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail. Last day for applying is January 31st, 2025.

**Your Elekta contact**


For questions, please contact the Global Talent Acquisition Partner Nidhi Sarkar at nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com

**We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer**.

**What you’ll do at Elekta**
============================

  

As a **Software Engineer** in our Neuro business line, you will be developing Leksell GammaPlan, a desktop Linux-based integrated treatment planning system for the Leksell Gamma Knife®. By designing efficient, reliable, and high-performance software solutions, your work will directly contribute to helping medical professionals plan personalized and precise cancer treatments**.** To learn more about the system you will help enhance, please visit: Leksell GammaPlan® | Stereotactic Radiosurgery | Elekta.  

You will be part of a collaborative team of around 15 Software Engineers, working in a SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) environment to drive innovation in cancer treatment.

#### **Responsibilities**

  

In this **hands-on** role, you will contribute to all phases of the software development and maintenance lifecycle in C++, including requirements, design, implementation, and testing. Coding and peer reviews will be a major part of your daily work.

  

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

* Participating in all phases of software R&D projects, with a focus on requirement specification, design, planning, implementation, testing, and documentation, while adhering to company standards.
* Evaluating technologies, methodologies, and products to enhance software development.
* Applying Agile principles and practices, following the SAFe methodology as part of a Scrum team.
* Understanding and adhering to Elekta’s quality system while contributing to its continuous improvement.
**What you bring**
==================

  

To thrive in this role, you should enjoy working in an Agile team environment and be comfortable discussing, reviewing, and verifying your work and that of the team before it reaches end users. We also expect that you have:

* 3-5 years of professional commercial experience in C++ development
* Experience in a team-based environment with disciplined use of source code version control and branch management
* A university degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
* Professional proficiency in English.
  

Nice to have:

* Experience with multi-disciplinary product development
* Familiarity with Linux-based systems
* Previous experience in a medical or other regulated industry.
**Why should you join Elekta?**
===============================

  

In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).
**Hiring process**
==================


We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the **20th** **of March 2025**.

  

For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

**About Elekta**
================

  

As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.

  

More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.

  

Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

**What you’ll do at Elekta**
============================


Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge software that makes a real positive impact in people’s lives? Join our team and play a key role in developing the real-time embedded software that controls multiple axes in our radiation therapy devices to safely deliver radiation to patients.


As a **L****ead Software Engineer**, you’ll be involved in every stage of the development lifecycle—requirements, design, implementation, and testing—while leveraging your strong C++ skills to build secure, modern, and maintainable solutions. You’ll be a part of a dynamic team of 15+ engineers, split into two agile Scrum teams, where you’ll contribute to developing new product features for our Linear Accelerator machines and radiation therapy product portfolio. You’ll work across a range of devices, from full-fledged Linux systems to bare-metal microcontrollers, utilizing various communication protocols and design patterns.

#### **Responsibilities**


Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

* Software implementation, primarily in C++, including unit and integration tests
* Designing architecture and creating detailed documentation
* Reviewing code and software related artifacts
* Mentoring colleagues and sharing knowledge
* Staying updated on technical and clinical advancements in the field
* Understanding and adhering to the Elekta quality system, introducing improvements to its effectiveness.

**What you bring**
==================


We are looking for a proactive and collaborative software engineer with a can-do attitude and a systems-thinking approach. Your ability to drive results, collaborate effectively within a team, and contribute to a supportive and fun work environment will be key to your success in this role.


We believe you should also have:

* A university degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience in software engineering within a product development organization.
* Strong C++ skills, with a passion for writing clean, safe, and maintainable code.
* Solid understanding of software architecture for large-scale projects.
* Professional proficiency in English.
* Experience in regulated industries, such as medical technology, is a plus.

**Additional merits** include experience with or strong interest in one or more of the following:

* Real-time systems
* Control theory, e.g., servo control
* Fieldbus communication technologies (CAN, EtherCAT)
* Board Support Package development (e.g. DMA, UART, USB, Ethernet)
* ZeroMQ, Protobuf
* Unit testing framework, like Catch2
* CMake and build systems in general
* CI/CD integration
* Linux
* Yocto
* Development of test frameworks, simulators and/or emulators.

**Why should you join Elekta?**
===============================


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).


If you thrive in an environment where innovation, teamwork, and high standards come together to make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!

**Hiring process**
==================


We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the **23rd** **of March 2025**.


For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

**About Elekta**
================


As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.


More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.


Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: IT Mjukvaruingenjör / C#/.NET Software Engineer
emails: marcus.lansink@kubal.se, peter.eliasson@kubal.se, jobb@kubal.se, marcus.lansink@kubal.se, peter.eliasson@kubal.se, jobb@kubal.se
description:
Kubikenborg Aluminium AB är Sveriges enda producent av primäraluminium och är ett av de största industriföretagen i Sundsvall. Fabriken byggdes 1942 och vi har kapacitet att tillverka 130 000 ton aluminium per år. Slutprodukten som består av göt levereras till press och valsverk över hela Europa. Kubal har idag 460 anställda.
  
Arbetsbeskrivning
  
Vi söker en IT Mjukvaruingenjör som kan utveckla och underhålla våra digitala lösningar som stöder centrala produktionsprocesser och hjälpfunktioner. Denna roll kräver en teknisk bakgrund kombinerat med problemlösningsförmåga samt en god samarbetsförmåga då du kommer att samarbeta med de övriga avdelningarna på företaget.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

Designa, utveckla, testa och underhålla anpassade mjukvarulösningar
  
Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att definiera funktionella och icke-funktionella krav
  
Bidra till mjukvaruarkitektur, design och API/gränssnittsdefinition
  
Dokumentera programvarukrav, arkitektur och designspecifikationer
  
Säkerställa driftsäkerhet för verksamhetskritiska system, inklusive deltagande i beredskapsaktiviteter
  
Förbättra systemens prestanda, skalbarhet och säkerhet
  
  

**Krav:**  

Kandidat- eller masterexamen I datavetenskap, systemteknik eller motsvarande erfarenhet
  
Minst 3-års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla skalbara, underleverantörsbara och säkra mjukvarulösningar
  
Starka kunskaper i C#/.NET programmering
  
Erfarenhet av databashantering och optimering
  
Stor förståelse för mjukvaruutvecklingens livscykel och bästa praxis
  
God kommunikationsförmåga i engelska (både skriftligt och muntligt)
  
Grundläggande förståelse för agila metoder (Scrum, Kanban).
  
  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**  

Erfarenhet av Kubernetes och kontainerorkestrering
  
Praktisk expertis inom testdriven utveckling (TDD) och ramverk för enhetstestning
  
Kunskap om webbaserade UI-ramverk
  
Erfarenhet av MySQL-klustring med hög tillgänglighet (HA)
  
Kunskaper inom utveckling av mobilapplikationer
  
Erfarenhet av Grafana eller liknande datavisualiseringsverktyg
  
Erfarenhet inom C++
  
Kunskaper om Active Directory för autentisering och auktorisering (samt alla andra lokala IAM-lösningar)
  
**Kunskaper om MSOffice och API:** er för export av data och dokumenthantering
  
  

Tjänstens omfattning avser heltid och på dagtid
  
Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
  
**Placeringsort:** Sundsvall
  
Tjänsten rapporterar till chef för IT-avdelningen.
  
  

**Fackliga företrädare:**  

Ledarna, Marcus Lansink 073- 988 5888
  
marcus.lansink@kubal.se
  
Unionen, Peter Eliasson 073-988 5981
  
peter.eliasson@kubal.se
  
Vi vill ha en alkohol och drogfri arbetsmiljö. Därför genomför vi ett alkohol- och drogtest vid nyanställning, samt slumpmässiga alkohol- och drogtester under året.
  
Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av chef för IT-avdelningen, Yevgen Izvyekov, 073- 988 80 42
  
Din ansökan märkt ”IT Mjukvaruingenjör” skickas till jobb@kubal.se så snart som möjligt då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast 2025-05-01.
  
Vi behandlar ansökningarna löpande vilket gör att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden löper ut.
  
  

Engelsk version
  
  

**Position:** C#/.NET Software Engineer
  
Job Description
  
We are looking for a skilled C#/.NET Software Engineer to develop and maintain digital solutions supporting core production processes and auxiliary functions. This role requires a strong technical background, problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with the production departments.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design, develop, test, and maintain custom software solutions.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define functional and non-functional requirements.
  
Contribute to software architecture, design, and API/interface definition.
  
Document software requirements, architecture, and design specifications.
  
Ensure operational reliability of mission-critical systems, including participation in emergency response activities.
  
Improve system performance, scalability, and security.
  
  

**Reporting:**  

The C#/.NET Software Engineer reports directly to the Head of IT.
  
  

**Job Requirements:**  

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, or equivalent experience.
  
At least 3 years of proven experience designing and developing scalable, maintainable, and secure software solutions.
  
Strong C#/.NET programming skills.
  
Experience with database management and optimization.
  
Solid understanding of software development life cycle and best practices.
  
Good communication skills in English (both written and spoken).
  
Basic understanding of agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).
  
  

**Merits (Preferred Skills & Experience):**  

Experience with Kubernetes and container orchestration.
  
Hands-on expertise in Test-Driven Development (TDD) and unit testing frameworks.
  
Knowledge of web-based UI frameworks.
  
Experience with high-availability (HA) MySQL clustering.
  
Familiarity with mobile application development.
  
Working experience with Grafana or similar data visualization tools.
  
Experience with C++.
  
Familiarity with Active Directory for authentication and authorization. (+ any other on-premise IAM solutions)
  
Familiarity with MsOffice APIs for exporting data and document handling
  
  

The scope of the service refers to full-time and daytime
  
Probationary employment may apply.
  
**Placement:** Sundsvall
  
The position reports to the head of the IT department.
  
  

**Union representatives:**  

Ledarna, Marcus Lansink 073- 988 5888
  
marcus.lansink@kubal.se
  
Unionen, Peter Eliasson 073-988 5981
  
peter.eliasson@kubal.se
  
We want an alcohol and drug-free work environment. Therefore, we carry out an alcohol and drug test for new hires, as well as random alcohol and drug tests during the year.
  
Questions about the position can be answered by Head of the IT Division, Yevgen Izvyekov, 073- 988 80 42
  
Your application marked "IT Software Engineer" will be sent to jobb@kubal.se as soon as possible as the selection takes place on an ongoing basis, but no later than 2025-05-01.
  
We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which means that the position may be filled before the application period expires.

title: Systemadministratör till Social Omsorgsförvaltningen!
description:
Ystad är den lilla staden med de stora möjligheterna. Här finns unika naturupplevelser, en levande historia, ett dynamiskt kulturliv och mångfald av fritidsaktiviteter. Vi har också ett rikt näringsliv som verkar både lokalt och globalt.​
  
  

I Ystads kommun är vi cirka 2900 engagerade medarbetare som bidrar och gör skillnad. Tillsammans skapar vi en bättre vardag för våra invånare, företag, organisationer och besökare, nu och i framtiden.​
  
  

För oss är ledarskapet viktigt, därför utbildas alla chefer i utvecklande ledarskap. Vi erbjuder dig en trygg anställning där du gör en meningsfull insats i samhället. Här hittar du även många karriärmöjligheter i en organisation som ständigt utvecklas.
  
  

Vi står stadigt på vår värdegrund som är - Bättre Tillsammans, som kännetecknas av mod, tillit, delaktighet och professionalitet.
  
  

Inom social omsorgsförvaltningen arbetar cirka 1200 engagerade medarbetare som bidrar till att ge stöd och omsorg till de som behöver i vår kommun. Arbetet sker inom äldreomsorg, hemtjänst, funktionsnedsättning och socialpsykiatri, individ- och familjeomsorg.
  
  

ARBETSUPPGIFTER
  
Inom social omsorgsförvaltningen arbetar cirka 1 200 medarbetare för att ge stöd och omsorg till dem som behöver det i kommunen. Arbetet sker inom äldreomsorg, hemtjänst, funktionsnedsättning, socialpsykiatri samt individ- och familjeomsorg.
  
  

Systemadministratören ingår i Kansli- och utvecklingsstaben för social omsorgsförvaltningen, där förvaltningens IT-organisation är placerad.
  
  

Som systemadministratör ansvarar du för administration, support och utveckling av förvaltningens verksamhetssystem.
  
  

**I rollen kommer du att:**  

* Administrera och utveckla verksamhetssystem genom att implementera nya funktioner och moduler i samarbete med verksamheten.
* Felsöka och hantera supportärenden, inklusive felanmälningar till systemleverantörer och IT-avdelningen.
* Ansvara för behörighetsadministration, inklusive skapande, ändring och borttagning av användarkonton enligt säkerhetsföreskrifter.
* Ta fram statistikrapporter.
* Utbilda och stödja användare i systemhantering samt bistå med utbildningsmaterial.
* Leda och hålla i möten med en arbetsgrupp av superusers.
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av GDPR och andra regelverk, samt arbeta med loggkontroller och journalgallring.


Du kommer att ingå i ett engagerat team och ha ett nära samarbete med kollegor som arbetar inom samma område, där utvecklingsfrågor är en central del av arbetet.
  
  

KVALIFIKATIONER
  
Vi söker dig som har en relevant utbildning eller erfarenhet som bedöms passa för en systemadministratörsroll. Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i system och har lätt för att stödja användare och förstå deras behov. Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom eller i nära anslutning till hälso- och sjukvård eller vård och omsorg är meriterande.
  
  

**För att lyckas i tjänsten ser vi gärna att du:**  

* Är serviceinriktad, strukturerad och har god kommunikationsförmåga i både tal och skrift
* Trivs med att arbeta självständigt och kan prioritera arbetsuppgifter effektivt
* Har en god pedagogisk förmåga och känner dig bekväm med att hålla utbildningar och mötesforum
* Har en god förståelse för IT-säkerhet, användarbehörigheter och regelverk som GDPR
* Är en lagspelare som trivs med att arbeta i samverkan med olika parter


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet tillsammans med kompetens och erfarenhet.
  
  

Låter detta som en rolig utmaning som skulle passa dig? Bli en del av vårt team och skicka in din ansökan idag!
  
  

ÖVRIGT
  
Medarbetare sökes under förutsättningen att tjänsten inte måste tas i anspråk av redan anställd personal eller personer med företrädesrätt.
  
  

Alla medarbetare ska erbjudas förutsättningar till en god hälsa, därför arbetar vi aktivt med vår arbetsmiljö. Vi erbjuder friskvård och en rökfri arbetstid.
  
  

I samband med denna rekrytering undanber vi oss kontakter från rekryteringsföretag och andra annonsörer. Observera även att vi endast tar emot ansökningar via Visma Recruit och således inte via e-post eller via andra kontaktvägar. Har du frågor om tjänsten vänligen kontakta angiven kontaktperson.

title: IT - tekniker
description:
Majvallen Taxi AB är ett transportbolag med (enbart) samhällsbetalda uppdrag.
  
Vi utför trafik i hela Västra Götalands län.

**Krav:**  

**Sökanden ska:** Kunskap inom IT hantering.
  
Ha bra kunskap över Office programmet (särskilt Excel). Kunna hantera mjuk och hårdvara på program. Kunna ha förståelse för grupparbete och uppgifter inom ekonomi.
