title: Senior Software Engineer - Open banking
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
 At Tink, we deliver open banking solutions as a part of Visa. We’re creating the foundations that a new world of finance will be built on. By constantly challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing the ground-breaking services that businesses will use, to revolutionize the way millions of people manage their money. The world of financial services is changing fast, and we will continue to be at the forefront of it.
   

  

 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  

**What we offer you:**
 You will be working in an international environment where your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Datadog, REST and much more.
* Develop reliable, scalable, high performance and highly distributed systems that power open banking products for different markets using your technical expertise.
* Innovate around new features and measure how these features perform, being instrumental in bringing the product vision to life.
* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following best engineering practices.


 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

 This is a hybrid position, and we would like you to be in office three days per week.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Engineering organization, working from our office in central Stockholm. We see that you enjoy working with others and that you have a passion for what you do. You want to better the product you are working on as well as your knowledge and skills.
   

  

 We would like you to have:
   

  

* Extensive experience working as backend engineer with Java technologies
* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric
* Experience from working with DevOps methodologies and tools
* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics
* Experience in mentoring more junior colleagues


**Additional Information**
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Senior System Developer
company_industry: Ground Passenger Transportation, Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage, and Truck Transportation
description:
**Senior System Developer - Backend & Vehicle Technology.** 




  





 Nobina är en av Nordens största och mest erfarna operatörer inom kollektivtrafik. Varje dag hjälper vi över en miljon människor att komma till jobbet, skolan eller andra aktiviteter. Genom att leverera kontrakterad kollektivtrafik på uppdrag av samhället bidrar vi till ökad rörlighet, minskad miljöbelastning och lägre samhällskostnader.
 



  





 Hos Nobina får alla medarbetare en gedigen introduktion och möjligheter till vidare kompetensutveckling. Vårt arbetssätt genomsyras av vår affärsidé "Förenkla kundens vardagsresor" och vår vision "Alla vill resa med oss". Vi är stolta över vår mångfald och arbetar aktivt med att främja en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där alla medarbetares unika kompetenser tas tillvara.
 



 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens transportlösningar genom innovativ systemutveckling? Vi söker nu en Senior System Developer till vårt team Backend & Vehicle Technology.
 



  





**Om tjänsten:** 




 I den här rollen får du möjlighet att arbeta med vårt nyutvecklade system som hanterar enorma mängder data i en molnbaserad SQL-databas. Du kommer att ansvara för optimering och uppsättning av databaser samt vara en central del i att vidareutveckla systemet, som redan spelat en viktig roll i Nobinas trafikteknologi under de senaste tre åren.
 



 Här kommer du att arbeta med TDS – ett kritiskt system för att samla, hantera och analysera trafikdata i realtid. Du kommer att arbeta nära IoT-teamet för att säkerställa att korrekt data når våra realtidssystem, som används för till exempel kartor och punktlighetsmätningar.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla och optimera molnbaserade SQL-databaser i Azure.
* Arbeta med .NET Core och .NET 8 i Microsoftmiljö.
* Vidareutveckla systemet genom att integrera nya funktioner och datakällor.
* Hantera databassystemens struktur och säkerställa deras effektivitet.
* Granska och åtgärda buggar samt förbättra systemets prestanda.
* Bidra till teamets tekniska utveckling genom omvärldsbevakning.



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* Djup erfarenhet av databasdesign, särskilt inom SQL och molnmiljöer.
* Arbetat med större databaser och förstår komplexiteten kring databasoptimering.
* Flera års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET och molnbaserade lösningar, gärna med fokus på Azure.
* Är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta i en databasintensiv miljö.
* En passion för teknik och en vilja att bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens transportlösningar.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps och GIT.
* Erfarenhet av transport- och logistikbranschen.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med IoT-system och integrationer.



  





**Varför Nobina?** 




 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsmiljö där varje dag är unik. Du får möjlighet att vara en del av ett engagerat team som ständigt arbetar med att förbättra och utveckla våra IT-tjänster. Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med engagerade kollegor. Något vi ser fram emot extra mycket i höst är vår flytt till nya kontor i Solna som kommer att erbjuda både gym och pool!

title: Project Team Manager
description:
**Project Team Manager, Schneider Electric**





 Are you passionate about leading projects and driving customer satisfaction? Schneider Electric is seeking a dedicated Project Team Manager to join our vibrant team in the Digital Power Application Center (DPAC) Nordics -
 

 Your location will be in Stockholm - Sweden or Ballerup - Denmark preferred
 

 .
 






**Your Mission:**





 In this pivotal role, you will manage customer projects and services across several states and with a diverse customer base. Project Team Manager, you’ll lead a multicultural team, ensure high-quality project execution, and maintain exceptional customer communication. Your responsibilities will include overseeing project performance, controlling P&L, and driving transformation initiatives for enhanced software, services, and sustainability.
 




**Key Responsibilities:**



* Lead and support project management teams to ensure successful execution.
* Monitor and report on project performance, including profitability and customer satisfaction.
* Conduct sensitive negotiations and maintain high-level communication with clients.
* Manage risks and opportunities within the project portfolio to ensure safety and cybersecurity.
* Foster a culture of customer focus and quality within the project teams.
* Drive transformation initiatives with a lean and agile mindset, focusing on digital growth and sustainability.
* Ensure global governance is applied within your scope.
* Build and lead diverse teams, preparing for the future by identifying critical talent.
* Provide support to project hubs as needed.



**What will help you succeed in this role?**



* Education: A Level + 5 years of relevant experience (engineering or business administration preferred).
* Experience:
 
	+ Minimum of 7 years in project management, project controller, or project-related role with international exposure in a multicultural, matrix environment.
	+ Proven leadership, with strong business acumen and finance acumen.
* Skills:
 
	+ In-depth knowledge of customer project services and trends.
	+ Exceptional team-building skills in complex environments.
	+ Excellent relationship and communication skills, especially with executives and stakeholders.
	+ Confidence to lead with agility and make decisions in uncertain situations.
	+ You are proactive, motivated, and structured in your working style and you have a hands-on approach to your work.
	+ You seek solutions to customers’ questions with a commercially driven attitude.



**What do we offer you?**





  
 





 At Schneider Electric, we are committed to fostering a vibrant and inclusive work culture where every employee is empowered to thrive. As part of our team, you can expect:
 



* **Professional Growth:**

 Access to continuous learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and career development resources to nurture your potential and drive your career forward.
* **Innovative Environment:**


 Be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that encourages creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit as we lead the way in digital transformation and sustainability.
* **Work-Life Balance:**



 We value your well-being and offer flexible work arrangements, comprehensive wellness programs, and support to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* **Global Impact:**



 Contribute to meaningful projects that address global energy challenges and sustainability, making a positive impact on the world while advancing your career.
* **Inclusive Community:**



 Join a diverse and inclusive community where your unique perspectives are celebrated, and your voice is heard, fostering an environment of collaboration, and belonging.




  
 
**Did we get you inspired?**





 Join Schneider Electric and unlock your full potential! Apply now and embark on an exciting career journey with us. Please submit your application soonest. We will fill the position as soon as a suitable candidate has been found.
 





  
 










  
 




**Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?**






 When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our  IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.
 





 IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
 





 We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.
 





 Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!
 





 €36 billion global revenue
   



 +13% organic growth
   



 150 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   



 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
 




  
 







  
 




 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
 




  
 




*Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‘inclusion’ is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do.* 





  
 




*At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here*





*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Silicon Design Data Scientist
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 Are you ready to shape the future of verification analytics at Ericsson Silicon? Join our Design Verification Methodology team and drive cutting-edge, metric-driven methodologies across our global R&D sites in Austin, Stockholm, and Lund. As part of Ericsson Silicon, a leading engineering unit developing state-of-the-art ASICs and FPGAs for Ericsson’s 5G telecommunication portfolio, you’ll have access to vast career growth opportunities and a rich knowledge base.
   

  

 In this high-impact role, you’ll combine your data science expertise with a background/ solid understanding of Hardware domain specific to ASIC IP/ASIC SoC to develop scalable metric systems and integrate AI/ML techniques for predictive analytics. Your insights will help optimize ASIC SoC health and improve workload throughput across compute clusters and EDA tools. With your contributions, you'll drive data-driven decision-making in the verification process and play a key role in shaping the future of ASIC verification. Join us and help set new standards in this exciting field!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* You will design and implement Silicon DV metric systems to track and visualize key metrics, playing a crucial role in shaping data-driven methodologies that empower silicon IP engineers, that follow:
* Coverage & Functional Coverage (pass/fail rates, closure status)
* Workload Throughput (runtime, memory usage, compute efficiency, job scaling)
* EDA Resource Utilization (license usage, peak load analysis, bottleneck detection)
* Additional KPIs to measure and track Silicon Design and Verification status
* Develop interactive dashboards for real-time monitoring of verification progress and EDA tool performance.
* Create AI/ML-driven analytics for predictive workload optimization and resource allocation insights.
* Automate data collection and transformation from EDA tools, compute clusters, and job schedulers.
* Integrate metric systems into CI/CD workflows, enabling data-driven decision-making for IP/ASIC/SoC verification teams.
* Collaborate with silicon engineers to improve compute scheduling, license efficiency, and verification throughput.
* Establish best practices for data visualization, reporting, and engineering decision support.


**Skills You Bring**
**At least 5+ years of experience overall**
* Strong expertise in data science, analytics, and visualization tools (e.g., Python, Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, Tableau, Grafana).
* Experience with EDA tool monitoring (e.g., Synopsys VCS, Cadence Xcelium, Siemens Questa, JasperGold, Verdi).
* Proficiency in SQL, NoSQL databases, and scalable data pipeline development.
* Knowledge of AI/ML frameworks for predictive analytics in EDA workloads.
* Familiarity with compute cluster resource monitoring (e.g., Slurm, LSF, Kubernetes).
* Hands-on experience with runtime and memory profiling for verification workloads.
* Understanding of CI/CD tools like Jenkins, GitLab, Docker, Kubernetes.
* Strong programming skills in Python, Bash, Perl, or similar scripting languages.
* Effective communication and ability to present data-driven insights to engineering teams.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm/ Lund]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Edward Lindenholst]]

title: PA designer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future if technology. This is the place where you’re welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent and perspective you bring to the team.
   

  

 Do you have a passion in radio and RF design? Are you in? We have several openings!
   

  

 We are now looking for an Intermediate - or a Senior Power Amplifier (PA) Designer to our growing team. We are developing PAs for Ericsson future Radio Systems. We are working on all horizons: Research, pre-development, product development as well as after-market. The amplifiers covers all applicable power levels and frequencies used for mobile narrow band and broadband applications.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* You will take part in all kinds of activities that comes with the role
* You are since several years working with power amplifiers. You could e.g. discuss with a transistor vendor, a mobile infrastructure vendor, a university or a research institute.
* You are skilled in ADS and/or AWR. If you have experience in HFSS or others it´s positive.
* You are familiar with all kinds of lab equipment. If you are used to work with load-pull equipment it´s a bonus.
* You have experience of different PA modes and architectures.
* You are familiar with transistor technology and different device vendors. You might have experience with MCM or MMIC.
* You have experience in Innovation, GaN, wideband, volume production
* If might have any kind of experience with DPD or any other linearization techniques.


**The skills you bring:**
* Education: MS in electronics or engineering physics, or PhD PA related subject
* Domain experience: Minimum 5 years within PA design
* Business understanding
* Working with people and networking
* Innovating, adapting and responding to change
* Delivering results and meeting customer expectations
* Planning and Organizing


**Additional Requirements:**
 The position is based in Stockholm Sweden, so you need to relocate to Sweden and be able to mainly work from office. Hybrid ways of working is implemented to some extent, but the Office is our main place of work.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Silicon DevOps - Jenkins Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About The Opportunity**
 We are part of Ericsson Silicon, an engineering unit specializing in the development of state-of-the-art ASICs and FPGAs targeting the latest technology nodes for Ericsson’s 5G telecommunication portfolio. This department offers extensive opportunities for career growth, along with access to a vast knowledge base that supports innovation and advancement.
   

  

 To excel in this high-visibility role, we seek individuals with a background in ASIC IP/ASIC SoC development, DevOps, and CI/CD automation. You will play a crucial role in shaping and optimizing methodologies, EDA workflows, and compute cluster efficiency, ensuring the seamless adoption of industry best practices for high-performance silicon design.
   

  

 Additionally, this role requires expertise in CI/CD automation, specifically in Jenkins review flows, timed/nightly builds, and release automation. A key focus is on integrating AI/ML techniques to optimize verification flows, improve throughput, and enhance the scalability of compute resources.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design and maintain Jenkins review flows, timed/nightly builds, and release automation for silicon development.
* Optimize EDA Workloads throughput and efficiency of compute clusters, ensuring high performance and scalability.
* Develop robust CI/CD pipelines tailored for silicon design and verification.
* Develop, deploy, and support EDA tool flows in Frontend Design & Verification.
* Implement AI/ML-driven automation for job scheduling, resource management, and verification flow optimizations.
* Identify and address inefficiencies in flow, methodology, and tooling for IP/ASIC/SoC environments.
* Collaborate with engineering teams to streamline build, test, and deployment processes.
* Ensure high availability, reliability, and security of CI/CD infrastructure.


**Skills You Bring**
**We see you have 5+years of experience overall**
* Strong expertise in Jenkins, Groovy scripting, and pipeline automation.
* Experience in DevOps for hardware/software co-design, with a focus on silicon development.
* Deep understanding of compute cluster scheduling, resource management, and optimization.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and cloud-based CI/CD solutions.
* Knowledge of AI/ML frameworks and their application in workflow optimization.
* Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Bash, etc.) for automation.
* Familiarity with Git, artifact management, and release engineering best practices.
* Hands-on experience continuous integration methodologies and AI/ML applications in DevOps.
* Effective communication and leadership in distributed engineering teams.

title: Key Account Manager
description:
**Company Description** 




 Tidypay is a leading card present-payment solution provider dedicated to empowering businesses with seamless, secure, and efficient payment processing across Europe. Specializing in SoftPOS and EMV payment solutions, Tidypay enables POS vendors to easily integrate payments into their existing systems, offering a streamlined and hassle-free experience.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full-time hybrid role for a Sales Manager at Tidypay. The Sales Manager will be responsible for day-to-day sales activities, building and maintaining client relationships, and meeting sales targets. The role is located in Stockholm, with some work from home flexibility.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Sales Strategy, Business Development, and Sales Management skills
* Client Relationship Management and Negotiation skills
* Product Knowledge and Market Analysis skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and in a team
* Experience in the fintech or payment industry



  





**Who You Are:** 




 ✔ A fearless negotiator with a knack for winning over customers
 



 ✔ A relentless sales hunter who excels at closing deals and surpassing targets
 



 ✔ A strategic thinker who envisions big ideas and a doer who executes even bigger plans that generate results
 



 ✔ A tech-savvy expert with a deep knowledge and experience selling through partner channels in the Point of Sale and Payments industry
 



 ✔ A globetrotter who loves traveling to seal international deals across Europe
 



 ✔ A challenger with a winning attitude—because here, success isn’t just celebrated, it’s expected!
 



  





  





**Why Choose Tidypay?** 




 ✔ 
 **Impact:** 
  Big enough for enterprise, small enough to care—your impact matters here!
 



 ✔ 
 **Culture:** 
  Join a team committed to excellence, ambition, and a relentless drive for success.
 



 ✔ 
 **Environment:** 
  Thrive in a setting that rewards energy, creativity, and outstanding results.
 



 ✔ 
 **Growth:** 
  Be a key player in a fast-growing company that’s making waves in the payment industry.

title: Redovisningsekonom till myndighet
description:
***Till myndighet i Stockholm söker vi nu en redovisningsekonom för ett uppdrag med start i juni 2025.***




  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Förvaltningsrättsliga avdelningen består av fyra enheter och hanterar ärenden inom miljörätt, fastighetsrätt, stiftelserätt, stämpelskatt, Sveriges indelning, registrering av trossamfund, vigselrätt, resegarantier, begravningsavgifter och fordringsbevakning. Avdelningen sköter även administrativa uppgifter åt vissa statliga nämnder.
 



  





 Vi söker en redovisningsekonom för två huvudsakliga uppgifter:
 


1. Ansvara för redovisning, inklusive inbetalningar, utbetalningar, fakturering och periodisk avstämning.
2. Stötta avdelningens chefer med budget, ekonomisk analys och prognoser.



  





 Rollen är placerad på Processenheten och innebär nära samarbete med Ekonomi- och förvaltningsavdelningen samt IT-enheten och enheten för kontorsservice.
 



  





*Läs mer om uppdraget på vår hemsida.* 




  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi ser att du uppfyller följande;
 


* Högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi eller likvärdig utbildning och minst tre (3) års arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande arbete. Alternativt, gymnasium eller likvärdig utbildning samt fem (5) års arbetslivserfarenhet som redovisningsekonom.
* Goda kunskaper i MS Office, i Excel i synnerhet. En hög digital mognad är nödvändig för att kunna genomföra uppdraget.
* Goda kunskaper i Unit4 ERP.
* Erfarenhet av statlig redovisning samt
* Kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska, såväl i tal som skrift.



  





 Arbetsuppgifterna kräver att du är drivande, stöttande, ansvarstagande, kvalitetsmedveten och strukturerad.
 



  





**Du erbjuds** 




 Ett konsultuppdrag hos vår kund i Stockholm Uppdraget förväntas starta i juni 2025 och löper tom. 2025-12-15, med eventuell förlängning. Du kommer att bli anställd av Jurek Talets och vara uthyrd till vår kund i Stockholm. Vid frågor angående tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Kajsa Lidén på kajsa.liden@jurek.se

title: Finnish Speaking Sales Development Representative
description:
**Finnish speaking Sales Development Representative (SDR)at a Fast-Growing B2B SaaS Company** 




  





 Are you a results-driven salesperson, fluent in
 **Finnish and English** 
 , and ready to take your sales career to the next level? At Tendium, you’ll have the opportunity to become a key player in our rapidly growing sales team!
 



  





 As an SDR, your role is to identify new business opportunities and book meetings with potential customers—an essential part of our continued success. With short sales cycles, a high-impact product, and no commission cap, you’ll have every opportunity to succeed! 🚀
 



  





**Who Are You?** 




 We’re looking for a driven and ambitious colleague with the right attitude. Experience is a plus, but
 **MINDSET** 
 is key!
 



  





 At Tendium, we provide the best conditions for you to develop and reach your career goals, with support from 15 experienced colleagues in the sales team and our Head of Sales along the way.
 



  





**What You Bring** 



* A goal-oriented mindset—you’re motivated to reach the top.
* Comfortable with digital platforms and quick to adapt to new tools.
* Fluency in Finnish, proficiency in English and at least a basic understanding of Swedish.
* Based in Stockholm or nearby



  





**Bonus points if you...** 



* Have experience with cold calling or using CRM tools like HubSpot.
* Have additional language skills — Swedish is especially valued, but other European languages (B2+ level and above) are a plus.
* Have previous experience in a tech company, familiarity with public procurements or an existing network in Finland are seen as advantages.



  





*This is a full-time, permanent position with a six-month probation period, base salary, and commission.* 




  





**About Tendium** 




 Tendium is an AI-driven scale-up revolutionising public procurement. We provide businesses with a smarter and easier way to participate in public tenders. At Tendium, you’ll be part of a growing team backed by strong investors. We’re an engaged, friendly, and open team where every member gets the space to grow.
 



  





**Ready for the Next Step? 💼** 




 We look forward to your application! We are hiring continuously, so apply as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, successful candidates will be asked to record
 **two short videos—one introducing yourself (in English)** 
 and another with a
 **brief pitch where you sell Tendium to us, as if we were a potential customer (in Finnish).** 




  





 To make this process even more efficient, sign in to your Connect profile and add your references at any stage.
 



  





 Please find additional information on our recruitment process here. If you want to know more about our culture and what you can expect when working at Tendium you can read more about it
 *here.* 




  





 We can’t wait to hear from you! 🚀

title: Gymnasielärare i sociologi och annat ämne till YBC gymnasium, Nacka kommun
description:
Vill du förändra världen genom undervisning i sociologi och annat ämne på gymnasiet? Vill du undervisa motiverade och engagerade elever tillsammans med mycket kompetenta kollegor på en stabil, populär och välfungerande kommunal gymnasieskola? Vill du vara med att utveckla en av Sveriges bästa gymnasieskolor när skolan växer?
   

  

 Till höstterminen 2025 fortsätter vår gymnasieskola att expandera och vi välkomnar cirka 340 elever. Därför söker vi fler engagerade lärare som vill vara med och bidra till vår utveckling. Kanske är det dig vi söker? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 I rollen som lärare undervisar du våra klasser i sociologi och annat ämne som du är behörig i. Du är ansvarig för planering, genomförande och utvärdering av undervisning i dina ämnen utifrån läroplanen. Du anpassar undervisningen utifrån elevernas behov, intressen och förutsättningar. Du följer upp, bedömer, betygsätter och dokumenterar elevers kunskapsutveckling. Du ansvarar för att skapa förtroendefulla relationer med elever, kollegor och vårdnadshavare. I uppdraget som mentor är din viktigaste uppgift att motivera elever till studier samt stärka deras självkänsla och sociala utveckling.
   

  

 Tillsammans med kollegor driver du olika projekt samt samarbetar kring elevernas lärande. Du tillhör ett team med kollegor som arbetar tillsammans med systematiskt kvalitetsarbete, övergripande skolutveckling samt utveckling av elevernas gymnasieprogram. Vidare träffar du kontinuerligt dina ämneskollegor för planering, bedömning och betygsättning.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 För denna tjänst krävs att du har:
   

  

* lärarlegitimation med ämnesbehörighet i sociologi för gymnasiet.
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska i tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att arbeta som lärare i ämnet sociologi på gymnasiet eller motsvarande nivå
* ämnesbehörighet för gymnasiet i andra ämnen än sociologi
* erfarenhet av mentorskap
* god digital kompetens med god vana av att arbeta med IT som pedagogiskt verktyg
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med specialpedagogisk verksamhet.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen som lärare hos oss är det viktigt att du både har intresse och förmåga att samarbeta, kommunicera och skapa goda relationer med elever, vårdnadshavare och kollegor. Du har ett tydligt ledarskap som skapar en trygg och strukturerad lärmiljö samt har förmågan att motivera och engagera dina elever. Du förstår att elever har olika förutsättningar och behov samt att de tar till sig kunskap och kommunicerar på olika sätt. Det gör att du anpassar ditt val av arbetssätt och verktyg efter varje elev. För att både trivas och lyckas hos oss är det även viktigt att du är kreativ och entreprenöriell. På ett nytänkande och kreativt sätt hittar du lösningar på problem, utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 YBC är en nytänkande och innovativ gymnasieskola i Sickla. Skolan har cirka 850 elever uppdelade på tre program; ekonomi, naturvetenskap och samhällsvetenskap. Till hösten 2025 ska skolan växa och ha cirka 1000 elever, dessutom startar vi upp en specialpedagogisk verksamhet med inriktning ekonomi. Vi är en modern skola med en mycket god digital infrastruktur samt väldigt ändamålsenliga och fina lokaler. Vår undervisning grundar sig i skolans vision om att vi vill förändra världen. Visionen är levande i hela vår verksamhet. Våra ledord kreativitet och entreprenörskap uttrycks genom arbete med socialt entreprenörskap i alla årskurser och på alla program. Vi är en Erasmusackrediterad skola vilket innebär att vi arbetar i många olika internationella projekt och samarbeten.
   

  

 Som lärare hos oss erbjuder vi dig en mycket stimulerande och utvecklingsorienterad arbetsplats med motiverade, duktiga och intresserade elever samt kompetenta och drivna kollegor. Vi har en väl utvecklad samarbetskultur samt erbjuder en mentor till nyanställda lärare. Här får du stor möjlighet att påverka och utveckla din roll och undervisning utifrån kunskap, erfarenhet och intresse. Hos oss kommer du till en växande, stabil, trygg, populär och välfungerande kommunal gymnasieskola där såväl elever som kollegor trivs och lär sig av varandra. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Som anställd i Nacka kommun har du bland annat tillgång till förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag på 3 000 kr per år, köp av SL-kort via nettolöneavdrag och en mångsidig intern stödfunktion. I Nacka får du möjlighet att arbeta i en kommun som vill vara bäst i Sverige på att vara kommun, och som har öppenhet och mångfald som sin vision och en grundläggande värdering att lita på människors kunskap, vilja och förmåga.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Om du vill bli en del av Nacka kommun, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan! Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta biträdande rektor Fredrik Lindvall Dejert på 08-718 96 57 och fredrik.lindvall-dejert@nacka.se.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan!
   

  

**I rekryteringen har vi valt att rekrytera utan personligt brev** 
 . Vid bedömningen av din ansökan utgår vi endast ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor som du får besvara i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

**Tester kan komma att tillämpas**
**Utdrag ur Polisens belastningsregister för skola och förskola krävs** 
 i samband med anställning. Vi ber dig att välja "digitalt registerutdrag" för snabbare hantering. Länk här.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering.
   

  

 Besök gärna Nackas kommunala skolor och förskolors karriärsida här
   

  

 Nacka är en av Sveriges mest attraktiva och välrenommerade kommuner. Med fokus på mål, resultat, hållbart medarbetarengagemang och ständig utveckling strävar Nacka efter att bli bäst på att vara kommun. Nacka kommun är arbetsgivaren för dig som med stor frihet förnyar och gör skillnad.
   

  

 YBC (Young Business Creatives) är en gymnasieskola som ligger i Kunskapsgallerian i Sickla köpkvarter. Skolan har ungefär 730 elever på fyra program, ekonomi-, naturvetenskaps-, samhällsvetenskaps- och introduktionsprogrammets språkintroduktion. YBC är en mycket populär och stabil skola för både elever och personal. Skolans vision är att vi ska förändra världen
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: Heltid (provanställning kan komma att tillämpas). | Ort: Nacka | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/134 | Kontakt: Fredrik Lindvall Dejert +4687189657, | Facklig företrädare: Sveriges lärare, Mikael Eriksson mikael.eriksson@nacka.se, | Publicerat: 2025-03-05 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-19

title: Trainee #2
description:
**ARE YOU READY FOR A CHALLENGE?** 




 Every day is game day at WeSports Group! We are looking for the next star to join our team – someone who will push boundaries, challenge us to improve, and help us perform better every day. But, most importantly – eager to learn and grow.
 



  





**ROLE DESCRIPTION** 




 As a trainee at WeSports Group, you will work closely with group management and subsidiaries on M&A and business development projects. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in building billion-kronor businesses. It requires a balance of entrepreneurship and financial acumen, making it an ideal stepping stone for those looking to develop a career in M&A and business.
 



  





 We are looking for candidates who are about to graduate or have recently graduated with a BSc or MSc in a business-related field. This is a full-time position starting after summer 2025, with the duration of one year.
 



  





**PROFILE** 




 The perfect candidates are entrepreneurial individuals who are eager to take on new challenges and consistently exceed goals. You are financially literate and have a strong, genuine interest in the combination of M&A and business development. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy problem-solving, and are excited by the opportunity to create value through acquisitions and organic growth.
 


* Strong ability to manage high workloads and concurrent projects
* High proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
* Proven strong academic record
* Fluency in Swedish and English (additional languages are a plus)



  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO** 



* Participate in M&A activities, including sourcing, financial analysis and due diligence, while gaining valuable insights from senior decision-makers
* Lead and contribute to business development projects at both the group level and within group companies
* Be a key part of an ambitious growth journey, where your personal and professional development sees no limits
* You will work most closely with Group COO Niklas Hammar, who leads the trainee program, along with the Group CEO and CFO, while also taking on project-based placements within group companies



  





**LOCATION** 




 WeSports Group’s main office is located in central Malmö, with plans to establish a Stockholm office H2 2025.
 



  





 Trainee #1 completed the program while studying at the Stockholm School of Economics, working remotely with regular in-person meetings with the Stockholm-based management team. Since WeSports Group did not have an office in Stockholm at the time, he collaborated closely with the team through a flexible work setup.
 



  





 We welcome applications from candidates based in Malmö or Stockholm, with a willingness to relocate temporarily to different business units as needed. While we prefer candidates who have already graduated, we remain flexible on this requirement.
 



  





**CONTACT & QUESTIONS** 




 Please feel free to reach out for any questions you may have:
 



  





 Niklas Hammar, COO
 



 niklas.hammar@wesportsgroup.com / +46707440299
 



  





 August Höglund, Trainee #1
 



 august.hoglund@wesportsgroup.com / +46736335930
 



  





**APPLICATION** 




 Email motivation letter and resume to info@wesportsgroup.com at latest 30/4. Mark email with name and “Trainee #2”.
 



  





 Read more about the role here: www.wesports.se/trainee-2
 



  





**ABOUT WESPORTS GROUP** 




 WeSports Group is a Nordic sports equipment specialist group. We are leaders in our key categories Bikes & Mobility, Running & Outdoor, and Training & Team Sports – and strive for expansion in further sports and lifestyle areas. WeSports Group target elite athletes and active individuals through online- and physical stores, while distributing own- and external brands.
 



  





 We acquire and develop specialist companies, allowing them to operate independently, within a decentralized structure, and take advantage of shared infrastructure and strategic support.
 



 In 2024, WeSports Group achieved a proforma turnover of 2.5 billion SEK, driven by strong organic growth and solid profitability.
 



  





 Read more about WeSports Group: www.wesports.se

title: Juriststudent till Studentpoolen på Next Advokater
description:
**Vill du kombinera dina studier med praktisk erfarenhet på en välrenommerad advokatbyrå? Vi söker en ansvarsfull och engagerad juriststudent som vill arbeta deltid i vår studentpool.** 




  





**Om Next Advokater:** 





 Next är en specialistbyrå med svensk och internationell affärsjuridisk inriktning.
 





 Next erbjuder affärsjuridisk specialistkompetens inom avtalsrätt, arbetsrätt, bank och finans, bolags- och aktiemarknadsrätt, entreprenadrätt, IT- och immaterialrätt liksom M&A och tvistlösning. Byråns äkta true partnership-modell innebär att varje uppdrag hamnar hos den person som är mest lämpad för uppdraget. Vi erbjuder en personlig kontakt med ansvarig delägare samtidigt som vi har korta vägar till övriga specialister. Vi har ofta långvariga klientrelationer och därigenom kan vi ge genuint kundanpassade råd.
 





 Som den enda svenska affärsjuridiska advokatbyrån tillhör Next det internationella nätverket Lawyers Associated Worldwide (”LAW”) som har 100 medlemsbyråer i mer än 50 länder. Vi har en personlig kontakt med medlemsbyråerna och samarbetar i flera ärenden. Genom LAW kan vi tillgodose att våra klienter får kvalificerad juridisk rådgivning över hela världen.
 




  





**Om tjänsten:** 







 Som juriststudent i vår studentpool kommer du att arbeta med ett brett spektrum av arbetsuppgifter som stödjer vårt team av erfarna jurister och andra medarbetare. Tjänsten är en fantastisk möjlighet för dig som vill utveckla dina kunskaper inom juridik och administration samtidigt som du får en inblick i arbetet på en advokatbyrå.
 




  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:** 



* Förbereda möten utifrån kalenderbokningar
* Ta emot och välkomna besökare
* Hantera leveranser, exempelvis beställningar och paketmottagning
* Budhantering
* Utföra administrativa uppgifter och enklare rättsutredningar
* Skriva PM och hjälpa till med rättsliga dokument
* Kommunicera och följa upp med myndigheter och andra externa aktörer



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Studerar till jurist vid universitet och har ett intresse för juridiskt arbete
* Är noggrann, strukturerad och serviceinriktad
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* Är flexibel och har ett professionellt bemötande i alla situationer
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* En möjlighet att arbeta på en dynamisk och professionell advokatbyrå
* En flexibel och lärorik arbetsmiljö där du får chansen att utvecklas inom både juridik och administration
* En viktig roll i ett stöttande och kompetent team
* Konkurrensmässig ersättning och möjlighet till längre samarbete



  





**Placering:** 

 Centrala Stockholm
 




**Omfattning:** 

 Deltid, ca en dag i veckan
 




  






 Låter detta som en spännande möjlighet för dig? Skicka in din ansökan tillsammans med CV, personligt brev och betyg från juristprogrammet till
 
**projektledare@nextlaw.se** 

 senast den
 
**20 april 2025** 

 . Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Platform Engineer (.NET) - Remote
description:
Everything we do is powered by our customers! Featured on Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 list and G2's leaderboard, Maropost offers a connected experience that our customers anticipate, transforming marketing, merchandising, and operations with commerce tools designed to scale with fast-growing businesses. With a relentless focus on our customers’ success, we are motivated by curiosity, creativity, and collaboration to power 5,000+ global brands.



Driven by a customer-first mentality, we empower businesses to achieve their goals and grow alongside us. If you're ready to make a significant impact and be part of our transformative journey, Maropost is the place for you.



Become a part of Maropost today and help shape the future of commerce!



âÂÂ€¯

  


**About The Position:**



As a **Senior Platform Engineer**, you will play a crucial role in developing, maintaining, and optimizing our .NET-based applications. Your expertise in .NET development, code refactoring, and experience with both Linux and Windows environments will be essential. Additionally, your exposure to various open-source databases, cloud platforms like Azure and GCP, and experience with DevOps tooling will contribute to the success of our platform.

  



The role will be based in Europe. Core working hours for this role are 9:00am-5:00pm CET ( +/-2 hours).

 **What You'll Be Responsible For:**


* Work with .NET code/framework to develop and maintain applications running on Windows machines.
* Refactor code and identify/resolve bugs to improve application performance and functionality.
* Utilize experience working on both Linux and Windows-based machines to ensure compatibility and smooth operation of applications.
* Analyze and upgrade core API microservices from .NET Core 3.1 to .NET 8, ensuring successful builds and addressing any potential errors during the upgrade process.
* Develop and maintain Windows services, ensuring their reliability and efficient operation.
* Refactor and develop efforts for upgrading the Backoffice application from the old ASP .NET Web Forms framework to a higher version, addressing code compatibility and functionality improvements.
* Collaborate with team members to analyze and assess the scope of refactoring and development efforts for upgrading applications using Microsoft Assistant tools and Microsoft Planner.
* Utilize experience with Azure and GCP to deploy and manage applications on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and reliability.

  


**What You'll Bring to Maropost:**


* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
* 8+ years in .NET development, with proficiency in working with .NET code/framework.
* Experience with code refactoring and bug fixing to improve application performance and functionality.
* Ability to work on both Linux and Windows-based machines.
* Exposure to various open-source databases for data storage and management.
* Experience working on different cloud platforms, primarily Azure and GCP.
* Deep understanding of Azure-based services and DevOps tooling for building and deploying .NET applications.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with team members.

  


**Preferred:**


* 10+ years in .NET development, with proficiency in working with .NET code/framework.
* In-depth knowledge in architecting and optimizing large-scale .NET applications.
* Familiarity with distributed systems and message queuing systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes and writing YAML manifests for deployment and configuration management.
* Experience with monitoring and observability tools.
* Familiarity with network security concepts.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* 3+ years of experience in developing and maintaining Windows services for .NET applications.
* Hands-on experience of at least 3 years in designing and implementing backup and disaster recovery solutions for Windows-based environments.
* Proficiency of at least 3 years in writing and maintaining automation scripts for Windows-based infrastructure tasks.
* Previous involvement of at least 2 years in setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for .NET applications.
* Direct experience of at least 3 years with Windows system administration and troubleshooting.
* Practical knowledge of at least 2 years in managing Windows-based servers and services.
* Demonstrated experience of at least 2 years in configuring and utilizing monitoring and observability tools effectively in Windows environments.
* Proficient for at least 3 years in optimizing database performance through advanced indexing strategies, query optimization, and tuning methodologies in Windows-based databases.
* Previous exposure of at least 2 years to Windows-based distributed systems and message queuing systems.
* Hands-on experience of at least 2 years with Windows-based network security tools and concepts, including firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention systems.

  


**Equal Employment Opportunist:âÂÂ€¯âÂÂ€¯âÂÂ€¯**



Maropost is deeply committed to promoting diversity, advancing equity and fostering a culture of inclusion. Therefore, we invite applications from marginalized and equity-seeking groups. Individuals seeking employment at Maropost are considered without regards to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please feel free to reach out to the recruitment team for any accommodation requests or questions.

title: Cloud Specialist
description:
Want to embark on a new career journey where you can shape the way IaaS and CaaS services are provided?


I'm Giovanni Mumolo, head of Network Cloud SW development, and I'm searching for a **Cloud Specialist** to join my team. My team is located in Finland and Sweden and is consist of a group of individuals sharing a passion for technology and learning.


**As a Cloud Specialist, you’ll...**

**Manage configurations for cloud services and applications** to ensure they meet current requirements.


You’ll **monitor the status and performance of our cloud infrastructure** to prevent issues as well as perform routine security checks and audits to ensure compliance to our security guidelines.


One of the responsibilities will also be taking care of and updating technical and process documentation, working with cloud operations and tenant team to resolve any cloud issues that eventually arise.


The position includes collaborating with cloud teams to discuss improvements and stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in cloud computing and telecommunications.  

  



**Who we're looking for**

Someone with experience working in **a Linux administrator, DevOps Engineer or similar position** . Knowledge of either **Ansible or Terraform** and Gitlab is essential to the role.


**Scripting skills** (Bash and Python) and experience working with **monitoring & logging solutions** (Prometheus, Grafana or similar) are also required.


Knowledge of public cloud platforms would be considered as an advantage.


The ideal candidate for this position is someone with willingness to continuously learn new tools/technologies, and good communication skills for working with both other teams and stakeholders.


**We are more than a workplace**  

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.  



  

**Ready to make better happen?**

We are looking forward to your application by **2025-04-25** . If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by either the Hiring Manager or our Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
  

  

If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at giovanni.mumolo@teliacompany.com .  

  



**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**

  


Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv **with high ambitions.**


**As a Senior Engineering Manager**, you will lead a team of Android, Backend, and QA engineers within the calling team, and will work closely with the VP of Engineering on company-wide engineering initiatives.


**The impact you will create:**


* Manage and lead Android, Backend, and QA engineers within the Calling business unit.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to the engineering team.
* Mentor and develop team members.
* Participate in strategic planning and decision-making for the engineering team (including conducting technical design reviews)
* Drive continuous improvement in processes and technologies.
* Collaborate closely with the business unit lead to align engineering initiatives with overall business objectives and strategies. This involves:
* Regular meetings to discuss progress, challenges, and upcoming priorities
* Jointly defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success
* Ensuring that engineering solutions meet the specific needs of the business unit
* Proactively identifying and addressing potential risks and dependencies
* Fostering a strong working relationship based on open communication and trust
* Collaborate closely with the VP of Engineering to identify and drive horizontal engineering initiatives that span multiple teams or departments. This may include:
* Establishing and promoting standard engineering practices and processes.
* Leading cross-functional projects to solve complex technical challenges.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities to leverage shared technologies and resources.
* Fostering a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing across engineering teams.
* Ensure high-quality software delivery and adherence to best practices.


**What you bring in:**


* Proven leadership experience in managing and mentoring engineering teams, preferably in mobile app development.
* Strong technical background in either Android development or with backend systems (JVM based, or similar).
* Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and ability to drive efficient development workflows.
* Solid understanding of mobile CI/CD pipelines and release management.
* Experience in working with QA teams to implement automated and manual testing strategies.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions (Product, Design, DevOps).
* Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality software in a fast-paced environment.
  


**It would be great if you also have:**


* Knowledge of performance optimization for Android applications.
* Experience with security best practices for mobile applications.
* Exposure to cross-platform development (Flutter/React Native).
* Prior experience in hiring and scaling mobile engineering teams.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and mobile observability tools.

  


**Sounds like your dream job?**



We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.



**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**



We only accept applications **in English**.


**What we offer:**


* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package**: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
  

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: DevOps Engineer Lead
description:
**Vi söker en driven och erfaren** **DevOps Engineer Lead**  

Är du en engagerad ledare med passion för DevOps, automation och teknisk innovation? Vill du vara med och stärka kopplingen mellan utveckling och drift i en dynamisk och säkerhetsfokuserad miljö? Då vill vi gärna höra från dig!  

  



**Om rollen**  

Som DevOps Engineer Lead kommer du att spela en central roll i att leda och vidareutveckla våra DevOps-initiativ. Du ansvarar för att skapa och förbättra CI/CD-pipelines, säkerställa en smidig distribution av våra applikationer samt övervaka och optimera vår infrastruktur. Rollen innebär också att arbeta tvärfunktionellt med andra team för att förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser och kundmiljöer. Särskilt fokus ligger på Azure PaaS-tjänster och modern infrastrukturarkitektur.  

  



**Arbetsuppgifter**


* Mentorskap och utbildning av teammedlemmar i DevOps-principer
* Ledning och koordinering av DevOps-teamets arbete
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att öka release-frekvens och stabilitet
* Designa och implementera skalbara lösningar för molnbaserade tjänster, särskilt inom Azure PaaS
* Utnyttja och utveckla Infrastructure as Code med fokus på Bicep och Terraform
* Utvärdera och införa nya DevOps-verktyg och teknologier
* Övervakning och optimering av infrastrukturell prestanda och säkerhet
* Skapa, utveckla och förvalta kundmiljöer i Azure
* Säkerställa en effektiv och framtidssäker arkitektur i molnet

**Kompetenskrav**
  

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:


* Minst fem års erfarenhet inom DevOps och infrastrukturarbete
* Erfarenhet att leda och förbättra arbetssätt
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta och leda inom Agile/Scrum
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps och Infrastructure as code, Bicip och Teraform.
* Erfarenhet av arbetet med Azure
* Erfarenhet av container-teknologier som Azure Kubernetes Service,
* Förmåga att lösa komplexa problem och tänka strategiskt

**Vi erbjuder**
  

Hos oss får du chansen att växa i en dynamisk och inkluderande miljö. Vi värderar vår personal högt och erbjuder:


* En hybrid arbetsplats där flexibilitet är en självklarhet
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och utbildning
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag och andra attraktiva förmåner

Ett starkt kollegialt sammanhang med fokus på samarbete och innovation  

* 

**Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total?**


IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder.  

  

**Vi erbjuder:**

* En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
* Hybrid arbetsplats
* Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
* Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
* Fredagsfika tillsammans
* Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
* Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
* Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
* ‍‍ Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig
* Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**  

  

**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**  

Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:  

Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total  

Mail: kajsa.jordansson@it-total.se
  

Tel: 070 -729 19 82
