 I'm Giovanni Mumolo, head of Network Cloud SW development, and I'm searching for a
 **Cloud Specialist** 
 to join my team. My team is located in Finland and Sweden and is consist of a group of individuals sharing a passion for technology and learning.
   

  

**As a Cloud Specialist, you’ll...**
**Manage configurations for cloud services and applications** 
 to ensure they meet current requirements.
   

  

 You’ll
 **monitor the status and performance of our cloud infrastructure** 
 to prevent issues as well as perform routine security checks and audits to ensure compliance to our security guidelines.
   

  

 One of the responsibilities will also be taking care of and updating technical and process documentation, working with cloud operations and tenant team to resolve any cloud issues that eventually arise.
   

  

 The position includes collaborating with cloud teams to discuss improvements and stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in cloud computing and telecommunications.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 Someone with experience working in
 **a Linux administrator, DevOps Engineer or similar position** 
 . Knowledge of either
 **Ansible or Terraform** 
 and Gitlab is essential to the role.
   

  

**Scripting skills** 
 (Bash and Python) and experience working with
 **monitoring & logging solutions** 
 (Prometheus, Grafana or similar) are also required.
   

  

 Knowledge of public cloud platforms would be considered as an advantage.
   

  

 The ideal candidate for this position is someone with willingness to continuously learn new tools/technologies, and good communication skills for working with both other teams and stakeholders.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by
 **2025-04-25** 
 . If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by either the Hiring Manager or our Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at giovanni.mumolo@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: Senior Cloud Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
**We are looking for a**
**Senior Cloud Engineer (m/f/d)**
**(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Oslo, Verl or Baden-Baden – flexible working conditions available**
 Are you passionate about shaping the future of data engineering and cloud platforms? Do you thrive in an agile environment, ready to take on challenges with a can-do attitude? If you're a talented Senior Cloud Engineer with a strong interest in data and a drive to innovate, we want you to join our team!
   

  

 As a Senior Cloud Engineer in our Data & Analytics department, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining our cutting-edge cloud data platform. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy scalable solutions that enable efficient data processing, storage, and analysis. Your contributions will drive insights and decision-making across the organization.
   

  

**These will be your challenges and tasks:**
* Collaborate with product owners, data scientists, and other engineers to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions
* Design, develop, and deploy cloud-based data engineering solutions using tools like Databricks, Python, SQL, and Terraform
* Implement data pipelines for ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance
* Optimize data storage and retrieval mechanisms to support diverse analytical workloads
* Implement monitoring and logging solutions to ensure the health and performance of the data platform
* Work in an agile environment, participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and sprint reviews
* Contribute to code reviews, share knowledge, mentor junior team members and stay updated on cloud computing and data engineering trends as well as best practices


**How you will be successful in this role:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* 8+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on cloud-based solutions
* Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and experience with version control systems like Git
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (especially Azure, AWS or GCP also relevant) and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform
* Experience with data engineering tools and frameworks, particularly Databricks
* Solid understanding of data management principles, data modeling, and data warehousing concepts and a desire to contribute to building innovative data solutions
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
* Agile mindset with a proactive and adaptable approach to challenges
* Exceptional communication skills in English, both written and verbal, German is a plus


**Nice to haves:**
* We would be especially excited if you have any of the following (but we’re also excited if you come learn with us):
* Experience with big data technologies such as Spark or Kafka
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of machine learning and data science concepts
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks


 #EUR15
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: Cloud Engineer - Infrastruktur i Azure & IAM
description:
Centric söker en erfaren Cloud Engineer till vår kund i Stockholm för att stärka deras IT-infrastrukturteam. Rollen fokuserar på att designa, implementera och underhålla Azure-plattformar och IAM-lösningar i en hybrid IT-miljö. Du kommer att arbeta med säkerhet, nätverk och virtualisering samt bidra till strategier för en stabil och motståndskraftig IT-drift.
   

  

 Rollen kräver problemlösningsförmåga, samarbete med externa leverantörer och deltagande i tvärfunktionella projekt. Placering är i Stockholm med viss möjlighet till distansarbete enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Rollen som Cloud Engineer innebär att arbeta med IT-infrastruktur med fokus på Azure och IAM-lösningar. Du kommer att designa, implementera och hantera funktioner och tjänster i Azure, administrera IAM-plattformar, felsöka problem och säkerställa efterlevnad av säkerhetspolicys. Arbetet inkluderar även samarbete med externa leverantörer, deltagande i tvärfunktionella projekt samt vägledning och support till kollegor i en hybrid miljö.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer**
* Examen inom relevant område eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete med Azure och molntjänster
* Certifiering inom Microsoft Azure, t.ex. Azure Solutions Architect Expert eller Azure Security Engineer
* Starka kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av Compute, Networking, Storage, Identity och Security i Azure
* Goda kunskaper inom Entra ID och Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av autentiseringsmetoder (Kerberos, SAMLv2, OpenID-Connect)
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och hantera Conditional Access-policys
* Kunskap om kostnadskontroll i Azure
* Erfarenhet av IaaS, PaaS och SaaS
* Erfarenhet av hybridmoln- och on-prem infrastruktur
* Affärsorienterad och lösningsfokuserad med analytiskt tänkande
* Förmåga att identifiera och implementera nya lösningar
* Stark lagspelare med god relationsbyggande förmåga


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi sätter stort värde på att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande och roliga aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under trevliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, och med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Retail and Retail Apparel and Fashion
description:
**\*\* This is a 5-month contract position.** 




  





**Job Responsibilities** 




  




* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize, and support existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
* Design and implement efficient data models, data pipelines that support analytical requirements



  





**Required Skills and Experience** 




  




* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Good understanding of different data modeling techniques and trade-off
* Knowledge of ETL processes and tool
* Experience in data centric and API programming (for automation) using one of more programming languages Python, Java /or Scala
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases
* Experience in different data formats (Avro, Parquet)
* Experience in working with data visualization tools
* Experience in GCP tools – Cloud Function, Dataflow, Dataproc, and Bigquery
* Experience in data processing framework – Beam, Spark, Hive, Flink
* Have a collaborative and co-creative mindset with excellent communication skills
* Motivated to work in an environment that allows you to work and take decisions independently

title: Security Engineer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Security Engineer.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Security Engineer at Flower, you will play an important role in further safeguarding our systems and operations. Collaborating closely with the Security Office, Engineering Office, and individual tech teams, you will ensure that our infrastructure is both secure and aligned with industry best practices. You will help the company proactively prevent potential issues while effectively detecting and responding to any incidents that might occur. You will serve as a knowledgeable resource for colleagues and make sure Flower has the necessary insights and processes in place to address both current and upcoming security threats. You will have the possibility to shape the role according to your interests while making a meaningful impact on the security of the organization.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Implement and manage both static and dynamic code analysis tools to identify vulnerabilities and ensure code quality.
* Design and implement improvements to secure build and deployment processes, reducing risks in software delivery.
* Develop detection rules and alerts, and create streamlined incident response processes to address security threats effectively.
* Review, refine, and enforce best practices for infrastructure configurations to ensure robust security.
* Support engineers in adopting secure coding principles throughout the software development life cycle, emphasizing a shift-left security approach.
* Analyze code and system designs for vulnerabilities, ensuring adherence to security standards.
* Identify and prioritize initiatives to enhance the security posture of the organization.


**Who You Are**
* You are driven by the mission of protecting critical software and infrastructure, always staying one step ahead of emerging threats.
* You have a strong passion for automation and hands-on experience implementing DevSecOps practices.
* You have proven experience securing cloud infrastructure and are well-versed in established security frameworks and standards.
* You are skilled in one or more programming or scripting languages, such as Python, Go, JavaScript, SQL, or Bash.
* You take initiative, drive projects, and see your work through from start to finish.
* You are fluent in English and can clearly convey technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* You work well with others and are able to collaborate across an organization.
* You bring at least 3 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
* You hold at least a bachelor’s degree in IT, computer science, or equivalent practical experience. We also want you to to have advanced education or training in security.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, our Security officer, COO and CEO.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Lead DevOps Engineer - Svea Solar
description:
Svea Solar is one of Sweden’s leading energy tech companies. Our mission is simple: to rid the planet of fossil fuels! To bring this mission to life, we are looking for a
 **Lead DevOps Engineer.**
 The role
   

  

 As our
 **Lead DevOps Engineer** 
 you’ll be responsible for setting up and managing our
 **AWS** 
 platform with full
 **ownership** 
 of the structure of our
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 . You’ll be part of a small, agile development tech organization with three cross-functional teams and report directly to our Head of Engineering Danny Hajj.
   

  

 The role includes:
   

  

* Responsibility over our AWS plattform
* Working with CI/CD, testing, and automation
* Taking ownership and managing our Kubernetes clusters to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
* Engage in close collaboration with our developers, actively participating in meetings to understand their needs and support their success.
* Support developers by educating them on the platform, driving learning, and developing platform services to enhance their workflow.


 Are we a match?
   

  

 To thrive at Svea Solar we think it's important that our values correlates with your own since they are the guiding stars that help us move forward.
   

  

**For you to succeed in the role, we believe you should:**
* Have multiple years’ experience working with cloud-native CI/CD workflows and tools.
* Have knowledge of the full software development life cycle and delivery using agile practices.
* Hands-on experience with microservices and distributed application architecture, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology.
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code, using AWS CDK, CloudFormation, or other tools.


**If you also have at least two of the following, we are sure we would be a good match:**
* Experience in code development in at least one object-oriented programming language.
* Experience with automating cloud-native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure.
* Experience with self-hosted Grafana observability stack


 At Svea Solar we believe in Collaboration-first mentality which is why we work three days at the office to share ideas and better collaborate between the teams.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Svea Solar, we promote diversity and inclusion, as different perspectives drive innovation. Here, you will have the opportunity to grow professionally and contribute to the energy solutions of the future. As part of our team, you will play an important role in "The Power Shift" towards a greener future, focusing on teamwork, growth, and a fun working environment. 🌱🌞
   

  

**Svea Solar – More Than Just Solar Panels**
 Svea Solar is not only a leader in solar panel installations, but we also aim to be a long-term energy partner for our customers. We offer a broad product portfolio with smart solutions that enable our customers to optimize their energy usage. Our offerings include
 **heat pumps in collaboration with IKEA** 
 , electric vehicle chargers, batteries, electricity contracts, and our own
 **energy optimization software (VPP)** 
 . We are continuously working to develop new solutions that make a difference — both for our customers and for the climate.
   

  

**Application**
* We will start reviewing applications immediately, so don’t wait to apply!
* On this page, you will find more information about our recruitment processes.
* For the final candidate, we conduct a background check on criminal records.

title: Platform Engineer (Stockholm) - Sweden
description:
**Join Elisa Polystar: Build the Future of Telecom with Us**
 At
 **Elisa Polystar** 
 , we’re innovators shaping the future of telecom. As a proud subsidiary of
 **Elisa Plc** 
 , we’re on a mission to drive sustainability through cutting-edge digital solutions.
   

  

 We’re passionate about innovation and continuous improvement. As a member of our dynamic
 **Infrastructure Platform** 
**team** 
 , you and your colleagues will be
 **instrumental** 
 in the
 **evolution** 
 of our Infrastructure Platform—all while thriving in a creative, technology-intensive environment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Automate & Optimize – Enhance, secure and maintain our platform environments, ensuring our CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes run seamlessly.
* Innovate & Integrate – Develop and refine system integration solutions, leveraging Kubernetes, Linux, Python, and Go to meet evolving business challenges.
* Collaborate & Share – Work in a cross-functional team, sharing your expertise and learning from others in a supportive, change-driven culture.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Hands-On Experience with Kubernetes & Linux & Security – Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and Linux. Knowledge of best secure practices for platform development.
* Programming Savvy – Proficiency in Python/Go and Ansible.
* Deployment & CI/CD Expertise – Solid understanding of build pipelines, automation frameworks, and version control systems (GitHub, FluxCD, Jenkins & GitHub Actions).
* Team Player with Humility – You’re collaborative, eager to share knowledge, and ready to take initiative.
* Bonus Points – Familiarity with cloud providers (e.g. AWS, GCP)


**Why Elisa Polystar?**
* Hybrid & Flexible Work – Balance office and remote work as it suits you.
* Growth-Oriented Culture – Being part of Elisa group, we support your learning and career development.
* Be Part of Telecom innovators – Help shape the future of the industry.


 Interested? Please apply by
 **Friday, March 21st** 
 ! We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Note that the final candidate will be subject to a background check.
   

  

 Apply

title: Platform Success Engineer - OpenShift
description:
Vill du vara med och driva Sveriges energiomställning som Platform Success Engineer - OpenShift?
   

  

 Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. För att möta framtidens utmaningar bygger vi en robust och innovativ infrastruktur där vår OpenShift-plattform spelar en central roll. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
   

  

 Vi är i dag ca 600 personer på IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer. Vi söker nu en
 **Platform Success Engineer - OpenShift** 
 till vår enhet "containerteknik och drift", för att stötta våra utvecklingsteam och övrig verksamhet att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som Platform Success Engineer - OpenShift har du en nyckelroll i att stödja våra interna utvecklingsteam och intressenter inom verksamheten i deras resa att implementera och optimera sina lösningar eller färdiga system på plattformen. Genom att kombinera din tekniska expertis med din pedagogiska och kundorienterade approach hjälper du dem att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam och intressenter för att sätta upp och optimera deployment-processer, automatisera arbetsflöden och stöttar utvecklare med containerisering och applikationsoptimering. Genom att bygga relationer och skapa långsiktigt värde stärker du teamens förmåga att arbeta självständigt och skapar en utvecklingsmiljö som främjar effektivitet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**
* Stötta utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter i att integrera sina applikationer och arbetsflöden på OpenShift-plattformen.
* Hjälpa till med att sätta upp och optimera deployment av applikationer och CI/CD-pipelines för plattformen.
* Automatisera installation, deployment och livscykelhantering för applikationer och plattformen.
* Agera teknisk rådgivare och bygga relationer med intressenter inom Kubernetes och omkringliggande teknologier.
* Fokusera på kunskapsöverföring och utbildning för att utvecklingsteamen ska bli självgående.


**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig med teknisk erfarenhet och kompetens i kombination med en stark kommunikativ förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad, arbetar strukturerat och hjälper utvecklingsteamen att bli självständiga. Din nyfikenhet och vetgirighet gör att du håller dig uppdaterad och kan vägleda utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential. Dessa egenskaper lägger grunden för det goda samarbetet som är centralt för vår teamdynamik. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du har utbildning inom datasystemvetenskap, systemutveckling eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Du har även:
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av tekniskt arbete med enterprise Kubernetes-lösningar, OpenShift, inklusive installation, konfiguration och drift av OpenShift-kluster.
* Flerårig praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps-metodik, inklusive CI/CD-pipelines och automation av driftprocesser.
* Djup förståelse för infrastruktur, nätverk och lagringsbehov i medelstora till stora on-premise-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap och förmåga att förklara både tekniska och icke-tekniska komplexa koncept för olika målgrupper vid införandet av containerplattformar.
* Förmåga att skapa långsiktiga relationer med användare genom utbildning, teknisk support, felsökning och uppföljning.


 Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Certifieringar som CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) eller Red Hat OpenShift Administrator/Developer.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg inom OpenShift-ekosystemet, som exempelvis Helm, Operators, Prometheus eller Grafana.
* Kunskap om loggning och övervakning samt erfarenhet av datalager som PostgreSQL och Kafka.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg, Stockholm.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-04-14. Vi använder urvalsfrågor och tar därför inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, beredskap kan komma att ingå.


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anki Snis, anki.snis@se.experis.com eller Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät, maria.sahlen2@svk.se. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se

title: Teknisk Testare till Bliwa!
description:
*Vill du arbeta i en central roll där du säkerställer kvaliteten i systemutveckling genom testautomation och tekniska tester? Brinner du för att skapa effektiva testprocesser och bidra till en spännande transformation inom försäkringssystem? Sök då rollen som Teknisk Testare till Bliwa!*
**Din Vardag**
 Som Teknisk Testare hos Bliwa blir du en nyckelspelare i deras systemutveckling. Du arbetar tätt med utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att system och integrationer håller hög kvalitet. I takt med att Bliwa byter försäkringssystem och moderniserar IT-miljön kommer du att ha en viktig roll i att bygga upp testautomatisering och effektivisera deras testprocesser.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att utveckla och underhålla automatiserade tester, genomföra API- och databastester samt arbeta med integrationstester i en agil utvecklingsmiljö. Rollen innebär också analys av testresultat, optimering av teststrategier och säkerställa att systemen är stabila och funktionella innan produktionssättning.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Utveckla och underhålla automatiserade tester med verktyg som Cypress eller Selenium.
* Skapa och genomföra API-tester med verktyg som Postman, Swagger eller Ready API.
* Testa systemintegrationer och säkerställa kvalitet i molnbaserade IT-miljö.
* Analysera testresultat och identifiera förbättringsområden.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att optimera teststrategier och processer.


**Vem är du?**
 För att passa för rollen tror vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av testning med fokus på automatiserade tester.
* Erfarenhet av testautomatiseringsverktyg såsom Cypress eller Selenium.
* Kunskap inom API-testning och verktyg som Swagger, Postman eller Ready API.
* Förståelse för testning i molnmiljö.
* Erfarenhet av databashantering, SQL och gärna Entity Framework.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och verktyg som Azure DevOps.


 Som person är du kvalitetsmedveten, noggrann och analytisk. Du vågar lyfta problem, ifrågasätta processer och bidra med lösningar. Vidare är du en samarbetsinriktad och kommunikativ person som trivs i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

**Hur du ansöker**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Bliwa med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Gustaf Linder, gustaf.linder@wiseit.se .
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Välkommen med din ansökan
   

  

**Om oss**
 Bliwa skiljer sig från många andra försäkringsbolag. Bliwa är specialiserade på personförsäkringar och betalar ut pengar vid olyckor, sjukdom, arbetslöshet och dödsfall. Bliwa jobbar alltså inte med saker, utan med människor. Och det här präglar Bliwa som företag.
   

  

 Bliwa Livförsäkring bildades 2003 och är ett kundägt specialistbolag som erbjuder personförsäkring genom gruppförsäkring. I samarbete med företag och organisationer försäkrar bolaget cirka en miljon människor.
   

  

 Bliwa skapar försäkringar som gör skillnad – som bidrar till ett tryggare samhälle. Om kunden av någon anledning inte längre kan arbeta som vanligt, då fungerar försäkringarna som ett komplement till samhällets skydd.
   

  

 Bliwa har inga aktieägare, utan ägs av sina kunder och verksamhetens överskott går tillbaka till kunderna – i form av sänkta premier, bättre villkor och nya tjänster. Bliwakoncernen är verksam i Sverige och består av Bliwa Livförsäkring och det helägda dotterbolaget Bliwa Skadeförsäkring. Antalet anställda är ca 110 och alla arbetar i fina lokaler centralt på Kungsholmen.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**SSC is a leading, global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. The Satellite Management Service division in SSC is focused on providing high quality and innovative ground station services to our customers - the spacecraft operators. Together we help Earth benefit from Space.**
**What You Will Do**
 We offer the opportunity to join the Software unit within SSC Connect, which is entrusted to develop and maintain critical systems required to connect our customers with their satellites.
   

  

 Our core business is to deliver satellite data to our customers, and the Data Engineering team owns critical components in this process. Their software ensures fast and reliable data delivery, as well as providing great observability for our customers and NMC.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you will build and maintain:
   

  

* Systems used for data transfer and observability
* Data pipelines and KPI calculations
* Dashboards and reports


**Who You Are**
 We think that you care – about your systems, your colleagues and your users. That you have a creative and analytical mindset. You take responsibility, drive your own initiatives and can learn and process technical details quickly. We also think that you appreciate both working autonomously and together with other people.
   

  

 You have a European citizenship and can travel within and outside Sweden if needed. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services, it may include outside of standard working hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* B.S. Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering, or similar experience
* 2+ years of building and maintaining operationally critical systems
* Experience of implementing dashboard in tools/systems like MS Power BI or Grafana
* Implementation skills in Python, SQL and Flink
* Familiar with Git and Linux Fluency in English


**BONUS POINTS**
* Experience from containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes)
* Familiar with AWS
* Familiar with Spark
* Experience with message bus technologies like NATS/Kafka
* Experience of DevOps and CI/CD Methodologies
* Experience from the space industry


**WE OFFER YOU**
* An opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry and help Earth benefit from Space.
* An excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging endeavors.
* To be part of international development projects with highly engaged teams.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Possibility to work remotely part of the time (max 50%), and flexible work hours.


**LOCATION**
 Stockholm or Kiruna.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 Does this sound interesting? Interviews are held continuously.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 At SSC we help our customers gain access to space. With approximately 600 employees worldwide, SSC offers specialist skills in development, test, launch and operations of different flight and space systems. The Connect division provides satellite services and communications via a global network of our own as well as partner ground stations.
   

  

 Read more at  www.sscspace.com

title: Program Manager
description:
**Senior Program / Project Manager**
 Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading global information technology, consulting and business process services company. A company recognized globally for its comprehensive portfolio of services, strong commitment to sustainability and good corporate citizenship, we have over 240,000 dedicated employees serving clients across six continents. Together, we discover ideas and connect the dots to build a better and a bold new future.
   

  

 This role belongs to our Nordics subsidiary of Wipro Limited with a headquarter in Stockholm. Wipro has bold ambition for our Nordics subsidiary. Nordics is one of the fastest growing geographies for Wipro under the leadership of Vinay Firake, Sr Vice President and Managing Director Wipro Nordics.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will understand how to design and implement IT Organizations, new Ways of Working/Agile and drive strategic transformation programs
   

  

  

  

**Your working area & responsibilities :**
* Take the overall responsibility of successfully delivering IT Operating Model or New Ways of Working Transformation Consulting engagements.
* Build a trusted partner status with the client C-suite stakeholders based on excellent delivery of the Transformation Engagement.
* Attract, hire, retain, inspire and manage talent. Mentor and guide the team members where required.
* Ensure team and self-utilization at all times.
* Lead client engagements while driving both business development and practice growth at the same time.
* Own and achieve the assigned revenue, client satisfaction and team utilization targets.
* Deliver consulting projects in English language.
* Travel to client locations as and when needed (sometimes up to 80% travel required)


**Your skillset :**
* Must have deep Domain/Industry Knowledge in TMT (Technology Media and Telecom) and or Manufacturing : Awareness and knowledge of broad economic, demographic, technological and global trends within own ecosystem
* At least 15 years’ experience in delivering large and complex IT Operating Model, New Ways of Working and/or Projects to Products Transformation engagements as an Engagement Manager or Engagement Leader
* Understanding of Next Gen Application Management Services based on flow and reducing waste in SDLC
* Experience in managing and delivering complex transformation programs
* Broad background in IT management consulting and CIO advisory
* Proven track record of advising clients and implementing new operating models and delivery methods such as Agile, DevSecOps, Cloud, Cost Optimization, etc.
* Proven track record of successfully selling consulting engagements
* Proven track record of managing multitude of client stakeholders at the C-suite level and similar senior stakeholders
* Excellent Swedish (desirable) and English language skills


**Benefits include:**
* Diversity is in our DNA
* We are a part of the IT & Telecoms Collective Agreement with Almega
* Support via our New Hires Buddy-Program
* Regular All-Hands Meetings
* Regular Office Events
* Referral Program
* Comprehensive Learning Offerings
* Highly International, High-Performance Culture


  

  

 Wipro is an Equal Opportunity employer and is strongly and actively committed to diversity within its community. Women, minorities and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Additionally, Wipro prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.
   

  

  

  

 At Wipro, we endeavor to provide a formidable platform for professionals who will be our change agents - catalysts who are torchbearers of our fortitude to excel and redefine the limits of technology to make our clients successful. Our hiring team focuses on the recruitment of talented professionals in the industry. If you are experienced in the pursuit of excellence in IT, and looking for challenging opportunities to actualize your fire within, look no further. A career at Wipro offers just that and a lot more.
   

  

 Organizational Change Management

title: Senior Embedded Engineer
description:
Senior Embedded Engineer
 

  






 We are seeking a passionate Senior Embedded Engineer with strong microcontroller programming and wireless communication skills. You will play a key role in building our low-power wireless communication and ultra-wideband (UWB) tracking system.
 




  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Build and maintain the RTOS firmware for the Wittra tag and its companion click-on sensors
* Work on a variety of components including wireless IoT communication, UWB tracking, sensing, remote upgrade, security and more
* Opportunity to contribute to other parts of the product, from deep embedded hardware to the embedded Linux gateway
* With a DevOps mindset, extend and maintain our hardware-in-the-loop CI/CD pipelines and monitoring tools
* Communicate with engineers in your and other teams on designing interfaces between the system components



  





**Skills** 



* RTOS software design and development
* Industry-grade C programming
* Low-power wireless communication
* Experience with ultrawide-band (UWB) and positioning is a plus
* CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
* Additional good to have skills: Python, Golang, FreeRTOS, TI-RTOS, Zephyr, Contiki-NG, 6LoWPAN, Mioty, TDMA, BLE, Hardware design, TI CC13xx, Microchip SAML 21xxx



  






 Seize this opportunity to shape the future of IoT with us. If you're ready for this challenge, we are eager to meet you!
 




  





**What we do** 




  






 In the transformative world of the Internet of Things (IoT), Wittra stands at the forefront, offering innovative solutions that redefine industry standards for both asset tracking and sensing. Wittra's devices, powered by batteries, establish vast wireless networks comprising thousands of nodes. These networks integrate diverse sensor elements and cutting-edge positioning technologies. We provide robust products, infrastructure and user-friendly software platforms, empowering our customers to establish, manage, and expand secure IoT networks with ease.
 




  






 Join Wittra's team for an exciting journey, as we explore new markets and launch innovative products. As a forward-thinking and rapidly growing company, we offer a stimulating, supportive workplace that values diversity and high-impact contributions. Located in a modern office near Stockholm Central Station, Wittra embraces a flexible hybrid work model, catering to a variety of talents and aspirations.
 




  





**What we offer** 




  






 Join Wittra, a rising star in the IoT sector, and contribute to building and scaling a rapidly growing company.
 




  




* Work on diverse projects, spanning from hardware to cloud solutions.
* Competitive compensation package.
* Premium, hybrid-optional office space.
* An entrepreneurial, startup culture.
* Backed by prominent investors.



  





**Wittra equality** 




  






 As an equal opportunity employer, Wittra is dedicated to a diverse, inclusive workplace. We base our hiring on skill and experience, regardless of age, gender, identity, nationality, marital status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, or religious beliefs.

title: Sr Enterprise Account Executive
description:
**Company Description**  

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**  

You will produce new business sales revenue from a SaaS license model. You will accomplish this through account planning, territory planning, researching prospect customers, using business development strategies and completing field-based sales activities within a defined set of prospects, territory or vertical.

**What you get to do in this role:**

* Develop relationships with multiple C-suite personas (e.g., CFO, CIO, COO, CDO) across all product sales
* Oversee client relationship mapping to the account team, orchestrating an account strategy while leading across a broad virtual team (Solutions Consultants, Solutions Specialist, Success resources, Partners and Marketing, etc.)
* Be a trusted advisor to your customers by understanding their business and advising on how ServiceNow can help help their IT roadmap
* Identify the right specialist/ support resources to bring into a deal, at the right time

  

**Qualifications** **To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 10+ years of sales experience within software OR solutions sales organization
* Experience establishing trusted relationships with current and prospective clients and other teams
* Experience producing new business, negotiate deals, and maintain healthy C-Level relationships
* Experience achieving sales targets
* The ability to understand the "bigger picture" and our plans around IT
* Experience promoting a customer success focus in a "win as a team" environment
* Willingness to travel up to 50%
* Fluent in Swedish

*Not sure if you meet every qualification? We still encourage you to apply! We value inclusivity, welcoming candidates from diverse backgrounds, including non-traditional paths. Unique experiences enrich our team, and the willingness to dream big makes you an exceptional candidate!*

 **Additional Information** **Work Personas**


We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**


For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.


From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.
company_description: At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible.

title: Digital Trust and Cyber Security Management Consultant, Sweden (hiring to multiple levels)
description:
**At Capgemini Invent, we’re on a mission to build the leading Digital Trust & Cyber Security management consulting team in Sweden to be part of our existing Nordic team already established in Finland and Denmark.** With major market opportunities on the horizon and the strength of our Nordic and global teams behind us, we’re assembling a powerhouse of entrepreneurial minds ready to take cyber security to the next level. Cyber security has never been more critical—or more exciting. We are looking for driven, entrepreneurial people who are ready to shape the future of cyber with us. If you’re passionate about cyber security and ready to help us build and lead, we want to talk to you.


We are actively recruiting to the following roles/levels:


* Senior consultants
* Manager
* Senior Manager/Team Lead

**If you are passionate about building secure digital futures for clients and thrive at the intersection of strategy and execution, then we invite you to lead the way as one of our founding members of our Swedish Digital Trust & Security team.**

At Capgemini Invent, we empower businesses to navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital transformation. As a leading management consultancy, we help clients embrace new technologies while safeguarding their critical data and assets. Key responsibilities include:


* Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge cyber and data protection strategies and cybersecurity operating models.
* Conduct performance improvement assessments and benchmarking clients' security posture against national and international standards.
* Develop robust governance, risk, and compliance frameworks, incorporating both traditional and innovative approaches.
* Guide clients through business resilience transformations, ensuring they are prepared for any crisis or disruption.
* Working aligned with leading cybersecurity management platforms & technologies.
* Champion the integration of Digital Trust & Security into cloud and digital workplace initiatives.
* Manage and collaborate closely with our Nordic Digital Trust & Security teams.

We are driven by a shared purpose: Unleashing human energy through technology, data, creative and innovation for an inclusive and sustainable future. **The person we want to invite to join our mission will likely have:**

* Management consulting experience and proven experience in leading digital transformation projects focused on information security, data protection, or cybersecurity, and the application of cybertechnology.
* Passion for combining strategic thinking with hands-on implementation.
* High integrity, collaborative spirit, and a strong fit with our dynamic culture.
* Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.
* Familiarity with current cybersecurity management standards (ISO 2700x, NIST) is advantageous.
* Relevant certifications (ISO 2700x, CISM, CISA, CISSP) and experience with legal and regulatory requirements (EU-GDPR, NIS2) are a strong plus.
* Previous management experience, leading teams in information security, data protection, and/or cybersecurity, with a proactive approach to identifying strategic improvement areas for clients.
* Experience on sales, pre-sales, offering
* Educational background of relevance in cybersecurity , technology, or IT.
* Swedish citizenship, fluency in Swedish and English.

**What We Offer:**

* The opportunity to shape the future of a leading management consultancy practice.
* Collaborate with a team of passionate and talented professionals.
* Make a real difference for our clients, helping them thrive in today’s digital world.
* Build a rewarding career with a company that invests in your growth and development.

**Sounds like the next step in your career?**

We know that some might hesitate to apply unless they meet every single requirement. If that sounds familiar, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be a better fit than you think—and we’d love to hear from you. We review applications on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible! Please submit your application and CV in English.


Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris ) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of **strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists** who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.


Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent , or listen in to an episode of our podcast **Future Sight with Capgemini Invent** , available on Spotify.

title: Chief Product Security Officer (8944)
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.  


**Role and responsibilities**  

The Chief Product Security Officer (CPSO) is responsible for the overall cyber security and information security program within R&D for Product & Services, both Product Management & Development and Digital Services.  


This role will ensure that our products meet rigorous security standards, uphold customer trust, and future-proof our business amid increasing regulatory and security demands.  


The role also includes:
* Develop and drive the overall cybersecurity strategy for product and software development across PMD and DS including incident management.
* Ensuring regulatory compliance with relevant regulations and other industry frameworks.
* Establish and enforce secure software development lifecycle practices to embed security from concept to deployment.
* Assurance, Training & Awareness and Follow up

  


**Qualifications**  

To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
* Master’s or equivalent degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related technical field.
* Relevant experience in cybersecurity or information security, in a leadership role overseeing product or software security in a complex, global organization.
* Expertise in implementing and managing security frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, RED, CRA, NIST, GDPR etc).
* Proficiency in cloud security architecture, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
* Experience with operational technology (OT), Edge, IoT and cloud environments
* Certifications such as CSSLP, CISSP, CISM or equivalent are highly desirable.

  


The role also requires a proven ability to lead diverse teams and foster cross-functional collaboration across departments. Strong communication skills are essential to translate complex technical security concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders. A strategic mindset is also key, enabling you to balance immediate security needs with long-term goals effectively.  


**Working at DeLaval**  

Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.  

  

We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.  

  

**Additional information**  

This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm or Wroclaw, Poland. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.  


We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.  


**Contact**  

Hiring manager: Lars Bergmann, lars.bergmann@delaval.com  

HR Business Partner: Elin Fagerstedt, elin.fagerstedt@delaval.com  


**About DeLaval**  

Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.  


Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.  

See more at corporate.delaval.com
company_addresses: Gustaf De Lavals väg 15, 147 21 Tumba, Sweden
company_description: At DeLaval, We Live Milk!

title: Kreativ kommunikatör med inriktning mot film, foto, webb och sociala medier
description:
**Vill du vara med och bidra till en skola där alla barn och elever får lika rätt till god utbildning i en trygg miljö? Skolinspektionen söker en kreativ kommunikatör med inriktning mot film, foto, webb och sociala medier till kommunikationssekretariatet vid huvudkontoret i Stockholm.**

  

Skolinspektionen arbetar med tillsyn och kvalitetsgranskning av skolor och prövar tillstånd för fristående skolor. Skolinspektionen är regionalt organiserad med avdelningar i Göteborg, Linköping, Lund, Stockholm och Umeå. Myndighetsledning och centrala stödfunktioner är placerade i Stockholm.

  


**Kommunikationssekretariatet**



Kommunikationssekretariatet består av tio personer. Vi arbetar med kvalificerat kommunikationsstöd till ledning, chefer och medarbetare, gentemot interna och externa målgrupper. Vårt uppdrag är att nå ut med Skolinspektionens granskningar och beslut, göra bilden av myndigheten tydlig och tillhandahålla och förvalta effektiva kanaler för kommunikation.

  


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**



Du kommer att ansvara för digitala sändningar och möten i event- och utbildningssammanhang och för film och foto. Du ska själv kunna fotografera och filma, men även kravställa gentemot leverantörer inom området. Inom ditt ansvarsområde ligger även att tillsammans med andra på enheten arbeta med grafisk form och kommunikation via sociala medier och webb. Andra uppdrag inom kommunikationsområdet kommer också förekomma.

  


**Vi söker en person som:**


* agerar självständigt och tar egna initiativ,
* har god samarbetsförmåga, gott omdöme och hög servicegrad,
* är resultatinriktad, når uppsatta mål och håller tidsplaner,
* är bra på att skapa förtroende och goda relationer både internt och externt,
* är nyfiken på utveckling inom digital kommunikation.

  


**Kvalifikationskrav:**


* relevant utbildning inom kommunikationsområdet på högskolenivå eller motsvarande erfarenhet som Skolinspektionen bedömer relevant,
* minst ett års erfarenhet av eget arbete med produktion av foto och film,
* erfarenhet av sändningar av arrangemang i Teams och andra aktuella verktyg för digitala möten och erfarenhet av att arrangera digitala event,
* erfarenhet av arbete i Adobe Creative Cloud, inkl. Premier Pro och andra verktyg för filmredigering,
* erfarenhet av publicering och tillgänglighetsanpassning av foto och film för webb och sociala kanaler.

  


**Det är meriterande med:**


* erfarenhet av arbete i offentlig sektor.

  



Dina personliga egenskaper, förmågor och motivation kommer att tillmätas stor vikt.


**Tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning. Skolinspektionen tillämpar provanställning om sex månader.


**Ansökan**

Klicka på ansök nedan, bifoga personligt brev och cv. Välkommen med din ansökan senast 8 april,2025 . Diarienummer **2025:3242**


**Frågor**  

Rekryteringsprocessen:  

Fackliga företrädare: Robert Östberg, OFR och Caroline Engskär, Saco-S, båda nås via växeln 08-586 080 00.  

För frågor om tjänstens innehåll: Jesper Wadensjö, chef kommunikationssekretariatet, jesper.wadensjo@skolinspektionen.se

  


*I denna rekrytering har Skolinspektionen redan tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och önskar inte kontakt med mediesäljare gällande förslag till rekryteringslösningar.*

title: Senior infrastrukturkonsult
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och självgående senior infrastrukturkonsult till vårt team på IT-Total. Du kommer att arbeta med specialister inom IT och digitalisering för att leverera professionella IT-tjänster och lösningar till företag och organisationer. Vi fokuserar på produkter från VMware by Broadcom och HPE, inom områden som Datacenter Virtualization, Automation, Cloud Native Platform, Networking & Security samt Storage & Availability.


**Om rollen**

* Design, implementation, felsökning, förvaltning och utveckling av våra kunders VMware-plattformar och IT-infrastruktur.
* Delta i projekt och uppdrag som teknisk rådgivare och/eller utförare samt leverera dokumentation enligt utsatta krav.
* Agera teknisk specialist och rådgivare både internt och mot kund inom dina kompetensområden.
* Genomföra förstudier, analyser och workshops.
* Stötta arkitekter vid framtagandet av design för VMware-plattformar.
* Stötta sälj vid framtagandet av VMware plattforms-lösningar.

Utveckla din kompetens genom att omvärldsbevaka och hålla dig uppdaterad med det senaste inom IT, i synnerhet inom ditt kunskapsområde.  
* 

  

**Vad krävs för att lyckas i rollen?**

  

Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet som konsult inom planering, design, införande/installation och drift av IT-lösningar, helst inom VMware. Du har ett starkt problemlösningssinne, är tydlig och kommunikativ samt är självgående. Utöver detta har du en gedigen erfarenhet inom branschen, helst 5-10 år.


#### **Övriga meriter:**

* Certifieringar inom VMware (VCP, VCAP, VCIX och liknande), särskilt inom specialistprodukter som NSX, vRA/vRO och VCF.
* Certifieringar inom hårdvara (HPE, Dell och liknande).

Erfarenhet av VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF), VMware Cloud Director (VCD), Kubernetes, Tanzu är extra meriterande.  
* 

  

**Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total?**


IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på din framtid och jobbar i teknikens framkant med ett högt säkerhetstänk. Med säkerhetsprövade medarbetare och säkerhetsklassade lokaler- och datahallar garanterar vi trygghet och integritet för våra kunder.  

  

**Vi erbjuder:**

* En himmelsk fredagsfrukost med kollegorna
* Hybrid arbetsplats
* Roligt på jobbet - allt från träning till resor och spelkvällar
* Ett välfyllt lager av frukt, nötter, gudomligt kaffe från en Kunglig Hovleverantör om så önskas.
* Fredagsfika tillsammans
* Ett stenkast till både shopping på Mall of Scandinavia och natursköna Brunnsviken som är perfekt för löpning och lunchpromenader
* Goda och trygga anställningsvillkor.
* Frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete, vi tror på "Work life balance"
* ‍‍ Kollegor i världsklass som bryr sig
* Goda parkeringsmöjligheter
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag

  

Här kan du även läsa mer om våra värderingar

 **Varmt välkommen med din ansökan i formuläret nedan.**  

  

**Har du några frågor gällande tjänsten?**  

Tveka då inte att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare:  

Kajsa Jordansson, Talent Acquisition Manager, IT-Total

title: Cloud Operation Specialist
description:
**Cloud Operation Specialist**
==============================


Brinner du för molnteknologi och vill arbeta i framkanten av innovativa lösningar? Söker du en dynamisk arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att påverka kunders molnstrategier och säkerställa driften av molnbaserade lösningar? IT-Total söker nu efter en Cloud Operation Specialist till vårt team!

### **Om rollen**


I rollen som Cloud Operations Specialist kommer du vara teamets expert på Azure och hjälpa oss att nyttja plattformen maximalt i våra tjänster. Du kommer få jobba med design, prestandaoptimering, felrapportering samt implementationer och säkerställa att vi alltid levererar en tjänst med hög tillgänglighet. Vi arbetar primärt med Microsofts-produkter, men det kan även förekomma andra Cloudleverantörer AWS, GCP och tillsammans arbetar vi med att leverera de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder.

  

* Övervakning och hantering av molnmiljöer för optimal prestanda och tillgänglighet.
* Säkerställa driftsäkerhet genom att implementera och följa bästa praxis för molnsäkerhet.
* Kör verksamhetskritiska system och arbeta för att minska driftavbrott.
* Samarbeta med kunder för att förstå och förbättra deras molnstrategi.
* Skapa och underhålla dokumentation och processer för molndrift.

### **Vad krävs för att lyckas i rollen?**


Vi söker dig som har en gedigen teknisk bakgrund och erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnbaserade plattformar. För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:

* Ha gedigen kunskap inom Microsoft Azure.
* Ha erfarenhet av Hybrida Cloud-implementationer.
* Brinna för kund och uppskatta förvaltning.
* Ha erfarenhet av Microsoft-produkter.
* Vara nyfiken och lösningsorienterad.
* Vara serviceinriktad och en bra teamspelare.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och proaktivt i projekt.
* Ha mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

**Meriterande:**

  

* Terraform.
* Azure Az-104 certifiering eller motsvarande.

#### **Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total?**


IT-Total föddes ur idén att vara det bästa företaget för medarbetare inom sin bransch, därför välkomnar vi dig till en arbetsplats som ger dig glädje, stimulans och möjlighet att växa inom det område du brinner för. title: Enterprise Sales Director Sweden
description:
**Picture Yourself at Pega:**
-----------------------------



Imagine leading a dynamic team at Pegasystems, where innovation meets excellence. As the Director of Sales (Enterprise) for the Nordics, you’ll be a pivotal leader and key addition to the Central (DACH & Nordics) Management team. Since 2008, Pega has been revolutionising the customer journey for millions, working with well-known clients in the region, leveraging cutting-edge technology. Pega is The Enterprise Transformation Company™ that empowers organisations to Build for Change® with groundbreaking enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation solutions. This unique opportunity involves hiring and coaching a world-class enterprise sales team, developing pipelines, strategic planning, account management, accurate forecasting, and consistently achieving defined sales quotas within the MEDDPICC qualification framework.

**Meet Our Team:**
------------------



Join a team that is at the forefront of industry transformation. As the recognized leader in strategic business application by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner, we challenge companies to rethink their business models and empower them to become more efficient, smarter, and customer-centric.


Our Nordics Go-To-Market team is centered around our Stockholm office. We work in a hybrid model, offering the flexibility to work from home, client sites, or at our Stockholm office, while regularly connecting with your team to achieve outstanding results together.

**What You'll Do at Pega:**
---------------------------


**Lead, Inspire & Empower** your team to reach their full potential by listening, empowering, and driving accountability through empathetic leadership. Foster a collaborative, high-trust culture of top achievers, emphasizing OnePega sales engagement and a strong learning environment.

**Drive Sales Strategy -** Set sales targets and ensure pipeline and forecast accuracy. Demonstrate operational cadence and engage meaningfully with C-level executives to create value, drive commercial outcomes, and identify significant upselling opportunities

**Implement Strategic Partnerships:** Develop and execute a Sell-With and Sell-To strategy by leveraging top SIs, MSPs, and consulting firms in the DACH region

**Hire, train, and coach**new and existing Sales Executive team members to master the MEDDPICC Sales methodology, develop compelling territory plans, integrating the best of Pega’s internal ecosystem (marketing, inside sales, legal, presales, etc.) for successful deal realization.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Build effective working relationships with cross-functional GTM teams, including Solution Consulting, Delivery Services, Marketing, our Partner community, and the Pega Sales executive team.

**Who You Are:**
----------------



The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are a natural coach and mentor, thriving in these roles. You bring to Pega a proven track record of sales and leadership performance, characterized not just by a network of C-level connections, but by a wealth of best practices and innovative approaches. You are humble, authentic, and curious, and you excel in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

**What You've Accomplished:**
-----------------------------


* BA/BS/Masters or equivalent work experience
* 12+ years of industry-related sales experience, including 5+ years of experience in sales management (minimum)
* Business or fluent Swedish & English expected.
* Enterprise SAAS and/or complex software transformation solution sales background
* Strong listening, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ideally thought leadership on Cloud Modernization and AI Transformation.
**Pega Offers You:**
--------------------


* A rapidly growing yet well-established business with the world’s most innovative organizations as referenceable clients.
* A proven track record in AI, showcasing our deep understanding and continuous innovation in this field. We are recognized as leaders by analysts in emerging markets.
* A comprehensive portfolio of benefits and rewards designed to support and excite our team members.
* A culture that truly values flexibility, family, and learning.


#LI-PF1


  
**Inclusion and Diversity –** *Inclusive* is one of our values at Pega. Pegasystems is committed to inclusion and diversity and strives to foster a fair and inclusive environment for all. We believe Pega can achieve more when we create a culture that inspires each of us to fully contribute each and every day. We encourage diverse thinking and collaboration for better outcomes for all. Learn more about our inclusive culture.



We encourage candidates of all backgrounds and skillsets to consider opportunities at Pega. At Pega, we focus on the skills needed to be successful and we know that our employees can thrive even if they don't possess a traditional background. If you like the sound of this role, but are not sure if you are the right person, please consider applying. We would love to hear from you!



As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.


**Export Compliance –** For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations such as this, Pegasystems may need to obtain export license approval from the U.S. Government and EU Authorities for certain individuals.


**Accommodations –** If you require reasonable accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act (US only) or comparable regional regulations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact us here or contact (US only) 1-888-PEGA-NOW and/or 225 Wyman Street Waltham, MA 02451 ATTN: Benefits.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Build and Lead High-Performing Engineering Teams at Rerun**
-------------------------------------------------------------


At Rerun, we’re building a new multimodal data stack for robotics and spatial AI. Large parts of the physical-world economy will be transformed by these technologies, and we're developing the data infrastructure and tools that make it possible. Rerun’s open-source project focuses on visualizing and handling multimodal logs and is already loved by some of the best teams in the world.


We’re looking for a strategic and people-focused Engineering Manager to help scale and structure our engineering teams. This is a unique opportunity to step into an exceptionally talented engineering team that values agency, collaboration, and broad ownership of what we build. Your mission will be to streamline operations, empower engineers and further grow a high-caliber team that thrives on both autonomy and shared responsibility. This is a hands-on leadership role, ideal for someone eager to shape a strong, cohesive engineering culture while driving hiring, team development, and operational excellence.

**What You’ll Work On**
-----------------------


As an Engineering Manager at Rerun, you’ll:

* Shape engineering operations by optimising workflows, improving team communication, and ensuring smooth cross-functional collaboration.
* Define and foster engineering excellence by benchmarking against top engineering teams and setting clear expectations for quality, velocity, and consistency in technical rigor.
* Drive hiring and team growth by managing the hiring pipeline from sourcing to final interviews, ensuring the attraction and retention of top talent.
* Mentor and develop engineers through 1:1 coaching, career development, and ongoing support for a growing team.
* Improve organisational processes by assessing and refining our engineering structure, hiring strategies, and overall operational efficiency.
* Manage a globally distributed team by bridging time zones and ensuring effective collaboration across European and US-based teams as the company scales globally.
* Align engineering with business goals by helping leadership set realistic hiring plans, balancing team capacity with company milestones, and driving business growth.

**We’d Love It If You Have**
----------------------------

* Strong technical background with a passion for people management, having started your career as an engineer before transitioning into engineering leadership over the years.
* Proven experience managing and growing engineering teams in high-growth startups, ideally within data infrastructure companies or similar.
* Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to mentor, motivate, and develop engineers at various career stages.
* Technical expertise in distributed systems, data infrastructure, or cloud services, where technical depth is a strong advantage, even though this is not a hands-on coding role.
* A track record of structuring engineering processes, from hiring to technical execution and effectively scaling teams.
* Experience leading remote teams, with the ability to manage distributed teams across multiple time zones.
* A proactive mindset, taking ownership, solving problems independently, and driving key initiatives forward.

**How we work at Rerun**
------------------------

* We're a remote company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.
* We meet up in person for a week roughly once a quarter
* The team you'll join currently has members in European and US-east timezones


	+ Everyone is available for synchronous work between 1:30 and 5pm CET
	+ This is a new sub-team so for the right candidate we are open shifting this sync-time window to better accommodate the US west coast
* We've put together an uncommonly talented tech team, value agency and helpfulness highly, and expect everyone to take broad responsibility for what they build
* We offer competitive cash and equity compensation, six weeks paid vacation, and whatever hardware and software you need to do your job

title: Platform Engineer (Umeå) - Sweden
description:
We are a team of dedicated software developers, big data engineers, data scientists, telco engineers, and sales professionals, with marketing, finance, HR, and other business professionals supporting the core roles.  

  

What we do at Elisa Polystar is not taught in textbooks. With us, you get to join in the pioneering work of AI-driven network analytics and assurance.  

  

We believe in transparency and a Nordic work culture – allowing you to make a significant contribution while maintaining a healthy work–life balance.


### **MEET**


  
### **Platform Engineer (Umeå) - Sweden**


**Join Elisa Polystar: Build the Future of Telecom with Us**


At **Elisa Polystar**, we’re innovators shaping the future of telecom. As a proud subsidiary of **Elisa Plc**, we’re on a mission to drive sustainability through cutting-edge digital solutions.


We’re passionate about innovation and continuous improvement. As a member of our dynamic **Infrastructure Platform** **team**, you and your colleagues will be **instrumental** in the **evolution** of our Infrastructure Platform—all while thriving in a creative, technology-intensive environment.

**What You’ll Do**

* **Automate & Optimize** – Enhance, secure and maintain our platform environments, ensuring our CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes run seamlessly.
* **Innovate & Integrate** – Develop and refine system integration solutions, leveraging Kubernetes, Linux, Python, and Go to meet evolving business challenges.
* **Collaborate & Share** – Work in a cross-functional team, sharing your expertise and learning from others in a supportive, change-driven culture.

**What We’re Looking For**

* **Hands-On Experience with Kubernetes & Linux & Security** – Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and Linux. Knowledge of best secure practices for platform development.
* **Programming Savvy** – Proficiency in Python/Go and Ansible.
* **Deployment & CI/CD Expertise** – Solid understanding of build pipelines, automation frameworks, and version control systems (GitHub, FluxCD, Jenkins & GitHub Actions).
* **Team Player with Humility** – You’re collaborative, eager to share knowledge, and ready to take initiative.
* **Bonus Points** – Familiarity with cloud providers (e.g. AWS, GCP)

 **Why Elisa Polystar?**

* **Hybrid & Flexible Work** – Balance office and remote work as it suits you**.**
* **Growth-Oriented Culture** – Being part of Elisa group, we support your learning and career development.
* **Be Part of Telecom innovators** – Help shape the future of the industry.


Interested? Please by **Friday, March 21st**! We look forward to hearing from you!


Note that the final candidate will be subject to a background check.
