title: Customer Success Manager - Sports Performance
description:
**We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join the Spiideo team!**


Spiideo is a global leader in automated, cloud-based solutions for sports video analysis and streaming. Trusted by thousands of organizations worldwide, Spiideo serves some of the most renowned professional and collegiate teams, media companies, and leagues and federations.


Join the Customer Success team if you would love the opportunity to manage some of the top sports organizations across Europe.

  

This role is based in Malmö, Sweden and you will report directly to the VP of Customer Success.

**The role:**


You will manage a portfolio of Media companies, Leagues, and Sports clubs in Europe with a primary focus in Southern Europe markets (Spain, Italy, etc.). Fluency in Spanish and Italian is required to effectively manage the Spain and Italian markets.

 **Core responsibilities:**

* **Onboarding & Training:** help new customers get onboarded with Spiideo
* **Customer Satisfaction:** delivering exceptional guidance, maximize potential
* **Renewals:** proactive management to achieve company renewal targets
* **Upsell & Expansion:** identify opportunities to maximize and expand usage
* **Churn management:** proactively engage to reduce churn and ensure success
* **Relationship building:** cultivate strong, trusted partnerships with key stakeholders
* **Process development:** ability to coordinate and manage complex implementations

**What type of customers would you manage?**

  

You will manage a portfolio of Sports clubs, Leagues, and Media companies (in market) across a variety of sports (Football, Ice Hockey, Basketball, Handball, etc.) across the entire Spiideo portfolio: Spiideo Perform (video analysis), Spiideo Play (streaming), and Spiideo Replay (VAR).

  

* Leagues
* Professional sports clubs
* Media Companies

**What we are looking for:**

  

* Prior Customer Success or Sales experience (at least 2 years)
* Professional proficiency in Spanish, Italian and English, both written and spoken
* Sports tech industry is a bonus
* Very process-driven and structured approach to working
* Self-motivated, takes initiative, positive, team-first attitude
* Excellent ability to train customers via Webinars, 1on1 meetings, etc.
* Strong problem solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Passion for customer success and get joy out of seeing our customers succeed

**What we can offer:**

  

* The chance to make an impact in a growing, international SaaS company.
* A friendly and skilled multinational team
* Access to cutting-edge tools and resources to empower your work.
* Benefits package that includes an extensive pension & insurance package in line with collective agreements, wellness contribution, parental leave benefits and the opportunity to spend two working hours per week on physical activity.

**Location**: Spiideo's office at Lilla Torg 1 in Malmö

**Remote status:** Office first (Hybrid, minimum 3 days in Malmö office per week)

 **Application**


You will be part of an international team with knowledgable and friendly people from many different nationalities and backgrounds. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives, skills, and experiences, fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce across Spiideo.


We believe that when the best people work together in an open environment, magic happens. Apply now and become an integral part of our success story! We review new applications continuously.

title: Support Engineer
description:
Hello Network,
 



  





  





 I hope you're doing well today!
 



  





  





 We are recruiting a freelance
 **Support Engineer role f** 
 or a
 **Swedish** 
**Client** 
 based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden:** 




  





  





**Duration: 6 months + chance of extensions** 




**Location: Stockholm (Hybrid Working Possible)** 




**Language: English Speaking Accepted** 




**Pay Rate: Negotiable** 




  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  





  




* In the role as Atlassian Support Engineer, you will provide essential support for Jira and Confluence to their employees globally. In this role, you will handle incident and request related support issues, while also serving as an escalation point for more complex cases. You will document solutions and create guides to streamline workflows for both the Atlassian team and end users.
* As a person it is important that you are proactive and self-driven, with the ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines. You should have strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze issues, identify root causes and implement effective solutions in a timely manner. Capable to work in a fast-paced environment, with ability to prioritize what’s most important. Also, you need to have strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders. Finally, the client value curiosity, a passion for Atlassian products and a proactive, team-oriented mindset.



  





  





**Requirements:** 




  





  




* 3+ years of experience in relevant field
* Experience in Jira and Confluence administration (Data Center and Cloud), with hands-on knowledge in configuration, user management and troubleshooting.
* Experience in providing first-line support for Jira and Confluence, handling basic to mid-level technical issues and escalating complex cases when needed.
* Experience in creating and managing documentation in Confluence, including creating user guides, troubleshooting steps and knowledge base articles.
* Familiarity with Jira automations and workflows, with the ability to configure and troubleshoot automation rules within Jira and Confluence.
* Basic understanding of Microsoft 365 Administration, to assist with integration between Atlassian tools and Microsoft services.
* Knowledge of cloud-based services such as Azure and integrations with Atlassian tools to support the seamless operation of Jira and Confluence.
* Fluent in written and spoken English



  





  





 If you are interested, or you know someone that could be please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who is
 **immediate joiner** 
 and want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Responsibilities:**
* Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
* Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
* Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
* Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
* Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
* Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
* Good knowledge of Terraform
* Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
* Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
* Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start:** 
 Immediate
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.
   

  

**Locations:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.**

title: Stockholms starkaste lösningsarkitekt ServiceNow
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är Europas ledande konsultföretag inom ServiceNow och digital transformation. Vi hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera sina verksamheter genom innovativa teknologilösningar. Med fler än 4000 ServiceNow-experter besitter vi marknadens största och mest framstående ServiceNow-team där får du möjligheten att arbeta med dem mest spännande projekten samt utvecklas i en dynamisk och framåtlutad arbetsmiljö. Nu tar vi nästa stora kliv och satsar ännu hårdare på vår ledande position inom ServiceNow. Hos oss får du chansen att vara med och driva utvecklingen framåt, forma framtidens lösningar och göra verklig skillnad. Vill du vara en del av vårt ledande team?
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt inom ServiceNow kommer du vara en central del i utvecklingen och designen av moderna lösningar för att effektivisera arbetsflöden och processer. Som Elite Partner för ServiceNow har vi en av Skandinaviens största och mest kvalificerade konsultgrupper med närmare 500 dedikerade experter. Vi söker nu en senior profil som kan ta en ledande roll i våra teamleveranser tillsammans med våra experter som utvecklar innovativa lösningar för våra kunder.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter:**
* Designa och implementering avancerade lösningar inom ServiceNow.
* Ledande roll i att utveckla och konfigurera plattformen för att möta specifika krav och behov.
* Arbeta nära affärsavdelningar för att förstå och översätta deras verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar.
* Driva tekniska workshops och rådgivning gentemot kunder.
* Aktiv deltagande i agila team och förmåga att leda och inspirera.


**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:**
* Flerårig erfarenhet som arkitekt inom ServiceNow med uppsättning, implementering, utveckling och konfiguration inom plattformen.
* Expertis inom Javascript, HTML, SQL och ITIL.
* Vana av att arbeta i agila team.
* Relevanta certifieringar inom ServiceNow.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* En spännande arbetsmiljö hos Europas ledande ServiceNow-konsultbolag.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med innovativa lösningar och den senaste tekniken.
* Kompetensutveckling genom certifieringar, utbildningar och mentorskap.
* Hybrid arbetsmodell samt konkurrenskraftiga villkor och förmåner


**Om ServiceNow-teamet på Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är Nordens ledande expert inom ServiceNow – vi har den största och mest specialiserade kompetensen på marknaden. Vårt starka och sammansvetsade team levererar omfattande och högkvalitativa lösningar, där flera av våra erfarna ServiceNow-konsulter samarbetar för att maximera värdet för våra kunder. Vi drivs av innovation, samarbete och kunskapsutbyte – tillsammans sätter vi nya standarder och skapar framtidens digitala lösningar. Vill du arbeta med de bästa? Då är Sopra Steria platsen för dig.
   

  

**Om Sopra Steria:**
 Sopra Steria är en av Europas ledande aktörer inom digital transformation, med över 60 000 medarbetare i mer än 30 länder globalt. Vi driver innovation och hjälper företag och organisationer att effektivisera, utvecklas och skapa långsiktigt värde genom banbrytande teknologilösningar.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar de främsta experterna inom sina områden i en dynamisk och framtidsorienterad miljö där samarbete, nytänkande och teknisk spetskompetens står i centrum.
   

  

**Ansökan:**
 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara en del av en framstående arbetsplats, ansök genom att ladda upp ditt CV. Kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare, Teodor Nellvik (teodor.nellvik@soprasteria.com) eller Business Owner Mikael Kroglund (mikael.kroglund@soprasteria.com) för eventuella frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

**Välkommen till Sopra Steria - där din kompetens formar framtidens digitala lösningar!**
**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Enterprise Sales Director Sweden
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Picture Yourself At Pega**
 Imagine leading a dynamic team at Pegasystems, where innovation meets excellence. As the Director of Sales (Enterprise) for the Nordics, you’ll be a pivotal leader and key addition to the Central (DACH & Nordics) Management team. Since 2008, Pega has been revolutionising the customer journey for millions, working with well-known clients in the region, leveraging cutting-edge technology. Pega is The Enterprise Transformation Company™ that empowers organisations to Build for Change® with groundbreaking enterprise AI decisioning and workflow automation solutions. This unique opportunity involves hiring and coaching a world-class enterprise sales team, developing pipelines, strategic planning, account management, accurate forecasting, and consistently achieving defined sales quotas within the MEDDPICC qualification framework.
   

  

**Meet Our Team**
 Join a team that is at the forefront of industry transformation. As the recognized leader in strategic business application by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner, we challenge companies to rethink their business models and empower them to become more efficient, smarter, and customer-centric.
   

  

 Our Nordics Go-To-Market team is centered around our Stockholm office. We work in a hybrid model, offering the flexibility to work from home, client sites, or at our Stockholm office, while regularly connecting with your team to achieve outstanding results together.
   

  

**What You'll Do At Pega**
**Lead, Inspire & Empower** 
 your team to reach their full potential by listening, empowering, and driving accountability through empathetic leadership. Foster a collaborative, high-trust culture of top achievers, emphasizing OnePega sales engagement and a strong learning environment.
   

  

**Drive Sales Strategy -** 
 Set sales targets and ensure pipeline and forecast accuracy. Demonstrate operational cadence and engage meaningfully with C-level executives to create value, drive commercial outcomes, and identify significant upselling opportunities
   

  

**Implement Strategic Partnerships:** 
 Develop and execute a Sell-With and Sell-To strategy by leveraging top SIs, MSPs, and consulting firms in the DACH region
   

  

**Hire, train, and coach** 
 new and existingSales Executive team members to master the MEDDPICC Sales methodology, develop compelling territory plans, integrating the best of Pega’s internal ecosystem (marketing, inside sales, legal, presales, etc.) for successful deal realization.
   

  

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Build effective working relationships with cross-functional GTM teams, including Solution Consulting, Delivery Services, Marketing, our Partner community, and the Pega Sales executive team.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. You are a natural coach and mentor, thriving in these roles. You bring to Pega a proven track record of sales and leadership performance, characterized not just by a network of C-level connections, but by a wealth of best practices and innovative approaches. You are humble, authentic, and curious, and you excel in a fast-paced SaaS environment.
   

  

**What You've Accomplished**
* BA/BS/Masters or equivalent work experience
* 12+ years of industry-related sales experience, including 5+ years of experience in sales management (minimum)
* Business or fluent Swedish & English expected.
* Enterprise SAAS and/or complex software transformation solution sales background
* Strong listening, communication, and negotiation skills.
* Ideally thought leadership on Cloud Modernization and AI Transformation.


**Pega Offers You**
* A rapidly growing yet well-established business with the world’s most innovative organizations as referenceable clients.
* A proven track record in AI, showcasing our deep understanding and continuous innovation in this field. We are recognized as leaders by analysts in emerging markets.
* A comprehensive portfolio of benefits and rewards designed to support and excite our team members.
* A culture that truly values flexibility, family, and learning .


 Job ID: 21730

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**About Keyfactor**
 Our mission is to build a connected society, rooted in trust, with identity-first security for every machine and human. Keyfactor helps organizations move fast to establish digital trust at scale — and then maintain it. With decades of cybersecurity experience, Keyfactor is trusted by more than 1,500 companies across the globe. We are proud to continually earn recognition as a Best Place to Work, and we achieve that through our amazing people who cultivate our culture as we grow. We hope you will trust your future with Keyfactor!
   

  

**Title:** 
 Solutions Architect
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden; Stockholm
   

  

**Experience:** 
 Mid level
   

  

**Job Function:** 
 Professional Services
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time, Permanent
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Computer & Network Security
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Solutions Architect leads complex solution deployments for enterprise-level customers. Acting as a trusted advisor, they provide expert guidance on technical aspects and best practices. They contribute to continuous improvement of processes and methodologies, mentor junior team members, and ensure high-quality service delivery.
   

  

**The position is based in Stockholm office in Sweden, we have hybrid work model and excellent working practices. Applicants must be living in Sweden and must hold a valid Right to Work in Sweden.**
**Job Responsibilities**
* Lead complex solution deployments for enterprise-level customers.
* Provide expert guidance on technical aspects and best practices.
* Assist with the continuous improvement of processes and methodologies.
* Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance.
* Act as a primary technical point of contact for customers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Participate in the development of technical strategies and roadmaps.
* Resolve escalated technical issues promptly and effectively.
* Conduct in-depth technical assessments and provide recommendations.
* Assist in pre-sales activities and solution design.


**Minimum Qualifications, Education, And Skills**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or relevant field; or equivalent experience.
* Solid knowledge in a technical, MSP, or software consulting capacity.
* Comprehensive knowledge of industry standards, company operations, and advanced methodologies.
* Moderate understanding of core networking and infrastructure fundamentals.
* Moderate knowledge of Active Directory Certificate Services & Active Directory Federation Services.
* Moderate experience with Unix/Linux.
* Moderate experience with scripting development using various Microsoft tools (SQL, PowerShell, etc.).
* Moderate familiarity with Public-Key Infrastructure (PKI), digital certificates, and cryptography.
* Moderate familiarity with business application suites such as Microsoft 365.
* Ability to lead small projects, innovate within the role, and provide training to peers.


**Compensation**
 Salary will be commensurate with experience.
   

  

**Culture, Career Opportunities And Benefits**
 We build teams that continually strive to get better than the day before. You will be challenged daily and given opportunities to grow personally and professionally. We balance autonomy and structure to create an entrepreneurial environment to spur creativity and new ideas.
   

  

 Here are just some of the initiatives that make our culture special:
   

  

* Second Fridays (a company-wide day off on the second Friday of every month).
* Comprehensive benefit coverage, paid for by the company for you and your dependents (US).
* Generous paid parental leave (US).
* Dedicated employee-focused ambassadors via Key Contributors & Culture Committees.
* DIVERSE Commitment, a call to action for a more inclusive and diverse future in business, society, and technology.
* The Keyfactor Alliance Program to support DEIB efforts.
* Wellbeing resources, wellness allowance, mindfulness app free membership, Wellness Wednesdays.
* Global Volunteer Day, company non-profit matching, and 3 volunteer days off.
* Unlimited time off (US) and competitive time off globally.
* Monthly Talent development and Cross Functional meetings to support professional development.
* Regular All Hands meetings – followed by group gatherings.


**Our Core Values**
 Our core values are extremely important to how we run our business and what we look for in every team member:
   

  

**Trust** 
**is paramount.** 
  

  

*We deliver security software and solutions where trust and openness are of the highest importance for our customers. We are honest and a trusted partner in every aspect of business.*
**Customers** 
**are core.** 
  

  

*We strategize, operate, and execute through a customer-centric view. We prioritize the security interests of our customers, and we act as if their data were our own.*
**Innovation** 
**never stops, it only accelerates.** 
  

  

*The speed of change is accelerating. We are committed, through investment and focus, to stay ahead of the innovation curve.*
**We deliver with** 
**agility** 
**.** 
  

  

*We thrive in high-paced and continually changing environments. We navigate through newly added variables, adjust accordingly, while driving towards our strategic goals.*
**United by** 
**respect** 
**.** 
  

  

*Respect for all is what unites us. We promote diversity, inclusivity, equity, and acting with empathy and openness, both in our business and in our communities.*
**Teams** 
**make “it” happen.** 
  

  

*Vision and goals are not individually achievable – they require teamwork. We pride ourselves in operating as a cohesive team, creating promoters and partners, and winning as one.*
  

  

**Keyfactor is a proud equal opportunity employer including but not limited to veterans and individuals with disabilities.** 
  

  

**REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION:** 
 Applicants with disabilities may contact a member of Keyfactor’s People team via people@keyfactor.com and/or telephone at 1.216.785.2990 to request and arrange for accommodations at any time.
   

  

**Keyfactor Privacy Notice**

title: Service Manager - IT Operations
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
****Brinner du för att säkerställa en modern och stabil IT-drift? Vill du vara med och leda vår IT Operations mot en mer proaktiv och kostnadseffektiv framtid?****
****Perfekt! Då är du välkommen att söka rollen som Service Manager - IT Operations hos Best Transport.****
 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som Service Manager - IT Operations får du en nyckelroll i att styra och utveckla vår IT-drift genom strategisk leverantörsstyrning och teknisk kravställning. Vill du arbeta i en föränderlig miljö där du driver förbättringar och säkerställer en modern IT-infrastruktur?
   

  

 Du blir en del av en mindre, effektiv IT-organisation där du jobbar nära vår CIO, verksamhet och IT team. Rollen är placerad på vårt huvudkontor vid Globen, och det kommer förekomma resor inom Norden (Norge och Danmark samt inom Sverige) för att bygga relationer och förstå IT-miljöer på olika kontor.
   

  

 Du Kommer Att Ansvara För Kravställning, Uppföljning Och Kvalitetssäkring Av Best Transports Outsourcade IT Tjänster Hos Samtliga Drift- Och – Systemleverantörer Samt Säkerställa Att IT-driften Är Modern, Proaktiv Och Kostnadseffektiv. Här Kommer Du Bl.a.
   

  

* Ansvara för leverantörsstyrningen där du styr och optimerar leverantörers leveranser enligt avtal och SLA
* Definiera och följa upp tekniska krav på IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, servrar och SaaS-lösningar för att säkerställa optimerad driftmiljö
* Säkerställer regelefterlevnad inom IT-säkerhet (NIS2, GDPR, ISO 27001/27002)
* Optimerar IT-kostnader, licenshantering och resursallokering
* Leda och samordna IT-relaterade projekt och förbättringsinitiativ


 Om dig
   

  

 Vi söker dig med minst fem års erfarenhet inom IT Operations, IT Service Management eller IT-drift. Du har en god teknisk förståelse för IT-infrastruktur, nätverk och molntjänster som Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud. Erfarenhet av ITIL-processer samt att hantera externa IT-driftleverantörer. Dessutom är du van vid att arbeta med IT-säkerhet, IAM och regelverk.
   

  

 Som person är du analytisk, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Du kan ställa krav på leverantörer och förklara tekniska frågor på ett pedagogiskt sätt för både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter. Du tar egna initiativ, arbetar strukturerat och är trygg i att fatta beslut i kritiska situationer.
   

  

 Det här erbjuder vi
   

  

 🍎🍐🍊På vår arbetsplats ska du som jobbar växa, ha kul men framförallt – du ska vara dig själv! På Best är vi eniga om att mångfald är en nyckel till framgång och att vi får en roligare arbetsplats när vi som arbetar tillsammans har olika bakgrund.
   

  

 🌍 Best har ett stort hållbarhetsfokus, både gällande miljö, schyssta villkor och ekonomisk hållbarhet. Engagemanget för hållbarhet genomsyrar vår organisation och våra medarbetare medverkar aktivt till att vi ska uppnå våra högt uppsatta mål. Vi tror att du som också tycker hållbarhet är viktigt kommer trivas hos oss!
   

  

 👩‍💻🔮🤖 Best är en platt och snabbfotad organisation med stort driv och eftersom vi hela tiden växer finns det stora utvecklingsmöjligheter hos oss. Genom vårt dotterbolag Best Labs säkerställer vi att vi hela tiden ligger i framkant när det gäller innovativa tech-lösningar och verktyg som bland annat underlättar arbetsvardagen för oss som jobbar på Best.
   

  

 🧡 Vi erbjuder ett attraktivt jobb på ett framgångsrikt och lönsamt logistikbolag. Best har kollektivavtal med Biltrafikens Arbetsgivareförbund och vi erbjuder våra medarbetare friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Best har sedan 1976 erbjudit företag prisvärda logistiklösningar och är idag en ledande aktör i Norden inom last-mile. Företaget utför dagligen, med hjälp av innovativa tech-lösningar, tiotusentals snabba och hållbara expressleveranser och distributionsuppdrag i Sverige, Norge och Danmark.
   

  

 Best har med sitt express- och distributionserbjudande kunder inom vitt skilda branscher och av varierande storlek. Företaget är även specialiserat inom ett antal koncept såsom logistik för E-commerce, Servicelogistik och Healthcare-logistik.
   

  

 Best är idag logistikbranschens klarast lysande hållbarhetsprofil, framför allt tack vare den fossilfria fordonsflottan där elbilarna snabbt ökar i antal och företagets fokus på schyssta villkor och krav på kollektivavtal.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm, Globen
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

**Lön:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan
   

  

 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Du söker tjänsten enkelt via länken nedan som tar dig vidare till Ada Digitals hemsida.

title: Digital Transformation Lead
description:
BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. In fact, our market share is higher than all our competitors’ combined. Today, we manufacture close to 2,000 spreaders of all types every year and our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports world- wide.
   

  

 BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.
   

  

 More information about BROMMA can be found on www.bromma.com
   

  

**About Bromma**
 Bromma is the industry’s most experienced spreader manufacturer, recognized globally for crane spreaders known for their exceptional reliability. Since the 1960s, over 20,000 crane spreaders and rotators have been put into service. Today, Bromma manufactures nearly 2,000 spreaders of various types annually. In fact, anywhere you go, if you work in container handling, you are likely to see a Bromma spreader in action.
   

  

**Make Your Next Move Count**
 Are you a driven and innovative digital transformation professional with a passion for technology? If so, this role at Bromma could be your next career move!
   

  

 We are looking for a Digital Transformation Architect to join our team in Kista, Stockholm. In this role, you will lead the digitalization of the cargo handling industry by defining and executing Bromma’s digital strategy. You will play a key role in shaping our enterprise information management (IM) landscape while driving transformation initiatives to enhance our operations.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Digital Transformation Architect at Bromma, you will work closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors to:
   

  

* Develop and execute Bromma’s IM architecture strategy across the entire digital landscape
* Lead major technology transitions, including a global ERP modernization, enhancements to service delivery tools, and process improvements
* Own Bromma’s data and analytics strategy, with a focus on Google Cloud Platform products (e.g., Data Studio, Connected Sheets), including hands-on development of new capabilities
* Improve Bromma’s data models and drive increased integration across platforms and processes
* Implement and optimize AI-driven capabilities to enhance business operations
* Work with a diverse technology stack, including SAP, Hybris eCommerce, Salesforce, Tacton CPQ, Jira Service Desk, and various custom and legacy applications.


**Why Join Bromma?**
 At Bromma, we believe in our people—our team is what truly makes the difference. We foster a collaborative culture, working closely with customers, keeping our promises, and tackling challenges together. We want everyone to feel valued and free to be themselves because your uniqueness is your strength. At Bromma, you belong.
   

  

**Joining Us Means**
* Being part of an international, innovative environment where you can grow and thrive
* Working with great colleagues from diverse backgrounds who share ambitious goals
* Contributing to the future of digitalization in the cargo handling industry.


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
 We are looking for a candidate with significant experience leading digital transformation in large, international enterprises. The ideal candidate will have:Extensive experience in IM architecture and digitalization strategy.
   

  

* Background in IT environments within industrial manufacturing companies
* Broad expertise in enterprise applications and hands-on analytics development (especially Google Analytics and Google Workspace tools)
* Proven track record in IT project management and Agile project delivery methods
* A MSc or BSc degree in Engineering or a related field
* Fluency in Swedish and English (English is our corporate language).


**Additional Information**
 We believe diversity drives innovation and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, including women in technology and individuals from diverse backgrounds.
   

  

 We support hybrid work arrangements, offering flexibility to balance office and remote work.
   

  

 For more information, please contact Joakim Heijbel, Director Digitalisation and Sustainability, via email: joakim.heijbel@bromma.com.
   

  

 If this opportunity excites you, apply by 29.04.2025. Interviews may begin before the closing date, so we encourage early applications.
   

  

 Bromma is part of Kalmar Solutions. Learn more at www.kalmarglobal.com.
   

  

 Bromma is part of Kalmar.
   

  

**About Kalmar**
 Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki: KALMAR) is moving goods in critical supply chains around the world, with the vision to be the forerunner in sustainable material handling equipment and services. The company offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,200 people. In 2024, the company's sales totalled approximately EUR 1.7 billion. www.kalmarglobal.com

title: IT Security Engineer
description:
**About the team:**
 The Schibsted Media Cyber Security team is looking for an IT Security Engineer to protect the organization and the publishers along their mission for free and independent press. Located in Sweden, the team is responsible for designing, building and maintaining core cybersecurity tools and services for the company and journalists as well as supporting the development of safe products and services to our customers. We are part of the tech department, the cybersecurity team collaborates with the other part of the organisation: journalists, editors, IT, AI, legal, infrastructure, network, user devices, collaboration software, …
   

  

**What will you do in this role?**
 As an IT Security Engineer, you will be responsible for the development of critical IT Security functions within the company. In this role, you will be analysing, designing, implementing, and maintaining security solutions to protect our organisation's IT infrastructure and assets. Your expertise will be vital in ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our systems and data.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities will be to:
   

  

* Perform security assessments and identify areas for improvements and designing strategies to mitigate risks effectively.
* Drive and improve enterprise-wide security initiatives, including threat detection and prevention systems, incident response functions, and vulnerability management
* Engage in Incident Response in collaboration with NOC & SOC to mitigate and investigate security incidents using threat hunting and digital forensics methodology.
* Design and implement robust security systems and architectures, including network segmentation, firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, VPNs, and endpoint protection solutions.
* Improve security monitoring of the network , cloud, IAM and endpoint system environment to detect and prevent threats quicker and more accurately.
* Perform security due-diligence of and define security procedures towards external vendors and third party providers to prevent supply-chain threats.
* Write security documentation, including policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
* Collaborate with external auditors and regulatory bodies to facilitate security audits and assessments.
* Contribute to the development of security training and education programs tailored to e.g. journalists and developers.
* Depending on your experience, provide guidance and mentorship to junior security team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development.


**Key competencies:**
* Strong academic background within the areas of cyber security, computer science or other relevant field
* 1-3 years of experience in an IT Security role, with practical experience in implementing security controls and technologies.
* Proficiency in network and system administration, with hands-on experience managing security tools and technologies such as SIEM, DLP, EDR, and vulnerability scanning tools.
* Strong understanding of networking protocols, operating systems, and cloud computing platforms, with the ability to analyse and troubleshoot security-related issues.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks effectively.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Nice to have:**
* Relevant certifications such as CompTIA Security+, GHEC or CEH would be appreciated.
* A good understanding of the threat landscape of a media house.
* Systems programming experience such as Python or Go.
* Experience provisioning and maintaining cloud environments through IaC frameworks such as Terraform.
* Previous experience working with EDR, vulnerability scanners or SIEM.
* Experience working with threat intelligence for tactical and strategic improvements.

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
At Board, we power financial and operational planning solutions for the world’s best brands. Thousands of enterprises use our technology to optimize resources, drive growth, and ensure profitability. With advanced analytics and forecasting, plus AI-driven insights, customers transform complex, real-time data into actionable intelligence.
 



  





 What’s been key to our success? Our people—we value everyone’s unique perspective and energy they bring to the organization. We collaborate openly across teams and borders. We embrace a growth mindset to get results. And we celebrate shared success as goals and milestones are achieved.
 



  





 Ready to join a team where innovation meets collaboration? If you're driven by bold ideas and a customer-centric mentality, your next adventure starts here!
 



  





 Board is looking for a results-driven Enterprise Account Executive to join our team as part of our continued expansion in the Nordics.
 



  





 Reporting to the VP Sales, the successful candidate will work with our Marketing, Business Development, Pre-Sales, Alliances, Professional Services teams and Business Partners to drive license revenue in new-name and installed based accounts, focusing on our Enterprise Sales business in the Nordic Region to be based out of
 **Sweden (preferably Stockholm).** 




  





**Main duties:** 



* Gain a broad understanding of the Board platform to effectively position the value proposition of our comprehensive solutions to your Named Account list.
* Manage and own the full sales cycle from prospecting, qualification and contract negotiations
* Build and maintain a pipeline of high-quality opportunities by leveraging our Business Development team, as well as through outbound territory development
* Meet and exceed sales targets within your assigned territory through the effective management of multiple simultaneous sales cycles
* Work successfully in a team environment to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success



  





**What we look for:** 



* Proven experience in Enterprise Sales for CPM/EPM, ERP, BI or Saas software solutions
* Experience selling FP&A, S&OP, IBP, Supply and Demand Planning or Retail Planning solutions is preferable
* Familiarity with Budgeting, Planning, and Forecasting processes, Business Analytics, Data Visualization, Data Management, and Financial Reporting
* Technical aptitude to learn the Board platform and explain complex solutions
* A self-starter who works well within a strong team culture while independently managing their own work
* Proven ability to meet and exceed a sales quota
* Outstanding communication skills
* Experience working with Salesforce.com
* Fluent in Swedish



  





**Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion** 




 Join a company that believes in the added value of diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We foster a working environment in which all people are respected and valued, for all aspects which make them unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!
 



  





**Board International is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.**

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 








**About the Product & Tech Organisation** 









 Our Product & Technology organisation drives the development of Trustly’s products. The cross functional teams collectively work with innovative ideas, development of products and platform and set the vision and strategy for the problem spaces they own. The Product & Tech organisation consists of a bit more than 200 people spread across Stockholm, Lisbon, Örebro, Paris, London and Izmir.
 









 All teams consist of a product manager, an engineering manager, a lead developer and engineers. Some teams also have designers and analytics competence in the team. They all work closely together to enable new products and features within existing products within Europe and to make sure the payment platform runs without interruptions and with high performance.
 









 We are now looking to strengthen our engineering capacity within Product & Technology with one more senior position. We operate in an agile culture combined with DevOps, allowing our teams to take on full responsibility from code to on-call.
 








**About the Role** 









 As an
 
**Engineering Manager** 

 at Trustly, you will play a crucial role in leading and supporting an agile team of talented engineers. Working closely with product managers, lead developers, and other stakeholders, you’ll ensure delivery of high-quality, scalable, and reliable systems while fostering a positive and empowering team culture. This is an excellent opportunity to bridge technical excellence and people management, delivering real impact in the payments industry.
 











**What you'll do** 
* **Team Leadership** 
 : Lead, coach, and support a team of engineers, enabling them to perform at their best while fostering a culture of collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning
* **Delivery Excellence** 
 : Drive successful delivery of the team’s commitments, ensuring alignment with domain objectives and product goals
* **Technical Collaboration** 
 : Work hands-on with lead developers and engineers to design, implement, and maintain scalable systems and solutions aligned with Trustly’s technical standards
* **Product Partnership** 
 : Work closely with the product manager to define and prioritise the team’s roadmap, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision
* **Operational Ownership** 
 : Ensure your team’s systems operate reliably in production, with high performance, availability, and maintainability
* **Talent Development** 
 : Recruit, onboard, and mentor engineers, creating an environment where they can grow and thrive
* **Process Improvement** 
 : Advocate for and implement best practices in agile methodologies, DevOps, and engineering processes to continuously improve team effectiveness






**Who you are** 
* Proven experience managing engineering teams in agile environments, with a strong focus on team empowerment and delivery
* Hands-on engineering background with expertise in Java and experience in building scalable, robust systems
* Familiarity with modern tech stacks including Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, and Spring Boot
* Experience working with cloud solutions (preferably AWS), monitoring, and analytics
* Knowledge of service-based architecture and microservices
* Strong ability to balance technical decisions with business needs, ensuring delivery without sacrificing scalability, performance, or reliability
* Committed to fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence
* Passion for DevOps practices and ownership, with a track record of driving improvements in automation and monitoring
* Exceptional communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills
* Fluent in English






**At Trustly, you’ll have the opportunity to:** 
* Shape the future of payments as part of a global leader in the industry
* Work with cutting-edge technology and highly skilled colleagues in an agile and collaborative environment
* Take on a role with real impact, where your contributions directly drive the success of your team and Trustly’s mission
* Enjoy a supportive and dynamic culture that encourages growth, innovation, and ownership










  



 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.

title: Junior Client Executive | SEB Boye Advisory, Stockholm
description:
Boye Advisory är ett administrativt Family Office som hanterar finansiell administration för kunder och bolag och ägs sedan år 2024 av SEB. Sedan starten 1856 har SEBs fokus på långsiktiga kundrelationer varit framgångskonceptet. Och nu söker vi dig – en Junior Client Executive som vill arbeta i ett inkluderande och prestigelöst team med affären i fokus. Vi tror på att erbjuda kapital som främjar en hållbar framtid och på att hjälpa privatpersoner och företag att uppnå sina mål. På så sätt kan vi fortsätta vara en positiv drivkraft i samhället.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Är du en administrativ, strukturerad och engagerad person med hög känsla för service och ett öga för detaljer? Som Junior Client Executive hos Boye Advisory får du möjlighet att axla en varierande roll med ansvar för ett proffsigt mottagande, koordinering, administration.
   

  

 Som Junior Client Executive kommer du att stötta upp kundansvarig och har möjlighet att utvecklas inom bokföring, rapportering och finansiell administration.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av:
   

  

* Koordinera, säkerställa och följa upp administration
* Enklare löpande bokföring
* Vara en kontaktperson för leverantörer
* Administration åt Boye Advisorys kunder


 Detta är en koordinerande roll med varierande arbetsuppgifter i ett högt tempo. För att lyckas i den här rollen är du en person som är van att ta eget ansvar men även uppskattar att jobba i team. Du är en prestigelös person som trivs i en miljö där det är högt och lågt, du har förmågan att kavla upp ärmarna och se vad som behöver göras samtidigt som du även hanterar komplexa uppgifter och problem.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har en akademisk utbildning inom ekonomi eller motsvarande
* Trivs i en koordinerade roll med varierande arbetsuppgifter
* Har hög integritet, då du kommer i kontakt med mycket sekretessbelagd information
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift då det används i den dagliga kommunikationen
* Har du ett genuint intresse inom ekonomi och finans, samt erfarenhet av enklare bokföring ses som meriterande


 Vi ser att du är en person som är noggrann, kommunikativ, flexibel samt tycker det är givande att lösa problem. Vidare är du proaktiv och service-minded vilket betyder att du gör det lilla extra för dina kunder. Det här är en dynamisk roll som kräver att du är flexibel och kan anpassa dig till olika spännande situationer.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder:**
* En flexibel roll och arbetsmiljö som främjar kompetensutveckling för rätt person
* Ambitiösa kollegor med en gedigen kompetens och ett familjärt kontor i centrala Stockholm
* En spännande kundportfölj och ett exklusivt kundnätverk


**Vill du bli en del av Boye Advisory?**
 Det är vår djupa övertygelse att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framgång. Vi strävar efter att ha en inkluderande, värdedriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och delaktiga oavsett vem de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.
   

  

 Då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum är du välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag, men senast den 1 april 2025. Om du har frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Madeleine Gustâv, Talent Acquisition Partner, på madeleine.gustav@seb.se
   

  

 Observera att våra slutkandidater genomgår bakgrundskontroller. Denna process inkluderar exempelvis identitetskontroll, verifiering av kvalifikationer, kreditkontroller, företagsengagemang och kontroll av brottsregister. Även slumpmässiga drogtester kan genomföras.

title: Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift
description:
**Vill du vara med och driva Sveriges energiomställning som Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift**
 Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. För att möta framtidens utmaningar bygger vi en robust och innovativ infrastruktur där vår OpenShift-plattform spelar en central roll. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.
   

  

 Vi är i dag ca 600 personer på IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer. Vi söker nu en
 **Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift** 
 till vår enhet ”containerteknik och drift”, för att stötta våra utvecklingsteam och övrig verksamhet att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential.
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Som Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift har du en nyckelroll i att stödja våra interna utvecklingsteam och intressenter inom verksamheten i deras resa att implementera och optimera sina lösningar eller färdiga system på plattformen. Genom att kombinera din tekniska expertis med din pedagogiska och kundorienterade approach hjälper du dem att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteam och intressenter för att sätta upp och optimera deployment-processer, automatisera arbetsflöden och stöttar utvecklare med containerisering och applikationsoptimering. Genom att bygga relationer och skapa långsiktigt värde stärker du teamens förmåga att arbeta självständigt och skapar en utvecklingsmiljö som främjar effektivitet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden**
* Stötta utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter i att integrera sina applikationer och arbetsflöden på OpenShift-plattformen.
* Hjälpa till med att sätta upp och optimera deployment av applikationer och CI/CD-pipelines för plattformen.
* Automatisera installation, deployment och livscykelhantering för applikationer och plattformen.
* Agera teknisk rådgivare och bygga relationer med intressenter inom Kubernetes och omkringliggande teknologier.
* Fokusera på kunskapsöverföring och utbildning för att utvecklingsteamen ska bli självgående.


**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig med teknisk erfarenhet och kompetens i kombination med en stark kommunikativ förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad, arbetar strukturerat och hjälper utvecklingsteamen att bli självständiga. Din nyfikenhet och vetgirighet gör att du håller dig uppdaterad och kan vägleda utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential. Dessa egenskaper lägger grunden för det goda samarbetet som är centralt för vår teamdynamik. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare Ser Vi Att Du Har Utbildning Inom Datasystemvetenskap, Systemutveckling Eller Motsvarande Kompetens Förvärvad På Annat Sätt. Du Har Även
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av tekniskt arbete med enterprise Kubernetes-lösningar, OpenShift, inklusive installation, konfiguration och drift av OpenShift-kluster.
* Flerårig praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps-metodik, inklusive CI/CD-pipelines och automation av driftprocesser.
* Djup förståelse för infrastruktur, nätverk och lagringsbehov i medelstora till stora on-premise-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap och förmåga att förklara både tekniska och icke-tekniska komplexa koncept för olika målgrupper vid införandet av containerplattformar.
* Förmåga att skapa långsiktiga relationer med användare genom utbildning, teknisk support, felsökning och uppföljning.


 Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Certifieringar som CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) eller Red Hat OpenShift Administrator/Developer.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg inom OpenShift-ekosystemet, som exempelvis Helm, Operators, Prometheus eller Grafana.
* Kunskap om loggning och övervakning samt erfarenhet av datalager som PostgreSQL och Kafka.


 Bra att veta
   

  

* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg, Stockholm.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-04-14. Vi använder urvalsfrågor och tar därför inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, beredskap kan komma att ingå.


 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Anki Snis, anki.snis@se.experis.com eller Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät, maria.sahlen2@svk.se. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
   

  

 För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Product Area Architect
description:
*Länsförsäkringar befinner sig mitt i en spännande digital transformationsresa – och vi vill ha dig med på resan! Vi bygger framtidens IT-infrastruktur med fokus på automation, self-service och hybridmolnlösningar. Nu söker vi en driven och strategisk Product Area Architect inom Private Cloud Platforms som vill vara med och skapa innovativa och affärsdrivande lösningar.* 




*Vill du forma framtidens digitala infrastruktur?* 




  





**Om jobbet** 




 Som Product Area Architect kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i vår förflyttning mot Hybrid Cloud. Du får chansen att forma och vidareutveckla vår infrastruktur och säkerställa en sammanhållen och effektiv arkitektur i en komplex IT-miljö. Du samarbetar tätt med team och stakeholders för att driva utvecklingen av moderna infrastrukturtjänster som stödjer Länsförsäkringars affärsutveckling.
 



  





 Vår vision är att skapa en flexibel och säker IT-miljö där SD-WAN, SDN, Zero Trust och hybridinfrastrukturtjänster blir nyckelkomponenter. Hos oss får du möjlighet att påverka och forma framtidens IT-lösningar tillsammans med engagerade kollegor i en organisation som satsar på innovation och digitalisering.
 



  





 Dina ansvarsområden:
 


* Ansvara för den övergripande arkitekturen inom hybridmolnplattformar för Compute, Data och Network.
* Stötta produktteam vid utveckling av nya produkter och lösningar samt hålla produktroadmaps uppdaterade.
* Dokumentera och utveckla arkitektur (HLD, LLD) i linje med våra strategiska mål.
* Driva innovation och kontinuerlig utveckling inom IT-infrastruktur med fokus på SDN, SD-WAN, Zero Trust och Global Load Balancing.
* Samarbeta med olika arkitektroller och stakeholders för att säkerställa en effektiv och framtidssäkrad arkitektur.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som brinner för IT-arkitektur, innovation och förändring. Du är en strategisk tänkare som förstår både tekniska och affärsmässiga behov, samt har en naturlig förmåga att skapa trygghet och tydlighet i komplexa förflyttningar.
 



  





 För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:
 


* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som IT-arkitekt med fokus på hybrid IT-infrastruktur (on-prem & public cloud, framför allt Azure).
* Gedigen erfarenhet av SDN, SD-WAN, SASE och Zero Trust.
* Fördjupad kunskap inom serverhårdvara, virtualisering och operativsystem (Linux/Windows).
* Erfarenhet av databasplattformar som Oracle, MongoDB och MSSQL.
* God kännedom om Azure IaaS, PaaS och cloud-native teknologier.
* Ett starkt IT-säkerhetstänk.
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher som bank och försäkring är meriterande.
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.



  





**Om oss** 




 Välkommen till Digital & IT- enheten på Länsförsäkringar AB, vi stolta över att vara i centrum av vår teknologiska utveckling. Vi levererar innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt och säkerställer att vi alltid ligger steget före. Vårt team av dedikerade experter arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket möjliggör för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder. Vi är här för att göra skillnad, varje dag.
 



  





 Gruppen Private Cloud Platforms inom Development Solutions & Operation Platforms levererar tillgängliga, säkra och stabila hybrida IT-infrastrukturtjänster till Länsförsäkringar för att möta nuvarande och framtida behov. Vi befinner oss i centrum av en spännande digital förflyttning som kräver utveckling av agila arbetssätt och nya leveransmodeller. Du kommer att samarbeta med produktteam, Product Owners, Product Experts, samt andra arkitekter inom enheten och rapportera till chefen för Private Cloud Platforms.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan och bli en del av vår resa mot framtidens digitala lösningar!
 



  





**Mer information** 




*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.* 




**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-24**

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Location:** 
 EMEA - Remote
   

  

 Canonical is the global open source solutions provider and the publisher of Ubuntu. Since 2004, Canonical has led the way in providing free open source software solutions, putting innovation in the hands of everyone. Our portfolio of solutions is designed to support enterprises to innovate from the data centre to the edge, leading the way in cloud infrastructure, advanced robotics, and enabling AI, blockchain, autonomous cars, and smart things. We are proud to support the critical infrastructure and operations for thousands of businesses and millions of Ubuntu users worldwide including AT&T, Bloomberg, Netflix, Paypal, Sky, Slack, Spotify and Tmobile.
   

  

 At Canonical, the product marketing team is not just marketing products—we're building the best Go-To-Market (GTM) engine in the open-source world. Our mission is to take the power of open-source innovation and bring it to businesses everywhere, from the data center to the edge. We're growing fast and looking for a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) to join our team—someone who loves technology, thrives in fast-paced environments, and wants to make a global impact.
   

  

 This is a hands-on, multi-disciplinary, and dynamic position, requiring close collaboration with the Product, engineering, content, Sales, and other Marketing teams. The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing, and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of GTM campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity, and a drive to always improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love solving problems, getting hands-on, experimenting, measuring, and using automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

**Why You'll Love This Role**
 You'll own the GTM strategy for key products, shaping messaging and positioning that speaks to developers and enterprise buyers alike.
   

  

 You'll collaborate cross-functionally with product management, sales, regional marketing, content, and partner marketing teams to bring campaigns to life.
   

  

 You'll get creative, crafting compelling advertising, launch plans, and campaigns that make our products stand out in a competitive landscape.
   

  

 You'll measure impact, using data to refine messaging, optimize marketing funnels, and drive customer engagement.
   

  

 You'll be part of a truly global team, working with colleagues in over 85 countries in a fully remote, high-performance environment.
   

  

**As a product marketing manager, you will:**
* Develop and execute go-to-market (GTM) strategies for a range of products.
* Lead messaging and positioning efforts ensuring our products stand out in a competitive market.
* Lead content planning with product managers —from website copy to whitepapers, blogs, and sales enablement materials.
* Collaborate on marketing campaigns, partnering with regional marketing teams to execute integrated campaigns that drive pipeline growth.
* Launch new products and features, leading cross-functional teams to drive awareness and adoption.
* Run competitive analysis, staying ahead of market trends and evolving our positioning accordingly.
* Support the customer success team on driving customer engagement and growth, working on strategies to upsell and cross-sell across our customer base.
* Plan and execute global events, live webinars, and community meetups that align with our GTM priorities.


**The successful PMM will have :**
* Experience in product marketing for enterprise software, cloud, DevOps, or open-source solutions.
* A passion for technology and open source—you get excited about innovation, software, and community-driven development.
* Strong storytelling skills—you know how to craft messaging that resonates with both technical and business audiences.
* Experience with demand generation, understanding how to translate GTM strategies into pipeline growth.
* Comfort working cross-functionally with product, sales, partners, and marketing teams.
* Data-driven mindset, using insights to refine strategies and improve performance.
* Growth mindset—someone who thrives on experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**What Canonical Offers**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 602

title: RAN Solution Engineer
description:
We are now looking for a RAN Solution Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm! In this role you will mostly be working with customers in Stockholm, but some traveling to customers in other Nordic countries will be expected. Are you our next RAN solution expert?
 *Get the future you want and apply today!*
**Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and implementation of RAN networks, including LTE, and 5G NR (New Radio) technologies.
* Oversee the deployment and integration of RAN nodes (e.g., eNBs, gNBs, RRU, BBU, Small Cells) into existing networks. Ensure proper network functionality and performance or worked in past for these kinds of roles.
* Design, validate, and implement 5G architecture and next-gen technologies (e.g., Carrier Aggregation (CA), MIMO, Massive MIMO, beamforming, Network Slicing).
* Provide input into the strategic planning of future RAN technologies. Lead initiatives in network automation, cloud-native RAN, and virtualized RAN (vRAN),
* Support pre-sales team and Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Ability to deliver presentations and demonstrations confidently to technical and non-technical audiences
* Work closely with core network engineers, backhaul engineers, and service providers to ensure seamless integration of RAN with the broader network.
* Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements and standards for network deployment and operations.
* Undertake technical ownership and responsibility for small to medium sized opportunities and accounts
* Drive the pre-sales discussions, presentations and customer meetings


**Required Skills & Qualifications**
* Min 10 years in RAN design, optimization, and troubleshooting, with at least 5 years of experience in 5G/LTE technologies.
* Strong understanding of 4G LTE, 5G NR, including radio interface protocols, PHY/MAC layers, and eNB/gNB configurations.
* Expertise in 5G NR technology, 5G core network integration, network slicing, and related 5G innovations (e.g., massive MIMO, beamforming, Carrier Aggregation).

title: Python Engineer (banking)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 As a Python Engineer in a banking environment, you will be responsible for the development of Python programs using pure Python, pandas, and polars. You will design and implement solutions, as well as provide support and maintenance to meet business requirements. Additionally, you will develop and maintain metadata, user access, and security controls. Providing technical support for users and resolving system issues is also a key part of the role. Furthermore, you will develop and maintain technical documentation, including data models, process flows, and system diagrams.
   

  

**Your profile**
* 6+ years of experience in Python programming language and proficient in working with 3rd party libraries like pandas and polars.
* Skilled in orchestration, cache techniques, APIs and working on cloud platforms.
* Experienced in solutioning and architecting applications.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Fluency in Swedish and experience in financial services or the insurance industry is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* We keep everyone connected, with learning activities and social events. With the freedom to grow, you get access to a wide range of our global comprehensive training programs.
* We focus on inclusion and embrace and empower talent in all its diverse forms and origins.
* We are valuing work-life balance with flexible working arrangements in order for you to balance your work life with your personal life.


**Application**
 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. title: Quantitative Developer - Energy Market
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Quantitative Developer
 **.**
**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Quantitative Developer, you will be responsible for setting up and maintaining the infrastructure and pipelines needed to host our trading algorithms. Working alongside a team of skilled data scientists, engineers, and developers, you will contribute to the development and deployment of the algorithms that form the core of our energy trading operations. Our tech stack includes Python, Golang, AWS, and Databricks.
   

  

 You will be part of the Trading domain, collaborating with technical colleagues such as data scientists, engineers, and developers, as well as engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across and beyond the Trading team. Your work will play a key role in one of the most important areas of Flower’s expansion.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and maintain scalable pipelines and infrastructure for deploying, version-controlling, and backtesting trading execution and optimization algorithms.
* Collaborate with ML Engineers and Software Developers to set up the necessary infrastructure.
* Work closely with data scientists and market experts to develop and implement trading algorithms in the energy sector.
* Partner with Data Engineers to ensure the ingestion of logs and data from algorithmic trading into our data platform, defining data contracts that align with regulatory standards in the energy sector.


**Who You Are**
* 3+ years of experience deploying and maintaining algorithmic trading models.
* Strong programming skills in languages commonly used in data science, such as Python, R, or Julia.
* Expertise in building and maintaining MLOps solutions for algorithmic model deployment in the cloud.
* Familiarity with infrastructure-as-code best practices and tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Experience setting up and maintaining backtesting environments for algorithmic trading.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, self-driven approach.
* Effective communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to a range of audiences.
* Experience developing algorithmic trading execution algorithms is a plus.
* Background in the energy or financial sector is a plus.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner, Squad Head, Data Scientists and our CEO.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*
