title: Sales Director CVX Ventures Sweden
description:
**Jobbeskrivning -** 
**Sales Director CVX Ventures Sweden**
 Trivs du i en snabb och dynamisk miljö där du får stort ansvar? Vill du vara en del av ett exceptionellt entreprenörsteam med unga, motiverade och drivna individer? Är du nyfiken på eller har en passion för venture capital? I så fall kan du vara vår nya Sales Director i Sverige.
   

  

**Ditt Mission**
 Som Sales Director blir du den första personen på plats för att bygga upp och leda vår svenska försäljningsverksamhet i Stockholm. Detta är en hands-on roll där du ansvarar för att bygga upp och underhålla en stark försäljningspipeline, säkerställa korrekt prognostisering och slutföra affärer i tid. Du har förmågan att arbeta med försäljning både strategiskt och operativt, och du behärskar en konsultativ försäljningsprocess.
   

  

**Vårt Mission**
 CVX är en av Europas snabbast växande riskkapitalaktörer, på väg att bli Europas största riskinvesterare genom att erbjuda snabbväxande bolag kapital, kunskap och nätverk.
   

  

 Vi drivs av tron att de bästa investerarna är de som kan ge grundare rätt kunskap, erfarenhet och nätverk för specifika skeden och branscher. CVX investerar alltid tillsammans med de bästa affärsänglarna för varje enskild grundare.
   

  

 Idag har CVX över 600 partners som investerar och bidrar till bolag där de kan göra verklig skillnad. CVX består nu av 20 ambitiösa individer i Köpenhamn, London, Oslo – och snart även i Stockholm.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Utveckla och implementera din försäljningsstrategi
* Driva försäljning och kontinuerligt nå och överträffa intäktsmål
* Rekrytera, utveckla och leda ett förstklassigt säljteam när dina försäljningsmål är uppnådda
* Delta i budgetarbete och sätta mål för organisationen
* Följa upp KPI:er och utveckla handlingsplaner för att förbättra resultaten
* Driva investeringsprocessen från prospektering till investering
* Representera CVX vid evenemang, konferenser och sammankomster
* Samarbeta nära med andra i organisationen
* Rapportera direkt till CEO.


**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet gärna inom riskkapital, snabbväxande startups eller dynamiska miljöer
* Naturlig förmåga att sälja och framgångar med att nå och överträffa intäktsmål
* Hög arbetsmoral och "sense of urgency"
* Exceptionell drivkraft och vilja vara bäst på det du gör
* Proaktivitet och förmåga att ta ägandeskap för allt du gör
* Stark förmåga att skapa samarbete och tillit mellan människor, samt vinna förtroende hos affärsledare
* Starkt intresse för riskkapital och startups
* Starka kommunikationsförmågor på lednings- och styrelsenivå
* Utmärkta analytiska och problemlösande färdigheter
* Ödmjukhet och med en passion för att bygga och utveckla nya verksamheter
* Flytande svenska och engelska
* Stort plus om du har ett nätverk inom det svenska startup-ekosystemet.


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Som Sales Director hos oss får du en resa fylld med personlig utveckling, karriärmöjligheter och tillväxt. Du blir en del av en organisation med stark laganda och ambitiösa kollegor.
   

  

* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med ambitiösa och talangfulla kollegor
* En kultur präglad av kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling
* Möjlighet att ha direkt inverkan på CVX och portföljbolagens framgång
* Coaching och utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Kombination av fast lön och resultatbaserade incitament.


**Startdatum:** 
 Så snart som möjligt.

description:

title: Mechanical Designer - Tender Prepartion
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0083512
**Date Posted:**

2025-03-18
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

As a Mechanical Designer for Tender Preparation, you will engage in a variety of engineering disciplines, including electrical, mechanical, chemical, civil, structural, automation, and software engineering. Your role will encompass discipline engineering and design, planning, risk assessments, and the coordination of resources such as personnel and equipment.


“ *In this position, you'll have the opportunity to engage in creative problem-solving and handle dynamic tasks that require quick decision-making. You'll be encouraged to think about the bigger picture and work on unique tenders, each presenting its own set of challenges and opportunities. As the first in the engineering chain, you'll be at the forefront of discovering market trends and new requirements, making this role both exciting and impactful* .” - Sofia Olin, Engineering Manager


**How you’ll make an impact**

* Ensure engineering is developed with complete and multidisciplinary information, leading the development of new solutions for complex projects and challenges, and driving the completion of all engineering activities on the project.
* Coordinate engineering disciplines across several projects, providing technical support for testing, installation, and commissioning activities, and designing and conducting experiments, analyzing, and interpreting data.
* Prepare complete project documents in the area of responsibility, acting as a design authority for a particular engineering discipline, and completing engineering assignments for that discipline.
* Deliver cost-effective quality solutions within budget and contract, ensuring adherence to safety standards, and mitigating potential risks.
* Create work plans and cost estimates, reviewing and approving scope, budget, and schedule for assignments.
* Interact directly with customers, officials, contractors, and the supply chain.

**Your background**

* Previous experience from mechanical plant design for HVDC converter station tenders, including the preparation of tender documents and design concepts according to customer specifications, applicable standards, and internal HE requirements.
* Experience from 3D modeling of equipment layouts and design coordination with various internal and external disciplines.
* Experience working with Bill of Quantities and engineering hours cost sheets.
* Proficiency with CAD tools such as Siemens NX and PLM systems like Team Center.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development

Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you! Applications will be screened on an ongoing basis so we encourage you to apply today.


Recruiting manager Sofia Olin, sofia.olin@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com

title: Associate Principal Scientist - Modelling and Simulation
description:
At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicines, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.

 **In** **Pharmaceutical Technology & Development** **(PT&D)**, within AstraZeneca Operations, we believe that nothing is impossible, and we are determined to push the boundaries of science to deliver medicines to our patients. We combine people’s technical knowledge and understanding with their talent and drive to design, develop and optimise processes that deliver our medicines in a sustainable, commercially viable way. Our ambition is to establish a strong predictive science culture by utilisation of state-of-the art modelling and simulation technologies to carry out our research and experimental work in the most efficient way.


To achieve our bold ambition, we have an open position for an experience scientist/engineer in the **Modelling** **& Simulation team****.**

**The role**


In this role you will join the modelling and simulation team to develop and implement predictive tools to accelerate development of robust drug substance and drug product manufacturing processes. You will work with project teams, process engineers, mathematicians, chemists, pharmacists, materials and data scientists as well as analytical and artificial intelligence experts, to build and validate models, perform in-silico analyses, and interpret results for decision making on projects.

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and utilise digital twins in drug substance and drug product manufacturing process development to establish manufacturing processes as well as de-risk scaleup and tech-transfer by in-silico design space exploration and process optimisation.
* Work closely with modelling and simulation team, subject matter experts and project associates to develop appropriate workflows for utilisation of predictive tools in pharmaceutical development and for exploitation in manufacture.
* Coach and upskill process engineers by delivering trainings/workshops and sharing good practices of using modelling and simulation tools in pharmaceutical development.
* Support defining and establishing model/data standards, workflows for model verification and validation, data collection, experiment conditions and sampling, etc.
* Drive democratisation of modelling and simulation tools by developing automated, documented and verified workflows to make simulation tools accessible to a wider community of process engineers, chemists and pharmacists.
* Keep abreast of global developments in your area by attending relevant events such as conferences, webinars, and workshops and being active member of relevant networks and working groups.
* Ensure access to state-of-the-art tools and technologies through engaging in pre-competitive collaborative projects, initiatives with academia and software vendors, etc.
 **Essential skills and qualifications:**

* PhD or MSc/MEng in chemical engineering, physics, chemistry, mathematics or related discipline.
* A few years post-graduate industrial work experience in a relevant field.
* Experience using modelling and simulation tools like gPROMS, DynoChem, Aspen, Ansys Fluent/CFX, Ansys Rocky or similar software packages in research or industrial projects.
* Strong coding skills and experience of using standard programming languages like Python, MATLAB, etc.
* Ability to build mathematical models of physical/chemical phenomena and solve them using appropriate coding tools.
* Ability to modify/enhance existing models to improve their efficiency/predictability and/or upgrade their functionality for a new context of use.
* Excellent writing and communication skills.
* Cultural awareness
 **Desirable skills:**

* Experience using computational fluid dynamics (CFD) and/or discrete element method (DEM) tools in simulating of complex, multi-physics systems (e.g. multiphase flow).
* Experience with process scale-up and working knowledge of unit operations (e.g. reactors, mixing, distillation, extraction, membrane, chromatography, crystallization, filtration, drying, etc.) in pharmaceutical drug substance manufacturing.
* Experience developing and implementing model-assisted process control (e.g., coupling PSE’s gPROMS and PharmaMV, etc.)
  

At AstraZeneca, we are driven by our commitment to deliver accelerated growth and make people's lives better. We thrive on innovation and collaboration, constantly seeking new challenges and solutions. Our inclusive environment supports personal growth and development while working towards our shared goal of transforming molecules into medicines. With a focus on sustainability and cutting-edge science, we are dedicated to making a positive impact on global health.


Ready to make a difference? Apply, with your CV and cover letter, no later than March 31st 2025!

title: Industrial Engineer to Production Development
description:
*Passionate about making ideas a reality? Join our welcoming world of tech and let your ideas soar.*

Production Development is an organisation with approximately 60 employees, and now growing. Therefor, we are now looking for a open minded person to join Industrial Engineering. This is a new group, in the start of establish ourselves in the organisation.


Your role


You will be a part of a team that is responsible for production development at Saab Surveillance. The Production Developments four key responsibilities are Industrial engineering, Production engineering, Test design and Test Infrastructure. We are responsible for alignment regarding manufacturing set up, development of new products and test equipment including the support of manufacturing production engineering. Your assignment includes manufacturing plans, i.e.: design for assembly, lead time calculations, value stream mapping & FMEA and production flow & layout planning. Your main responsibilities also includes:

* Development of production setups
* Development of production methods and processes
* Taking responsibility for investments and business cases
* Participate or lead implementation of new digital solutions


You will also be involved in cross-functional assignments together with areas such as Manufacturing, Product Development, Customer Projects and Businesses Intelligence.


Your profile


To thrive in this role, we believe that you are a person with your own drive and desire to succeed, but you also need to be able to co-operate with other team members. High demands are placed on your communication skills and flexibility.


We need you to take overall technical responsibility within our industrialization process when new products are introduced in our production and if necessary create new production lines.


Required skills:

* Master or Bachelor degree within areas such as Production, Manufacturing, Logistics and Industrial Engineering
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, verbal and written
* Competence in software’s like Microsoft Office 365, JIRA
* General interest of technical products and solutions


Desired skills:

* Knowledge in FMEA and simulation tools such as DES
* Experience of CAD software
* Experience with working in ERP/PLM-systems (such as IFS)
* Open to learn new software’s and tools


It is meritorious if you have experience from industry 4.0 with special focus on digitalization and automatization of production processes or/and experience from working with smart factories and connected production enviroments.

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*


What you will be part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here


Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.


If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Shape the Future of Robotics and Data Platforms as a Product Manager at Rerun**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


At Rerun, we’re building a new multimodal data stack for robotics and spatial AI. Large parts of the physical-world economy will be transformed by these technologies, and we're developing the data infrastructure and tools that make it possible. Rerun’s open-source project focuses on visualizing and handling multimodal logs and is already loved by some of the best teams in the world.


We’re looking for a technical and content-savvy Product Manager to work closely with founders, engineers, and design partners to drive product coordination and communication. This is a hands-on execution role—perfect for someone with a strong engineering background, solid product management experience, and a track record of effective communication through writing, blogging, or open-source contributions.

**What You’ll Work On**
-----------------------


As a Product Manager at Rerun, you’ll:

* Own product coordination, in particular keeping a track of product needs emerging from design partners and ensuring we are meeting them effectively.
* Translate the existing product vision into a clear, actionable plan by collaborating with founders and engineers to structure priorities and drive execution.
* Manage product communications through writing product updates, maintaining design partner communication (e.g., update emails), and ensuring transparency around new versions and feature developments.
* Collaborate with the team to support sales and marketing efforts such as creating compelling marketing copy, sales materials, and product documentation for external stakeholders.
* Immerse yourself in our product and technology, gain a deep understanding of our tech stack, and actively test and refine what we’re building.
* Bridge technical and commercial needs by interpreting customer contracts and technical requirements, ensuring alignment between business and engineering priorities.
* Maintain an active presence in the open-source and robotics community by writing technical reports, contributing to discussions, and driving thought leadership within the AI and robotics ecosystem.

**We’d Love It If You Have**
----------------------------

* A strong engineering background with prior experience as an engineer before transitioning into product management.
* Proven experience in product management, in a fast-paced environment, ideally at an early-stage startup or a high-growth company.
* Proven ability optimising execution and streamlining processes to turn established product visions into reality— you love rolling up your sleeves to make things happen, driving execution and smooth processes from the engine room rather than steering from the helm!
* Market experience in AI, robotics, or physical AI, with a background in self-driving, drones, robotics, or similar deep-tech industries and a strong understanding of customer needs.
* Excellent communication and writing skills, with a track record of blogging, technical writing, or creating content that translates complex topics into clear, engaging narratives.
* You thrive in an early-stage, high-agency environment, thriving in a fast-moving setting with highly skilled engineers who resist excessive process-heavy structures.
* Timezone alignment – Ideally based in Europe (used to working with West Coast customers) or US East Coast (Boston area preferred).

**How we work at Rerun**
------------------------

* We're a remote company headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.
* We meet up in person for a week roughly once a quarter
* The team you'll join currently has members in European and US-east timezones


	+ Everyone is available for synchronous work between 1:30 and 5pm CET
	+ This is a new sub-team so for the right candidate we are open shifting this sync-time window to better accommodate the US west coast
* We've put together an uncommonly talented tech team, value agency and helpfulness highly, and expect everyone to take broad responsibility for what they build
* We offer competitive cash and equity compensation, six weeks paid vacation, and whatever hardware and software you need to do your job

title: Analysis Leader
description:
**Fantastic challenges. Amazing opportunities.**

  


GKN Aerospace is reimagining air travel: going further, faster and greener! Fuelled by great people whose expertise and creativity sets the standards in our industry, we’re inspired by the opportunities to innovate and break boundaries. We’re proud to play a part in protecting the world’s democracies. And we’re committed to putting sustainability at the centre of everything we do, opening up and protecting our planet. With over 16,000 employees across 33 manufacturing sites in 12 countries we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers and achieved sales of £3.35 bn.in 2023. There are no limits to where you can take your career.


**Job Summary**
---------------



The role involves leading, planning, reviewing, communicating, and enhancing the work within your solid mechanics team, as well as performing advanced solid mechanical simulations yourself.


You are a skilled solid mechanical engineer with experience in GKN aerospace products. You have extensive expertise in ANSYS and are adept at understanding complex structural mechanics and scripting challenges. You possess the ability to make sound judgments and have a strong interest in leading and developing a team and its members.


The primary focus will be to establish conditions that maximize the team's potential and output.  



**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Responsible for the project's analysis deliverables, ensuring quality and timeliness.
* Establish a team organization that maximizes learning, quality, and throughput.
* Lead the solid mechanics team to achieve these goals.
* Plan the team's work, ensuring an even distribution of the workload.
* Develop a thorough understanding of the product’s legacy, including past actions and methods, to inform current and future work.
* Ensure proper documentation of technical results and present these results both internally and externally.
* Maintain the continuous airworthiness of our certified products by analyzing field events and proposing actions.
* Continuously improve team management and organization, as well as communication with customers and suppliers.


**Candidate Profile**
---------------------



You are a mechanical engineer with a deep understanding of the structural integrity of structures and cases. You are a problem solver who feels energized when facing technical challenges. You can easily move from details to the big picture and overall trends. You have the experience to judge what needs to be done and what does not.  

You are also a leader with a strong interest in maintaining plans, following up on progress, and presenting results to customers. Most of all you have the ability to inspire, motivate, and guide team members. You have an ability to create plans that are easy to understand, follow, track, and adjust, with natural milestones, moderately detailed.  



**Job Qualifications**
----------------------

  

* You hold a Master's degree in Applied Mechanics or a related field.
* Your knowledge in solid mechanics and material science is robust, allowing you to tackle challenges


 related to structural integrity, material properties, and component performance.  

* You have experience with ANSYS software.
* You can easily move from details to the big picture and overall trends.
* Ability to inspire, motivate, and guide team members towards common goals.
* You have an ability to create plans that are easy to understand, follow, track, and adjust,


 with natural milestones, moderately detailed.  

  

The recruitmet process is ongoing, therfore do not wait to send in your application.

  


**Type of employment**  

Permanent contract

  

  

**Place of employment and travel requirements**  

This position is based in Trollhättan, Sweden, as such, the applicant should be able to gain the right to live and work in Sweden. Travel to other locations within Sweden as well as EU is expected.

  

  

**Date for employment**  

To be agreed. Target: May, 2025

  

  

**For more information please contact**  

Rikard Nedar | Department Manager | GKN Aerospace Engine Systems Sweden. rikard.nedar@gknaerospace.com  



*The position requires that you undergo and be approved according to the current regulations for security protection. For positions where GKN's customer has requirements for security classification, this may, in some cases, involve specific citizenship requirements.*



We’ll offer you fantastic challenges and amazing opportunities. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that has proven itself to be at the cutting edge of our industry; and is committed to pushing the boundaries even further. And with some of the best training on offer in the industry, who knows how far you can go?

  


**A Great Place to work needs a Great Way of Working**

  


Everyone is welcome to apply to GKN. We believe that we can only achieve our ambitions through a coming together of diverse minds who enjoy collaborating in an inspirational environment. Through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging and by living our five powerful principles we’ve created a culture where everyone feels welcome to contribute. It’s a culture that won us ‘The Best Workplace Culture Award’. By embracing and celebrating what makes us unique we encourage everyone to bring their full self to work.


We’re also committed to providing an accessible recruitment process, so if you require reasonable adjustments at any stage during our recruitment process please get in touch and let us know.


We are the place where human dreams, plus human endeavour, shape the future of aerospace innovation and technology.

title: Senior System Verification Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced **Electrical & Electronics Engineer** with a strong interest in **system verification, vehicle diagnostics, and fault tracing**. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with dealers, as well as internal and external workshops, to coordinate and perform testing within the **Vehicle Connectivity and Infotainment** domain.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct **vehicle diagnostics and fault tracing** in both rigs and vehicles.
* Perform **end-to-end (E2E) testing** for onboard and offboard connectivity.
* Develop, write, execute, and report **test cases** based on system and vehicle-level requirements.
* Ensure **quality and readiness** before release.

**Your Profile:**

* Proven experience in **system verification** within **vehicles or system rigs**.
* **BSc or MSc** in Electrical/Software Engineering or equivalent.
* A **strong network** within Volvo Group and knowledge of its systems and processes (meritorious).
* A **T-shaped mindset** with a willingness to learn new areas.
* Experience with **Vector tools and System Weaver** is a plus.

title: Mechanical Designer - Tender Prepartion
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


As a Mechanical Designer for Tender Preparation, you will engage in a variety of engineering disciplines, including electrical, mechanical, chemical, civil, structural, automation, and software engineering. Your role will encompass discipline engineering and design, planning, risk assessments, and the coordination of resources such as personnel and equipment.


“*In this position, you'll have the opportunity to engage in creative problem-solving and handle dynamic tasks that require quick decision-making. You'll be encouraged to think about the bigger picture and work on unique tenders, each presenting its own set of challenges and opportunities. As the first in the engineering chain, you'll be at the forefront of discovering market trends and new requirements, making this role both exciting and impactful*.” - Sofia Olin, Engineering Manager

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Ensure engineering is developed with complete and multidisciplinary information, leading the development of new solutions for complex projects and challenges, and driving the completion of all engineering activities on the project.
* Coordinate engineering disciplines across several projects, providing technical support for testing, installation, and commissioning activities, and designing and conducting experiments, analyzing, and interpreting data.
* Prepare complete project documents in the area of responsibility, acting as a design authority for a particular engineering discipline, and completing engineering assignments for that discipline.
* Deliver cost-effective quality solutions within budget and contract, ensuring adherence to safety standards, and mitigating potential risks.
* Create work plans and cost estimates, reviewing and approving scope, budget, and schedule for assignments.
* Interact directly with customers, officials, contractors, and the supply chain.

**Your background**

* Previous experience from mechanical plant design for HVDC converter station tenders, including the preparation of tender documents and design concepts according to customer specifications, applicable standards, and internal HE requirements.
* Experience from 3D modeling of equipment layouts and design coordination with various internal and external disciplines.
* Experience working with Bill of Quantities and engineering hours cost sheets.
* Proficiency with CAD tools such as Siemens NX and PLM systems like Team Center.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you! Applications will be screened on an ongoing basis so we encourage you to apply today.


Recruiting manager Sofia Olin, sofia.olin@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Nicole Bergman, nicole.bergman@hitachienergy.com


Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort +46 107-38 29 86, Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43.

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Senior Support Engineer
description:
Do you want to be part of a support team and deliver market leading customer service as an expert in our contact center platform? Then maybe the role as **Senior Support Engineer** in our team could be of interest to you.


I’m Robert Ljunggren and I lead a team that supports the contact center platform Telia ACE. Our mission is to help Telia's corporate customers to create the best customer interactions possible. We do this by developing a market leading communication solution based on high-end technology.


If you want to know more about Telia ACE, you can check out our showcase pages.


**As a Senior Support Engineer you will…**
------------------------------------------

As part of our support team, you will help our customers to solve their support tickets.


The role includes, but is not limited to:


* Troubleshooting and resolving complex incidents from start to end, regarding Telia ACE software, related platform network systems as well as customer target environment
* Problem investigation
* Customer communication and guidance.
* Participate in 24/7 on-call duty every 4-5 weeks

**Who we’re looking for**
-------------------------

We think that you have a passion for technology and helping others. You are the most satisfied when you have solved a tricky problem and managed to quickly and smoothly help a customer in need.


Your personal competencies:


* Problem solving oriented
* Service minded
* Self-driven and able to work independently as well as in a group of people
* Unrestricted communication in Swedish and English both in speech and in writing

Your Experience:


* University degree in IT-technologies (or similar experience)
* At least 3 years of relevant experience after graduation

Nice to have:


* Digital forensics tools, experience with endpoint and network logs
* Knowledge of Windows functionalities and settings
* Basic navigation skills in SQL

**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

If you fancy joining my team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact me on Linkedin .


We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. Application deadline is **2025-** **04-01.**

**Welcome to Telia – Home to your next big opportunity!**

title: Fleet Office Engineer to Braathens
description:
Fleet Office Engineer at Braathens


Are you looking to use your aviation experience in a strategic role with opportunities for long-term career development?


The Braathens family is in an expanding phase, and we are currently looking for an additional Fleet Office Engineer to join our dedicated team.


Welcome to the Braathens family


Braathens is a trusted partner in ACMI services, delivering a seamless integration of operational reliability and your brand’s identity. With a proud legacy of Scandinavian excellence, we ensure every flight meets the highest standards of safety, dependability, and comfort. Drawing on decades of expertise and a proven reputation for precision, Braathens offers premium services that exceed industry expectations.


Braathens operate with a steadily growing fleet of 21 ATR 72-600, Airbus A319, and A320 aircraft, engaged in long-term ACMI contracts with Scandinavian Airlines and Austrian Airlines, alongside charter contracts for Ving and Apollo.


You’ll find our closely-knit and enthusiastic team at our headquarters, conveniently located at Hangar 5 next to Bromma Airport (BMA) and Bromma Blocks.


About the Fleet Office


The Braathens Fleet Office is a dedicated team, providing Operational Engineering support to our Flight Operations department, whilst closely coordinating with other key stakeholders for a continues- and successful operation. As the main support function for the OCC team, we ensure thorough preparation and coordination of flight operations before handing over to OCC for daily management.


The team consists of Fleet Office Engineers, EFB Admins and Navigation Database/Energy Performance Manager. The advantageous size of our team and close collaboration with key roles, such as Fleet Chief Pilots, Technical Pilot and NPFO, allows us to have a significant and positive impact across the organization.


Required Qualities:


To succeed in this role, you are result-oriented, adaptable, and thrive in a fast-paced aviation environment. You are a structured problem-solver with strong analytical skills who views challenges as opportunities. Your meticulous approach, strong communication abilities, and collaborative nature contribute positively to our dedicated team.


Key Responsibilities:


* Flight planning and performance calculations
* Securing flight- and traffic permits
* Analysis of operational data (route evaluation, geopolitical factors, etc.)
* Fuel efficiency initiatives
* Managing flight ops related databases
* Interaction with regulatory authorities, aircraft manufacturers and other key stakeholders

Required Qualifications:


* Completed ATPL theory OR experience as Flight Operations Officer (FOO)
* Familiarity with aviation regulations and standards (EASA, IOSA)
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to drive change effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Meritorious:


* Experience from aviation operations (flight planning, operational support, manual production)
* Completed university degree with a focus on aviation-related subjects
* Experience using Flight Planning software such as PPS8, N-FP or FlightKeys
* Proficiency in MS Office

We Offer:


* Travel benefits via MyID Travel after six months
* Vacation opportunities: Access to vacation rentals in Mallorca at self-cost prices for the perfect getaway.
* A supportive work environment with opportunities for internal career advancement and professional growth

For questions, contact Joakim Albihn, Senior Fleet Office Engineer, joakim.albihn@flygbra.se.


We look forward to your application, no later than 20 April! Selection and interviews are conducted continuously, the position may be filled before published end date.

  


Check out the Braathens Fleet Office latest achievements on LinkedIn:


* https://www.linkedin.com/posts/braathens\_in-december-we-operated-our-first-flight-activity-7292843301919973377-QhUL?utm\_source=share&utm\_medium=member\_desktop&rcm=ACoAAA0kf8gBsb4FfT6lPCRDcXYcLcahZrrHC3Q
* https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jeppesen\_jeppesen-braathensregionalairlines-flitedeckpro-activity-7284629943697715200-6wBw?utm\_source=share&utm\_medium=member\_desktop&rcm=ACoAAA0kf8gBsb4FfT6lPCRDcXYcLcahZrrHC3Q

Get to know us further: https://www.braathens.com/about-us/

title: Chief Engineer, Automation
description:
Are you a motivated automation engineer seeking an exciting role with a global leader in sustainable production solutions? Valmet, renowned for its innovations in reducing environmental impact in tissue production, is looking for **Automation Engineer for Tissue Machines Solution** to join our team in Karlstad.


As part of Valmet's Board, Paper, and Tissue Technology Solutions Business Unit, you'll be at the forefront of delivering cutting-edge technology and circularity solutions to mills worldwide. This role offers the opportunity to manage engineering projects from start to finish, collaborating closely with various stakeholders across sales, R&D, procurement, and site operations. Your expertise in automation engineering—covering either software, electrical/hardware, and/or fluid systems (Hydraulic, Pneumatic and Lubrication) —will be crucial in achieving project success.


**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Automation Engineering
* Over five years of experience preferred
* Knowledge of Board, Paper and especially Tissue mills is advantageous
* Proficiency some of the automation software such as Valmet DNA, Siemens PLC & PCS7, and CADS or Eplan for electrical/hardware and/or fluid systems engineering
* Fluent in English mandatory and Swedish preferably
* Determined, self-reliant, with strong teamwork skills and a passion for continuous improvement
* Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and environments
* Willingness to travel up to 20-40 days annually within Sweden EU, and internationally

Join Valmet and embark on a rewarding journey in a global environment, collaborating with experts worldwide to tackle diverse challenges in tissue machine engineering. You'll have access to comprehensive training, development opportunities, and exposure to state-of-the-art technologies.


Don't miss this chance to join a leader in sustainable production solutions. If you're ready to showcase your skills and drive for personal development, we invite you to apply and become part of the Valmet team. We look forward to hearing from you soon!


**Additional information**

In case of any further questions about this position, please contact Jukka Halme, Director Global Engineering Operations, Board, Paper and Tissue Technology Solutions Business Unit by phone +358 50 317 0890


If this sounds like the job you are looking for and you are ready to go for it, please send your application with your CV and salary request as soon as possible but no later than April 8th, 2025, selection is ongoing continuously.


**When everything works together**

*Valmet is where the best talent from a wide variety of backgrounds comes together. With 19,000 professionals around the world, we are the leading global developer and supplier of technologies, automation and services for the pulp, paper and energy industries. Our commitment to moving our customers’ performance forward requires creativity, technological innovations, service know-how – and above all, teamwork.*
company_description: Valmet has extensive technological know-how and a broad process understanding in solution related to the pulp, paper and energy industries.

title: Engineer - Software Development Engineer
description:
Varje gång du flyger, nästan var som helst i världen, är det troligt att GKN Aerospace hjälper dig på vägen. Vår teknologi och våra komponenter används i 90% av världens flygplan, i allt från små och stora passagerarflygplan, affärsjets samt i världens mest avancerade stridsflygplan. Vi designar och tillverkar även innovativa komponenter till rymdsystem. Vi utvecklas ständigt, banar väg för ny teknik och utmanar oss själva för att bli bättre i allt vi gör.  

Vi söker drivna och passionerade medarbetare som vill göra en skillnad! Var med och påverka den hållbara omvandlingen av flygindustrin och hitta en plats där din karriär tar fart i en värld av enorma möjligheter att lära och utvecklas.


**Summering**
-------------



Performance-avdelningen fokuserar på framdrivningssystem, gasturbinteknik och systemkunskap om helmotorsystem. Främst arbetar vi med motorfunktion och prestandaanalyser för RM12/RM16 i JAS 39 Gripen och motorkoncept för nästa generations stridsflyg.  

Gruppen söker förstärkning och letar efter dig med ett systemtekniskt synsätt som tycker om problemlösning och är intresserad av programmering, metodutveckling, verktyg och modellering. Tycker du om att arbeta med metodutveckling och vill vara en del av ett engagerat och drivet team, då är det dig vi söker.  



**Om rollen**
-------------



Som del i vårt Performance-team har du möjlighet att arbete med utveckling av både nya och befintliga metoder, verktyg och program för både certifierade motorer och nästa generations flygmotorer.

  


Exempel på typiska ansvarsområden inkluderar inom rollen:

  


* Uppdatera metoder, verktyg och tillhörande dokumentation
* Uppdatera vårt omfattande bibliotek av program och verktyg till en modern standard
* Testning, verifiering och granskning av nya metoder, verktyg och program
* Integrera nya metoder i ett redan etablerat system
* Effektivisera arbetssätt och processer för vårt analysarbete
**Kvalifikationer och erfarenheter**
------------------------------------



Kvalifikationer:  

* Master- eller civilingenjörsexamen
* Förståelse och erfarenhet av metod- eller systemutveckling
* Erfarenhet från programmering och utveckling (Python eller Fortran)
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Förmåga att samarbeta med andra, jobba i team och bygga nätverk
  

  

Meriterande för tjänsten:  

* Erfarenhet från industri eller akademi med liknande verksamhet
* Erfarenhet från programmering och utveckling (t.ex. Git, C++, Java, SQL etc.)
* Erfarenhet av granskning och kravverifiering av mjukvara
* Kunskap om jetmotorer/gasturbiner och aerodynamik
* Intresse för flygplan och flygplansmotorer
* Erfarenheter av systemmodellering eller verktygsutveckling

**Personliga egenskaper**
-------------------------

Vi värdesätter egenskaper som nyfikenhet, driv och förmåga att effektivt kommunicera. Vi tror att du stimuleras av att förstå tekniskt komplexa lösningar, har ett öga för detaljer samtidigt som du trivs med den sociala kontakten och att motivera och engagera andra. Vi söker dig som är bekväm med att ta ett stort individuellt ansvar, arbeta strukturerat samt vara en del av ett team.


**Ansökan**
-----------

  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidare  

Plats & Reso: Trollhättan,  

Arbetstid: Dagtid

  

  

Rekryteringsprocessen sker löpande. Vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan.


Ansök senast: 2025-04-30


För ytterligare information, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef:

title: Field Service Engineer - Linac / Unity
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with Cancer.**

  

Elekta is seeking a **Field Service Engineer** for Linac’s and Unity’s system to join our team! This role involves installing new equipment, providing support to existing customers, and selling spare parts. If you have a passion for technology, problem-solving, and customer service, we’d love to hear from you.

 **What you’ll do at Elekta**

  

Would you like to be part of our driven global team, where we aim to attract and invite the best competences to Elekta? We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join our Order Fulfilment & Service Organization.

  

This is a **home-based role** with a requirement to travel throughout Nordics as required and as  

directed by the Nordic Regional Service Manager. The Elekta linear accelerators and Unity systems are high end system providing electron and photon treatments for cancer patients. The advanced systems require deep knowledge in high power, fine electronics, computer science, CBCT X-ray, MRI, water cooling systems and vacuum.

**Responsibilities**

* Perform corrective and preventive maintenance on Elekta products after completing approved training.
* Maintain and update customer files.
* Provide technical support to customers and Elekta employees via phone, email, and on-site visits.
* Train customers to use and maintain Elekta products.
* Continuously enhance technical knowledge of Elekta equipment.
* Participate in site visits or online meetings with the Regional Service Manager.
* Support customers through helpdesk assistance, remote connections, or Elekta Remote Support.
 **Authority & Sales Responsibilities:**

* Sell spare parts according to price lists.
* Perform service on Elekta equipment you’ve been trained on.
* Sign customer acceptance forms and hand over Elekta equipment to customers.
 **What you bring**

* A technical degree in **Medical Engineering** or **Electronics**.
* Minimum 3+ yrs experience as a **hospital engineer** or **field service engineer** *in two or more modalities.*
* Proficiency in **computers and networking**.
* Strong command of **Swedish and English**, both written and verbal.
* Passion for educating and training others.
* Strong interpersonal and cultural awareness skills.
* Willingness to continuously learn and improve expertise in Elekta products.

  



**Why should you join Elekta?**

  

In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.


Overview of some of our benefits for Sweden are as below.

 **Sweden**

* 30 vacation days/year, plus an additional 4 Elekta days off/year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Company Car
**Hiring process**  

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

**Your Elekta contact**


For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Sarkar, nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com .**We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

 **About Elekta**


Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.


We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Installation Specialist
description:
Linköping, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

**Vad du kommer att göra på Elekta**


Är du en problemlösare med erfarenhet av tunghantering, elektronik och mekanik i kombination med mjukvara? Trivs du med att resa och arbeta nära kunden på ett lösningsorienterat sätt? Då kan rollen som Installationsspecialist vara något för dig!


I denna roll ingår du i Elektas division *Business Line Neuro Solutions* och arbetar med Elektas *Gammakniv*. Du får möjlighet att arbeta internationellt och ansvara för installationer på sjukhus runtom i världen. Installationsprocessen är uppdelad i två faser:

* Fas 1: Tunghantering och laddning av kobolt-60-källor
* Fas 2: Montering, installation och testning av systemet


Här arbetar du tvärdisciplinärt inom mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar bland annat:

* Montering av tung utrustning
* Installation och montering av system
* Fungera som länk mellan sjukhuspersonal och Elekta, eskalera uppkomna problem och säkerställa att dessa åtgärdas
* På sikt agera stöd och vägleda andra ingenjörer inom Elektas organisation
* Identifiera och genomföra förbättringar som ökar kundnöjdheten


Du utgår från Elektas kontor i Linköping och rapporterar till installationschefen.

**Rätt egenskaper**

* Du är kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta i team
* Du har ett öppet och prestigelöst förhållningssätt, anpassar dig till olika kulturer och löser problem på ett lösningsorienterat sätt
* Du är självgående och tar gärna eget initiativ, med ett strukturerat arbetssätt
* Du har inga problem med att resa i tjänsten och värdesätter kundnöjdhet högt

**Vad du tar med dig**

* Ingenjörsutbildning eller minst fem års dokumenterad erfarenhet av installations-/servicearbete
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Erfarenhet av minst ett av följande områden är meriterande:

* Medicinska system
* Montering av tunga maskiner (tunga lyft)
* Radioaktivt material och strålsäkerhet
* Automatiserade styrsystem
* Har du kunskap inom flera av dessa områden är det extra meriterande
* Det är också meriterande om du har erfarenhet av en resande tjänst

**Vad du får**


I den här rollen arbetar du för ett högre syfte – hopp för alla som drabbas av cancer och för att alla, oavsett var i världen de befinner sig, ska ha tillgång till den bästa cancervården. Utöver detta erbjuder Elekta en rad förmåner:

* 30 betalda semesterdagar per år, samt 4 extra Elekta-dagar per år (utöver röda dagar)
* Attraktivt premiebaserat pensionsprogram
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Lunchförmån
* Bidrag till friskvårdsaktiviteter

**Rekryteringsprocess**


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på “ansök”-knappen. Observera att vi **inte** tar emot ansökningar via e‑post. Urvalet sker löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.

**Din kontakt på Elekta**


Vid frågor om rollen vänligen kontakta ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner, Gustaf Ericson, på gustaf.ericson@elekta.com.**Vi är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald och inkludering**


Vi utvärderar kvalificerade sökande utan hänsyn till ålder, ras, hudfärg, religion, kön, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller könsuttryck, genetisk information, nationalitet, funktionsvariation, veteranstatus eller någon annan status som skyddas enligt lag i de länder där Elekta är verksamt.

***Om Elekta/About Elekta***

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.*

*More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives, and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it’s personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combines passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care.* ***We don’t just build technology, we build hope.***

*Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with a presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit* *elekta.com* *or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.*

title: Verification Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**


At Elekta, we make a difference by leading the way in precision radiation therapy. We’re dedicated to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about our mission and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!


We’re looking for two **Mechanical Verification Engineers** to join our R&D team within the Neuro Business Line, offering opportunities for both recent graduates and experienced professionals. This position is located at Elekta’s new head office at the heart of Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden.


**What you’ll do at Elekta**
=============================


You will be a part of a scrum team that specifies, develops and tests products for stereotactic neurosurgery in an R&D organization and works according to the SAFe agile methodology. The team’s goal is to develop and maintain precise, safe and compliant hardware devices and systems.


All mechanics, electronics and software are developed and verified in the Stockholm office.

#### **Responsibilities**

  

As a Mechanical Verification Engineer at Elekta your primary responsibility will be mechanical verification and continuous test ofLeksell Gamma Knife® and the Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System (please check the links to check these products you’ll help verify). In short, Leksell Gamma Knife is a non-invasive, precision stereotactic treatment device used to deliver focused radiation to intercranial targets. Leksell® Vantage™ Stereotactic System is minimally invasive system for neurosurgery.  

  

You will work in close cooperation with other team members to contribute to:* **Prototype testing & design improvement**: collaborate closely with team members to test prototypes, identify defects, and suggest design enhancements early in the development phase.
* **Verification & reporting**: write test specifications, execute verification activities, and thoroughly document and report results.
* **Process & product improvements**: participate in risk analysis, review of requirements, design drawings, related documents and selecting and validating tools.

  

This will require that you collaborate with many other stakeholders e.g. within system, control system, mechanics, quality, procurement, and production. We expect you to continuously strive to improve both process efficiency and product quality.  

  

At Elekta we are passionate about developing our products, and we need to make sure that our deliveries are of exceptional quality.

**What you’ll bring with you**
==============================


We are looking for a highly motivated and quality-oriented team player with a hands-on approach and a passion for innovation. We hope that you are ready to take the initiative, and that you have a structured and analytical approach to solving problems regardless of your level of previous experience. To be successful in the role, we believe you:

* Have work experience or interest in the role of Verification Engineer or working with medical devices
* Have a relevant University education such as Mechanical, Material or Medical Engineering or Physics
* Enjoy working in an Agile cross functional team
* Able to see the bigger picture while focusing on detailed tasks.


If you are familiar with working with tools such as portable measurement arms, coordinate measuring machines, 3D printing or automation using robotics, that’s valuable strength.

**Why should you join Elekta?**
===============================


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week).

**Hiring process**
==================


We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis until the deadline on the **31st of March 2025**.

  

For questions regarding the role or special assistance, please contact the responsible TA Partner Maria Strelkova at maria.strelkova@elekta.com. Please note that we don’t accept applications or provide individual application feedback via e-mail.

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

**About Elekta**
================


As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.

  

More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.

  

Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
#### **What you’ll do at Elekta**

At Elekta, we don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer. As Senior Software Development Engineer, you will be designing and implementing the user workflows for our radiation therapy products and contribute to the innovation of tomorrow’s radiotherapy solutions.


Your team is part of an international program that consists of a diverse group of specialists in mechanical engineering, electronics, physics, embedded software, and more.

#### **Responsibilities**


As a Senior Software Development Engineer, you’ll be an essential part of our dynamic, cross-functional team, contributing to every stage of the development lifecycle—from gathering requirements to design, implementation, testing, and documentation. You'll have the opportunity to:

* **Collaborate and Innovate**: Work alongside talented engineers and stakeholders to build cutting-edge software solutions, influencing both front-end and back-end development.
* **Drive Technological Advancement**: Evaluate and implement the latest technologies, methodologies, and products to ensure we're always at the forefront of the industry.
* **Continuous Growth**: Stay ahead of the curve by following the latest technical and clinical advancements in the field, ensuring you’re always learning and evolving as a professional.

  



Join us to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, innovative environment where your expertise is valued and your ideas have a real influence on the direction of our products!

#### **What you bring**


We are looking for a creative and smart new colleague, who works best in teams. You have a can-do attitude and a problem-solving mindset. The team works with software solutions that guide the users through the radiotherapy treatment workflow. They are enthusiastic about writing efficient code with great user experience - we think you are too. In addition, we believe you have :

* a Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, physics, electronics or similar
* worked with frontend development using Angular and Typescript.
* worked with backend development in C# .NET.
  

It is meriting if you have

* Experience of working in MedTech or some other regulated industry .
* Exposure to working with Docker / Kubernetes.
**Why should you join Elekta?**


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, our benefit package includes:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week).

**Hiring Process**  

  

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.


For questions, please contact the responsible Global TA Partner Nidhi Sarkar at nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com.

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: HiL Engineer, Battery Management System
description:
Telescope Services har som konsultbolag sedan början av 2000-talet anställt och flyttat ingenjörer och specialister från hela världen till Sverige. Idag har vi circa 150 stycken utländska ingenjörer på konsultuppdrag hos flertalet av våra olika klienter. Vårt huvudkontor är placerat i Lund, men vi har rekryteringskontor i över 10 olika länder.
  
  

**Job Description:**  

We are offering an exciting opportunity to be part of the team responsible for verifying that our batteries meet all safety, performance, and functional requirements. We are looking for engineers to work on the verification of Battery Management Systems (BMS) for our diverse battery products.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Verify BMS software for functionality, performance, and safety
  
Drive the automation of testing procedures
  
Develop test methods and requirements
  
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our working processes in the BMS area
  
Plan, execute, report, and follow up on verification deliverables
  
  

**Desired Qualifications:**  

Proven experience in HIL rig verification
  
Experience with Battery Management Systems
  
Familiarity with dSpace tools (Automation Desk, Configuration Desk, Control Desk)
  
  

**Preferred Experience:**  

Experience in commercial vehicle or automotive product development
  
Proficiency in Matlab/Simulink and Python
  
  

**Educational Requirements:**  

M.Sc. in Power Electronics, Electrical Engineering, Electronics, or a similar relevant field
  
  

**Other Skills:**  

Strong communication and collaboration skills are essential
  
Minimum of 5 years of relevant professional experience
  
  

Please send Your CV to jobs@telescopeservices.se.

title: HW Engineeer
description:
Join our team as a Hardware Engineer and contribute to the innovation and development of advanced hardware systems. We are seeking a dedicated engineering professional to drive the design, testing, and implementation of hardware solutions for our cutting-edge technology products.
  
**Key Responsibilities Design and Development:** Architect and develop hardware components and systems, ensuring they meet specification requirements and are optimized for performance and reliability.
  
**Testing and Evaluation:** Conduct rigorous testing of hardware systems to ensure quality and functionality, making necessary adjustments and improvements based on test results.
  
**Collaboration:** Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers and system engineers, to integrate hardware solutions seamlessly into broader systems.
  
**Documentation:** Prepare technical documentation for hardware designs, specifications, and testing protocols to support product development and manufacturing processes.
  
**Problem Solving:** Identify and troubleshoot hardware issues, implementing effective solutions to ensure system integrity and performance.
  
**Innovation:** Stay current with technological advancements in hardware engineering and implement innovative solutions to meet project objectives and consumer needs.
  
Qualifications and Experience Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or a related field.
  
Proven experience in hardware design and development, with a strong portfolio demonstrating successful projects.
  
Proficiency in hardware design tools and software, such as CAD and simulation tools.
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to innovate and improve existing hardware systems.
  
Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to quality engineering practices.
  
Effective communication skills for collaborating with team members and stakeholders.
  
Desirable Skills Experience in system integration and testing of hardware within complex electronic systems.
  
Familiarity with industry standards and compliance requirements for hardware engineering.
  
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and handle changing priorities effectively.
  
  

This opportunity is ideal for a passionate hardware engineer aiming to contribute significantly to the development of high-performance technology products. If you thrive on tackling technical challenges and achieving engineering excellence, we welcome your application.

title: Verification and Validation (V&V) Engineer
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.  

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.  

The Verification and Validation (V&V) Engineer is responsible for helping development teams understand what to test and how to test it efficiently, both for new and existing functionality. The ideal candidate will be well-organized, have a technical background, preferably within autonomous technology, and be able to understand the different domain challenges. They should also have an eye for details and be clear and efficient in both written and spoken language. The V&V Engineer should be determined, have a good analytical mind, and enjoy working in a team.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Review verification specifications for quality and completeness
* Plan test activities on the test track
* Work with development teams to develop high-quality verification content
* Provide input to the strategic V&V development plan
* Summarize and report on progress and results from release testing activities

### **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in verification and validation of software-controlled systems
* Experience in autonomous systems is a strong plus
* Experience in virtual verification methods such as SIL, HIL, and simulation
* Good understanding of how different verification methods can be applied to increase the efficiency of the verification process
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus)
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


This is a full-time position based in Gothenburg or Stockholm. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.  

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.  

Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: Software Test Engineer - Penetration testing
description:
**We are looking for a "Software Test Engineer - Penetration testing" for a global company in Gothenburg**.

**Start is ASAP, 6 month's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

**Assignment description:**


The role of Software Test Engineer needs to perform the following tasks:

* Create and execute automated and manual tests.
* Design and maintain test environments.
* Analyze test results, log defects, and work with development teams to resolve issues.
* Ensure compliance with ISO 26262 and Automotive SPICE standards.
* Monitor the effectiveness of test procedures and continuously improve them.
* Participate in code reviews and provide feedback on testability.
* Develop test scripts for Hardware-in-the-Loop (HiL) and Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) testing setups.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement test automation frameworks.

**Generic role descrpition:**

The role of a Software Test Engineer is to design, develop, and execute test plans and test cases to ensure that automotive software systems function efficiently and meet the quality standards required in EDU. This role plays a critical part in identifying software bugs, evaluating functionality, and ensuring compliance with industry standards.

**Responsibility:**

* Developing comprehensive test plans for software systems, ensuring full coverage of requirements.
* Collaborating with software developers and system engineers to define test cases that align with functional and non-functional requirements.
* Automating testing processes and creating test scripts to improve efficiency and repeatability.
* Identifying defects and issues in the software, tracking them using relevant tools, and working with development teams to resolve them.
* Ensuring that the software complies with safety and regulatory standards in the automotive industry.
* Reporting on testing progress, results, and quality metrics to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
* Conducting performance and regression tests to assess system behavior under different scenarios.

**Authority:**

* The authority to approve or reject software builds based on test results.
* Decision-making power on the implementation of automated test systems.
* The ability to propose process improvements and tool changes to enhance the testing process.

**Required skills:**

* Proficiency in Python
* Experience with penetration testing
* Experience within Cyber Security
* Strong experience in writing clean, maintainable, and efficient Python code.
* Hands-on experience in developing automated test scripts.
* Familiarity with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and automated testing in Jenkins, GitLab CI, etc.
* Ability to design and implement test frameworks.
* Experience in collaborating within a version-controlled environment (e.g., GitHub, GitLab).
* Experience with test management tools like JIRA, codebeamer
* Ability to create detailed and structured bug reports and communicate issues effectively with developers.
* Knowledge of build automation tools (e.g., Jenkins, Travis CI, GitLab CI).
* Ability to write detailed, accurate, and clear test cases, test plans, and test scenarios.
* Hands-on experience in executing manual test cases and documenting results.
* UDS protocols, CAN, XCP, ETK.
* Iso 26262 iso, ISO 14229, IOS 21434 knowledge
* General Microcontroller /emachine/ automotive experience.

**Experience:**

* Higher education and practical experience in applying skill set to job
* Performs tasks and applies knowledge independently, exercises personal responsibility and autonomy
* Investigates, defines and resolves problems
* Clearly stands out among peers in skill-set and behaviors

**This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Gothenburg.** **Start is ASAP, 6 month's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
