title: Development Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **10+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

### **Role Overview:**


The **client** is looking for a Development Engineer with a specific focus on engine calibration. The ideal candidate will have experience in testing and optimization of internal combustion engines, with a strong understanding of combustion theory and experience in developing combustion engines.

### **Main Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Deliver optimization tasks for specific engines, ranging from sensor linearization to complete engine software settings for production.
* Work with advanced tools like ENE and DoE for screening and calibration.
* Use tools such as ATI Vision (calibration and data acquisition), DTECS (client-specific development tool for embedded control systems), and Concerto (data post-processing and evaluation tool).
* Collaborate with various internal teams and external contacts to deliver engine calibration solutions for diesel and alternative fuel-powered engines.

### **Requirements:**

* Engine calibration experience.
* Master of Science or similar relevant technical experience.
* Several years of experience in combustion engine development.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
* Driver’s license for a car.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Service Engineer- Brake
description:
**Discover your potential. Pursue your passion.**
Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.  

**ACTIVITY**
* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering
* Power electronics technician with relevant professional experience in the service environment is also welcome
* Several years of experience in a comparable position, ideally knowledge in the field of brakes
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Fluent in English
* Customer and service-orientated appearance and corresponding work attitude
* High level of stress resistance
* Strong willingness to cooperate and ability to work in a team
* Willingness to travel, mainly Europe


**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence
* Varied and technically complex work content with high added value.
* International customers operating in Europe
* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract

title: Fleet Office Engineer to Braathens
description:
Publicerad den 17 mars 2025

**Fleet Office Engineer at Braathens**



Are you looking to use your aviation experience in a strategic role with opportunities for long-term career development?



The Braathens family is in an expanding phase, and we are currently looking for an additional Fleet Office Engineer to join our dedicated team.



Welcome to the Braathens family



Braathens is a trusted partner in ACMI services, delivering a seamless integration of operational reliability and your brand’s identity. With a proud legacy of Scandinavian excellence, we ensure every flight meets the highest standards of safety, dependability, and comfort. Drawing on decades of expertise and a proven reputation for precision, Braathens offers premium services that exceed industry expectations.



Braathens operate with a steadily growing fleet of 21 ATR 72-600, Airbus A319, and A320 aircraft, engaged in long-term ACMI contracts with Scandinavian Airlines and Austrian Airlines, alongside charter contracts for Ving and Apollo.



You’ll find our closely-knit and enthusiastic team at our headquarters, conveniently located at Hangar 5 next to Bromma Airport (BMA) and Bromma Blocks.


**About the Fleet Office**



The Braathens Fleet Office is a dedicated team, providing Operational Engineering support to our Flight Operations department, whilst closely coordinating with other key stakeholders for a continues- and successful operation. As the main support function for the OCC team, we ensure thorough preparation and coordination of flight operations before handing over to OCC for daily management.



The team consists of Fleet Office Engineers, EFB Admins and Navigation Database/Energy Performance Manager. The advantageous size of our team and close collaboration with key roles, such as Fleet Chief Pilots, Technical Pilot and NPFO, allows us to have a significant and positive impact across the organization.


**Required Qualities:**



To succeed in this role, you are result-oriented, adaptable, and thrive in a fast-paced aviation environment. You are a structured problem-solver with strong analytical skills who views challenges as opportunities. Your meticulous approach, strong communication abilities, and collaborative nature contribute positively to our dedicated team.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Flight planning and performance calculations
* Securing flight- and traffic permits
* Analysis of operational data (route evaluation, geopolitical factors, etc.)
* Fuel efficiency initiatives
* Managing flight ops related databases
* Interaction with regulatory authorities, aircraft manufacturers and other key stakeholders


**Required Qualifications:**


* Completed ATPL theory OR experience as Flight Operations Officer (FOO)
* Familiarity with aviation regulations and standards (EASA, IOSA)
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to drive change effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


**Meritorious:**


* Experience from aviation operations (flight planning, operational support, manual production)
* Completed university degree with a focus on aviation-related subjects
* Experience using Flight Planning software such as PPS8, N-FP or FlightKeys
* Proficiency in MS Office


**We Offer:**


* Travel benefits via MyID Travel after six months
* Vacation opportunities: Access to vacation rentals in Mallorca at self-cost prices for the perfect getaway.
* A supportive work environment with opportunities for internal career advancement and professional growth

  



For questions, contact Joakim Albihn, Senior Fleet Office Engineer, joakim.albihn@flygbra.se.



We look forward to your application, no later than 20 April! Selection and interviews are conducted continuously, the position may be filled before published end date.

  



Check out the Braathens Fleet Office latest achievements on LinkedIn:


* **See Braathens linked in here**


* **and here!**



Get to know us further: https://www.braathens.com/about-us/

title: Application Engineer - Verification IP - EDA - m/f/d
description:
**About Us**
------------


Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.

**About the role**
------------------


We are looking for a highly motivated Application Engineer who will be responsible for the technical selling and support of Siemens EDA's Verification IP (VIP) portfolio across the EMEA region.


As an Application Engineer (AE), you’ll play a pivotal role as the bridge between Siemens EDA and our customers. This dynamic and challenging position demands profound technical expertise, robust communications, and exemplary business skills. Collaborating with businesses spanning diverse technology sectors, you’ll assist our customers in tackling technical and business challenges using Siemens EDA's innovative verification solutions. As part of our technical sales team, you'll contribute to the growth of Siemens EDA's functional verification business in EMEA by ensuring the successful adoption and expansion of our products and services.


As a Verification IP AE, you will identify and qualify engagements based on customers' needs and business opportunities, define VIP evaluations and benchmark criteria, implement relevant technical campaigns to meet established goals considering customers' production flows, provide best-in-class support, and work with account managers to determine the sales execution strategy. You will ensure both the customers' success and the broader use of Siemens EDA's VIP solutions. Our application engineering team is a creative, dynamic, and highly productive small team environment.


Work location is in Europe with the applicant expected to be able to easily travel within the European Union and other EMEA countries such as the UK and Israel. This position can entail as much as 20% travel.

**Job Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* The primary purpose is to work with sales and field technical team members to help lead, define, and implement the technical engagements that support sales campaigns.
* Provide technical leadership on all aspects of sales campaigns. Contribute and complete pre-sales and post-sales account strategies as a member of the sales team.
* Qualify the technical viability of sales opportunities and communicate them to the sales team.
* Lead VIP portfolio presentations and demonstrations to prospective customers and effectively communicate the value proposition of Siemens EDA solutions to them
* Integrate VIP in customer testbench or guide them to do so themselves.
* Proactively share account, evaluation, competitor, technology, and other helpful information with peers, sales teams, management, and product divisions to help us compete more effectively.
* Develop and maintain ongoing positive relationships with customers.
* Ensure customers receive timely, effective support
* Influence marketing and product groups to meet customers’ needs and shape product direction.
* Work collaboratively with team members to ensure mutual success.

**Job Qualifications:**
-----------------------

* The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:
* BS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent.
* Practical experience and knowledge of one or more high-speed interface protocols such as PCIe, CXL, UCIe, NVMe, Ethernet, USB, DDRx, HBM, AMBA.
* Knowledge of controllers for one or more high-speed interface protocols
* Expertise in coding with SystemVerilog, and UVM is mandatory
* Experience with integrating commercial VIP in SV/UVM bench required.
* Experience with Linux and Windows environments including scripting languages.
* Individual leadership and initiative to manage pre-sales accounts
* Excellent presentation skills and verbal/written communication skills
* Strong project management skills and the ability to break down complex problems into manageable tasks

**Working at Siemens EDA**
--------------------------

**Why us?**


Working at Siemens EDA means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow reality.

title: Intermediate / Senior Concept Artist
description:

--------------

We provide remote-friendly studios with stellar game developers in all crafts.

 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.

 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript

**Good to have**

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Backend Engineer - Finance Tech Team
description:
**About the role**
 At Instabee, our Finance Tech team is a driving force behind the company’s financial operations, ensuring everything runs with precision and efficiency. We are the bridge between operations, commerce and finance. Our mission is to power seamless money flows, optimize pricing strategies, and leverage technology to keep our financial ecosystem strong and future-ready.We don’t just enable the business—we shape its profitability and financial success. Working closely with our commercial and financial teams, we integrate commercial tools with financial systems, ensuring that money moves efficiently and accurately across the company. Whether it’s evaluating the latest external software or building world-class internal tools, we are at the core of Instabee’s growth and financial excellence.
 



**Some of the things you will do** 



* **Invoicing & Process Optimization** 
 – Ensure our invoicing runs smoothly and efficiently by refining existing workflows and eliminating errors.
* **System Analysis & Improvement** 
 – Review and analyze our current systems to identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency.
* **Quality & Reliability** 
 – Take ownership of system reliability, ensuring stability and high performance.
* **Collaboration** 
 – Work cross-functionally with Finance, Commercial, and Product teams to integrate backend solutions seamlessly.
* **Innovation & Development** 
 – Drive innovation and develop future-proof solutions that align with company goals.
* **Staying curious** 
 – Stay updated on relevant technologies and evaluate how they can benefit our systems and workflows.







**Your future team**
 The Finance Tech team operates with a high level of autonomy, empowering you to make a significant impact on our systems and processes. Your contributions will directly influence Instabee’s ability to optimize revenue streams, strengthen financial operations, and maintain a cutting-edge financial infrastructure.
   

  

 You’ll work side by side with senior leaders across finance and Commercial teams, collaborating with Product and Engineering Managers to develop and advocate for innovative solutions. We expect you to bring bold ideas, strong reasoning, and a data-driven mindset to the table - because here, your voice matters.
 



**What We're Looking For**
 At Instabee we value individuals who are keen to learn and develop their own skill set. If you're a problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you. Beyond that we imagine that you have some of the following points on your resumé:
   




* Strong experience in a backend or fullstack role within a modern tech environment
* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, with a passion for building scalable solutions
* PostgreSQL and/or MongoDB experience (or equivalent database technologies)
* Basic understanding of Terraform and Linux
* Familiarity with GCP
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English



***The cherry on top would be if you…***



* Have experience within financial services or a strong interest in the financial sector is a plus
   

  

 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!



**What you’ll get** 




 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
 


* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
* 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
* 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
* 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.



  





 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
 



**Get to know us** 




 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
 



 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
 



*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Blockchain Developer Intern
description:
Position: Blockchain Developer Intern 
 



 Location: Remote 
 



 Type: Unpaid Internship 
 



 Start Date: Immediate 
 



 Duration: 3-6 months (Flexible, Part-Time or Full-Time) 
 



  





 Are you passionate about blockchain technology and decentralized applications? Are you eager to gain hands-on experience in a startup environment where your work can make a real impact? 
 



 We're offering an exciting opportunity for a Blockchain Developer Intern to join our early-stage startup, currently in the beta phase of creation.
 



  





**About Us:** 




 Gaddr is a bold, innovative startup aiming to revolutionise the way companies manage their operations, create products, and collaborate with teams. Our platform, Gaddr, is designed to integrate automation and decentralised technologies into every aspect of business, from project management to staffing and beyond. While we’re still in the early stages, our vision is to create a seamless, blockchain-driven environment where all company operations are unified and transparent.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 




 As a Blockchain Developer Intern, you’ll be a key player in helping us bring this vision to life. Your responsibilities will include: 
 



  





 - Smart Contract Development: Designing and implementing smart contracts using Solidity (or other blockchain programming languages) for our platform, enabling automated workflows and decentralized business processes. 
 



 - Decentralized Application (DApp) Development: Contributing to both the front-end and back-end development of DApps that ensure transparency, security, and scalability for our users. 
 



 - Blockchain Integration: Collaborating on integrating blockchain technology into our platform’s existing architecture, allowing decentralized management of assets, projects, and operations. 
 



 - Collaborative Development: Working closely with our design and operations teams to implement features, test blockchain functionality, and iterate on user feedback. 
 



 - Problem-Solving: Applying your blockchain knowledge to solve complex challenges such as transaction optimization, gas fee reduction, and smart contract security. 
 



 - Learning & Experimentation: Exploring new blockchain protocols, tools, and methodologies to continually improve the platform. 
 



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 - Technical Skills: Experience or strong interest in blockchain development, smart contracts (Solidity, Rust, etc.), and familiarity with decentralized platforms like Ethereum or Solana. 
 



 - Eagerness to Learn: A self-starter who is excited to learn and grow in a fast-paced, startup environment. 
 



 - Creativity & Innovation: A problem-solver who is not afraid to think outside the box and bring fresh ideas to the table. 
 



 - Team Player:: Someone who thrives in collaborative settings and is open to feedback and iteration. 
 



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 




 - Real-World Experience: Hands-on experience in blockchain development within a real startup environment. 
 



 - Portfolio Development: A chance to build and refine your portfolio with tangible projects that have a real impact. 
 



 - Mentorship & Growth: Direct mentorship from experienced developers and founders, with opportunities to learn about the full lifecycle of blockchain-based product development. 
 



 - Potential for Future Opportunities: While this internship is unpaid, there is potential for a future paid position depending on the growth of our user base and the success of the platform.
 



  





**Important Notes:** 




 - Unpaid Internship: Please note that this is an unpaid internship. The experience, skills, and mentorship you’ll gain are invaluable, but compensation will not be provided. 
 



 - Early-Stage Startup: We are in the very early stages of development, so this is an opportunity to get in on the ground floor and contribute to a project with significant growth potential. 
 



 - Beta Phase: Our platform is currently in beta, which means you’ll be working in a dynamic environment where things are constantly evolving.
 



  





**How to Apply:** 




 If you're excited about the possibility of working on cutting-edge blockchain technology and contributing to an ambitious startup, we'd love to hear from you! 
 



 Please send your resume and any relevant portfolio to team@gaddr.com
 



  





 Join us in shaping the future of decentralized work, one line of code at a time. We look forward to building something extraordinary together!

title: Pega developer (banking)
description:
At Capgemini, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your career in a way that suits you, supported by a global community of experts who inspire and empower you. We believe in reimagining what’s possible - using technology to build a more sustainable, inclusive world. Our Financial Services team is at the forefront of this mission. As a reliable partner we guide our customers such as major banks and insurance companies with everything from strategy and planning to implementation and management.
   

  

**Your role**
 Working with experienced colleagues, you will assist our customers from early-stage advice to the implementation and integration of the multifaceted platform Pega. Depending on your experience and background, you will have various opportunities and roles in Pega projects. Our projects enhance customer experiences, create customer journeys, and bring them to life with agile teams. We establish new digital platforms and streamline work processes with digital solutions.
   

  

**In this position you will play a key role in:**
* Designing and developing Pega applications to automate banking processes.
* Translating business requirements into effective Pega solutions.
* Customizing and configuring Pega systems to meet specific project needs.
* Providing ongoing maintenance and support for existing Pega applications.


**Your profile**
* Experience from Pega, either from a position as a developer or system architect.
* Experience in working in an agile and test-driven environment.
* Previous consulting or client service delivery experience.
* One or more certifications in SA, SSA or LSA.
* Fluency in Swedish and experience in financial services or the insurance industry is beneficial.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* You get to work with major customers within banking and insurance, in exciting and varied roles, giving you the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally.
* We keep everyone connected, with learning activities and social events. With the freedom to grow, you get access to a wide range of our global comprehensive training programs.
* We focus on inclusion and embrace and empower talent in all its diverse forms and origins.
* We are valuing work-life balance with flexible working arrangements in order for you to balance your work life with your personal life.


**Application**
 Don’t hesitate to send in your application. We will be interviewing continuously and look forward to finding our next colleague.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted* 
 .
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Security Engineer (Stockholm, SE)
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play and everything in between. That’s why our mission is to make life in cities that much easier – by taking care of the parking. With the use of technology, we break barriers, helping improve the urban experience. Our aim is to create a scenario where parking supply and driver demand are balanced not due to additional parking spots and fewer cars, but thanks to predictive technology that connects our users to available spots.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 We’re seeking a skilled Security Engineer to strengthen our core product applications through advanced security design, code review, testing, and implementation. In this role, you’ll assess current security measures, build custom tools for enhanced controls, and collaborate with product teams to elevate their security expertise.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include conducting system tests, supporting compliance, and responding quickly to security incidents. You’ll bring strong experience in application security, risk assessment, and cloud infrastructure, along with excellent communication skills to help teams adopt best security practices. If you’re passionate about building resilient, secure products, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Maintaining a thorough understanding of product and infrastructure security throughout the Product and Technology ecosystem and enabling product teams in secure development and operations of their applications
* Planning, researching, and designing, and developing secure application security capabilities and CI/CD pipelines.
* Developing, reviewing, and collaborating on the configuration of cloud account configuration, network isolation, security groups, access policies, network policies, VPNs, and overall compute platform security, including both host-based and container-based workloads.
* Integrating identity management systems, digital certificates, and secrets management with application workloads.
* Reviewing vulnerabilities with teams and suggesting strategies and tactics for remediation.
* Validating security implementations and participating in remediation and risk acceptance efforts.
* Working with platform and product teams to implement disaster recovery procedures and conducting security breach drills.
* Responding quickly and effectively to all security incidents and providing post-event analyses.
* Guiding the overall security community, cultivating a sense of security awareness, and arranging for continuous education.
* Maintaining and contributing to a growing threat modeling program, and assisting teams continuous improvement in this area.
* Remaining up to date with the latest trends, standards, and products.


**About You**
* A bachelor's or associate's degree in IT, computer science, or equal experience. Advanced education or training in cloud/application security is preferred.
* 5-10 years or more of experience in application development and security.
* Experience with AWS, including EKS, multi-account setups, GuardDuty, KMS, Config, SSM, CloudFront, Firewall Manager, Shield, Network Firewall, WAF, IAM, CloudTrail, Security Hub, Secrets Manager, Inspector, Global Accelerator, ELB, EC2, Athena
* A strong working knowledge of current application and infrastructure risks, secure application design, and operating systems including experience with various Linux distributions and mobile operating systems (Android and iOS).
* Experience developing solutions with Terraform, Terragrunt, and/or Crossplane.
* Experience implementing DevSecOps pipeline tools such as static application security testing (code scanning, dependency scanning, secret scanning) dynamic application security testing, interactive application security testing, container vulnerability scanning, and infrastructure vulnerability scanning
* Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of multiple languages including but not limited to Java, Kotlin, JavaScript, NodeJS, Go, C-Sharp, Swift, Python, bash, and SQL


 What We Offer
   

  

* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* Proactive health support: your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/year


 Apply for this job

title: Data Engineer
description:
**SSC is a leading, global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. The Satellite Management Service division in SSC is focused on providing high quality and innovative ground station services to our customers - the spacecraft operators. Together we help Earth benefit from Space.**
**What You Will Do**
 We offer the opportunity to join the Software unit within SSC Connect, which is entrusted to develop and maintain critical systems required to connect our customers with their satellites.
   

  

 Our core business is to deliver satellite data to our customers, and the Data Engineering team owns critical components in this process. Their software ensures fast and reliable data delivery, as well as providing great observability for our customers and NMC.
   

  

 As a Data Engineer in the Data Engineering team you will
   

  

* Work with data definitions, data/ER modelling, and data quality
* Build and maintain the data platform


**Who You Are**
 We think that you care – about your systems, your colleagues and your users. That you have a creative and analytical mindset. You take responsibility, drive your own initiatives and can learn and process technical details quickly. We also think that you appreciate both working autonomously and together with other people.
   

  

 You have a European citizenship and can travel within and outside Sweden if needed. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services, it may include outside of standard working hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* B.S. Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering, or similar experience
* 5+ years of working as a Data Engineer
* Experience with cloud platforms
* Experience with workflow orchestration
* Experience with docker
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with ci/cd development
* Experience with data transformation
* Experience with infrastructure as code
* Fluency in English


**BONUS POINTS**
* Familiar with AWS
* Experience with Terraform
* Experience from the space industry


**WE OFFER YOU**
* An opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry and help Earth benefit from Space.
* An excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging endeavors.
* To be part of international development projects with highly engaged teams.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Possibility to work remotely part of the time (max 50%), and flexible work hours.


**LOCATION**
 Stockholm or Kiruna.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 Does this sound interesting? Interviews are held continuously.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 At SSC we help our customers gain access to space. With approximately 600 employees worldwide, SSC offers specialist skills in development, test, launch and operations of different flight and space systems. The Connect division provides satellite services and communications via a global network of our own as well as partner ground stations.
   

  

 Read more at  www.sscspace.com

title: Embedded Software Developer - Scrum Master and Developer
description:
VCT Powertrain Control System is dedicated to developing products offering premium drivability and high-quality performance by integrating all actuators. We tackle complex physical hardware phenomena by creating software that delivers a powerful and smooth powertrain while preserving the hardware.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are seeking a new team member for gear change control who is passionate about software development and eager to utilize their leadership skills. Whether you have experience as a Scrum master or are looking to step into a team-leading role for the first time, we welcome your application.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Help the team to be high performance, that deliver with quality and on time
* Engage in vehicle testing as part of a team that generates ideas, develops, and tests them within short iterations
* Think outside the box to find solutions, and formulate requirements that meet customer needs
* Work on safety concepts for various situations, both with and without a driver, to comply with the ISO26262 standard.


**Your Profile:**
* Engineer with a background in software, mechatronics, or electrical systems development.
* Experience in embedded systems within the automotive industry or several years in a similar field is advantageous.
* Competence in Matlab/Simulink and C or Python


 Recruiting Manager:
   

  

 As your manager, my highest priority is to create a cohesive team that works together to deliver the best possible product. I see myself as part of the team, working on coaching and team building to foster a dedicated team and personal development for each member.
   

  

**What Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Please submit your CV and any relevant certificates. The application deadline is 2025-04-01, and screening will take place on an ongoing basis. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required.
   

  

 For more information, contact Karin Avatare, Head of Gear Change Control SW (ENECG) +46855382202

title: Spelprogrammerare
description:
*The Game Assembly (TGA) is a Higher Vocational Education institution that focuses on education within game development. Since 2008, we've been passionate about offering practical and creative programs to nurture and inspire future talent for both the Swedish and international games industry. Recognized by The Rookies as one of the best game and design schools globally, we're proud to supply the industry with employees who possess in-demand skills, such as animators, technical artists, level designers, graphic designers, procedural artists, and programmers. Today, nearly 10 percent of professionals active in the Swedish games industry were educated at The Game Assembly. Our schools are located in Malmö and Stockholm.*
*The Game Assembly (TGA) är en yrkeshögskola i Malmö och Stockholm som utbildar spelutvecklare till den nationella och internationella spelbranschen.*
*The Game Assembly startade 2008 och utbildar spelutvecklare inom sex olika yrkeskategorier; programmering, grafik, animation, leveldesign, technical art och procedural art. Fram till idag har The Game Assembly utbildat drygt 10% av den svenska spelbranschen vilket gör skolan till en stark aktör i dataspelbranschens ekosystem. TGA har under de tre senaste åren hamnat på topplaceringar på The Rookies årliga lista för världens bästa spelutvecklarskolor. The Game Assembly är hbtqi-certifierande och bedriver ett aktivt arbete för inkludering och mångfald.*
**Om tjänsten**
 En av våra kollegor ska vara tjänstledig, därför söker nu The Game Assembly en vikarie inom spelprogrammering som kommer arbeta med att utbilda våra studerande på plats på Stora Essingen i Stockholm. Vi söker dig som kan komplettera våra kunskaper och tillsammans med tre andra utbildare inom spelprogrammering driva utbildningen framåt. Arbetet omfattar undervisning med tillhörande för- och efterarbete samt handledning av de studerande i dels spelprojektskurser, dels mer specialiserade individuella kurser (t.ex. mjukvaruutveckling och mjukvaruarkitektur).
   

  

 The Game Assemblys unika utbildningskoncept bygger på att utbildningarna på skolan tillsammans skapar spel vilket gör att du även kommer ha ett tätt samarbete med de övriga utbildningsansvariga.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 För att trivas i rollen som utbildare ser vi att du är kommunikativ och har ett genuint intresse för människor och spelutveckling. Du har en god pedagogisk förmåga tillsammans med ett ödmjukt förhållningssätt och tålamod. Vidare har du ett djupgående intresse för programmering. Du behöver ha god förståelse för svenska språket då hela utbildningen bedrivs på svenska.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* goda kunskaper inom programmering i C++
* erfarenhet av att utveckla och arbeta i egen spelmotor
* erfarenhet inom spelbranschen
* kunskaper i mjukvaruutveckling
* erfarenhet av handledning


 Vi ser det som en bonus om du har:
   

  

* studerat på The Game Assembly
* goda kunskaper inom programmering i C#
* erfarenhet av Unity
* erfarenhet av mobilspelsutveckling


**Varför TGA?**
 Vi erbjuder en kreativ, energigivande, ambitiös och omtänksam miljö. Arbetet med att utbilda drivna och nyfikna individer är otroligt givande och utvecklande, både på ett personligt och arbetsrelaterat plan. Vi är ett sammansvetsat team som alla har ett stort engagemang och driv, där alla bidrar på olika sätt utifrån sina egna erfarenheter och förutsättningar.
   

  

 The Game Assembly eftersträvar ökad mångfald och jämnare könsfördelning och uppmuntrar därför kvinnor, icke-binära och personer med internationell bakgrund att söka tjänsten. The Game Assembly är hbtqi-certifierade genom RSFL.
   

  

**Anställningsort** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Augusti 2025
   

  

**Ansök senast:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Skicka därför in din ansökan så snart du kan
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Anställningsform:** 
 10 månaders vikariat med start augusti 2025 till juni 2026
   

  

*The Game Assembly är en del av Academedia-koncernen och tillämpar kollektivavtal mellan Almega och Unionen samt Sveriges Ingenjörer.*
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta platschef Ida Fontaine på ida.fontaine@thegameassembly.se

title: Data Engineer - Financial Systems
description:
******Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.******
**Job Summary:**
 As a part of the Financial Systems team, you will work together with a team of data engineers to build and maintain an in-house developed system focused on automating record keeping of online sales (subscription and track purchases) and PSP settlement data. Sales and settlement data are automatically ingested from multiple platforms, transformed and then automatically posts aggregated sales revenue on a daily cadence to our ERP system Netsuite. The platform also offers a simplified presentation and analysis of the online sales and settlement data sets in a Dashboard, where the finance team is able to filter, drill down and download data through quick summary reports designed for their convenience. The data is also exported to our DWH for user consumption.
   

  

****How you will make an impact:****
* Own, maintain, configure, enhance, deploy and document our financial systems infrastructure, particularly our custom code and integrations.
* Explore, discover, analyze, prototype, experiment and measure. Work with stakeholders and management to define systems requirements for new technology implementations, staying abreast of current industry trends.
* Review, retrospect and adapt, (re)learn and (re)iterate based on new knowledge and experience. Contribute to well-functioning collective ownership and decision making. Think and build smart, both for now and with the future in mind.
* Implement automation to make processes repeatable, scalable, and secure.
* Monitor systems and networks for issues and vulnerabilities and investigate security incidents when they occur based on established policies and protocols.


****We believe that to succeed in this role, you have experience in some/all:****
* A university degree in computer science or equivalent experience
* At least 5 years of data engineering experience
* Interest working with financial data in a business environment.
* Experience working with databases, including advanced query usage and DBT/Dataform
* It will be an advantage if you have experience working with GCP.
* Experience of data processing frameworks such as Spark, Beam, Flink, EMR etc.
* Proficiency in scripting & automation languages such as Python, etc and in coding.
* Communication, collaboration and facilitation skills and capabilities. Including ability to effectively facilitate information flow and alignment between you and co-workers. You have a track record of working and communicating well with many different kinds of people.
* Team player
* Curiosity and passionate drive for: continuous improvement, growth mindset, building and delivering great things to serve our users.
* Fluency in English: you are an excellent communicator both in speaking and writing


****And it’ll be awesome if you also know a bit about:****
* Payments backends.
* NetSuite / ERP systems and automation libraries.
* Business intelligence or analytics.


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Application Engineer - Verification IP - EDA - m/f/d
description:
**About Us**
 Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a highly motivated Application Engineer who will be responsible for the technical selling and support of Siemens EDA's Verification IP (VIP) portfolio across the EMEA region.
   

  

 As an Application Engineer (AE), you’ll play a pivotal role as the bridge between Siemens EDA and our customers. This dynamic and challenging position demands profound technical expertise, robust communications, and exemplary business skills. Collaborating with businesses spanning diverse technology sectors, you’ll assist our customers in tackling technical and business challenges using Siemens EDA's innovative verification solutions. As part of our technical sales team, you'll contribute to the growth of Siemens EDA's functional verification business in EMEA by ensuring the successful adoption and expansion of our products and services.
   

  

 As a Verification IP AE, you will identify and qualify engagements based on customers' needs and business opportunities, define VIP evaluations and benchmark criteria, implement relevant technical campaigns to meet established goals considering customers' production flows, provide best-in-class support, and work with account managers to determine the sales execution strategy. You will ensure both the customers' success and the broader use of Siemens EDA's VIP solutions. Our application engineering team is a creative, dynamic, and highly productive small team environment.
   

  

 Work location is in Europe with the applicant expected to be able to easily travel within the European Union and other EMEA countries such as the UK and Israel. This position can entail as much as 20% travel.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities:
   

  

* The primary purpose is to work with sales and field technical team members to help lead, define, and implement the technical engagements that support sales campaigns.
* Provide technical leadership on all aspects of sales campaigns. Contribute and complete pre-sales and post-sales account strategies as a member of the sales team.
* Qualify the technical viability of sales opportunities and communicate them to the sales team.
* Lead VIP portfolio presentations and demonstrations to prospective customers and effectively communicate the value proposition of Siemens EDA solutions to them
* Integrate VIP in customer testbench or guide them to do so themselves.
* Proactively share account, evaluation, competitor, technology, and other helpful information with peers, sales teams, management, and product divisions to help us compete more effectively.
* Develop and maintain ongoing positive relationships with customers.
* Ensure customers receive timely, effective support
* Influence marketing and product groups to meet customers’ needs and shape product direction.
* Work collaboratively with team members to ensure mutual success.


 Job Qualifications:
   

  

* The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:
* BS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent.
* Practical experience and knowledge of one or more high-speed interface protocols such as PCIe, CXL, UCIe, NVMe, Ethernet, USB, DDRx, HBM, AMBA.
* Knowledge of controllers for one or more high-speed interface protocols
* Expertise in coding with SystemVerilog, and UVM is mandatory
* Experience with integrating commercial VIP in SV/UVM bench required.
* Experience with Linux and Windows environments including scripting languages.
* Individual leadership and initiative to manage pre-sales accounts
* Excellent presentation skills and verbal/written communication skills
* Strong project management skills and the ability to break down complex problems into manageable tasks


**Working at Siemens EDA**
**Why us?**
 Working at Siemens EDA means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 At Siemens, we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow reality.

title: Global Online Remote Service Engineer
company_industry: Biotechnology Research, Medical Equipment Manufacturing, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
What you’ll do
   

  

* Own customer cases assigned to Remote Service team:


 Provide fast response remote support to incoming technical issue raised by Cytiva customers globally according to contract prioritization and applying right service differentiation.
   

  

 Diagnose and troubleshoot complete failure on hardware, Software or Network using remote support solutions.
   

  

 Fix remotely customer issue or propose the right part to be ordered in parallel to the FSE assignment.
   

  

 Follow up with customer, OptiRun Service team (customer care center) and regional service engineers on case status.
   

  

 Support regional billable customer cases making cost estimate.
   

  

* Support field service engineer:


 Provide live remote support to field service engineers on site and involve additional engineering resources as part of technical escalation process.
   

  

 Document resolution path provided to FSE and create knowledge article accordingly.
   

  

 Ensure efficient handover to Global Service Engineering / Tech Support at time of escalation.
   

  

* Drive global remote service performance:


 Apply process, track backlog, and deliver remote support based on KPIs participating to the overall success of the team.
   

  

 As part of global remote service team, you are accountable for process and responsible for performance global delivery.
   

  

 You are in contact with regional service team to keep awareness of issue, status, and resolution path.
   

  

* Develop and share knowledge:


 Contribute to Service knowledgebase and actively feeding, updating, and maintaining knowledge management database. You have a key role player on the knowledge transmission within all Service team, by identifying quality or recurring issues, by documenting resolution working closely with global service engineering. Participate actively to knowledge sharing session delivered within the global remote service team. Keep your high technical expertise, applying continuous learning by working closely with global engineering and field engineers regularly. Go regularly on site at customer performing hands on critical job supporting field regional team or new field engineers on job training.
   

  

* Keep regional service intimacy:


 Keep closed connection with regional service team for planning support, business updates and participate to regional business and technical ops mech.
   

  

* Engage on remote technology project:


 Participate actively to remote solution initiatives and projects and co-lead requirement, test, & deployment action plan (Phone system, Smart Glasses, Augmented reality video guidance, IoT platform).
   

  

 Provide level 1 technical support on our IoT asset monitoring platform and participate to project enhancement.
   

  

*Travel as needed for training and for field or customer support ~ 10-15%*
 Who you are
   

  

* Associate or bachelor’s degree in science, Electrical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or relevant experience in BioPharma industry.
* A solid engineering experience and an expert level knowledge of the repair and maintenance of Bioprocess systems and/or Cell Culture & Upstream systems.
* Strong expertise and experience on existing hardware Cytiva portfolio (Filtrations, Chromatography, Process, Bioreactors, Mixers…) and software platform like UNICORN Software networking and advanced IT skills.
* Demonstrated excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities, handling & resolving technical issues, guiding and supporting customer remotely, with tenacity and imagination, in industrial or academic customer environment, in timely manner.
* Fluent speaking and writing in English language. Additional European language preferrable.


 It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:
   

  

* Ability to train/mentor peers, ability to stay calm in pressurized situations and coach people through solving problems, efficient written and verbal communications skills.
* Knowledge Service Max CRM experience, understanding of Cytiva products (upstream/downstream/software/cell therapy) desirable.


 Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.
   

  

 For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: PhD Research Intern, Evaluation of next generation media delivery protocol
company_industry: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing, Entertainment Providers, and Broadcast Media Production and Distribution
description:
Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent. We’re big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits, not to mention a Flex Work approach that is truly flexible to support where, when, and how you do your best work.
   

  

 Start: August 2025
   

  

 Duration: 3-6 months
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

**Summary**
 Interactive content (e.g., multi-perspective video) allows the viewer to actively engage with the content, providing an immersive and more personalized experience. However, to enable seamless interactivity, transmission of additional content components is required. This leads to an increase in the bandwidth requirements. Transport protocols such as TCP and UDP are not designed to optimally delivery these emerging content experiences. In recent years, QUIC was proposed as a new generation transport protocol, and its features make QUIC an attractive alternative for emerging interactive content delivery scenarios.
   

  

 This project hypothesizes that emerging networking protocols such as Media over QUIC (MoQ) could provide an efficient way for streaming interactive media. To this extend, the goal of this internship is to design and conduct experiments to assess the performance of MoQ in comparison to state-of-the-art delivery protocols. The student will be expected to get acquainted with the current developments within MoQ and to provide a proof-of-concept implementation and evaluation of experiments comparing MoQ delivery to standard TCP delivery.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Pursuing a Masters/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Telecommunication, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical field,
* Interest in network protocols,
* Experience with programming (e.g., Python and Rust).


 Dolby Hiring Entity:
   

  

 Gävlegatan 12A 113 30 Stockholm,
   

  

 Sweden

title: Fleet Office Engineer to Braathens
description:
Fleet Office Engineer at Braathens
   

  

 Are you looking to use your aviation experience in a strategic role with opportunities for long-term career development?
   

  

 The Braathens family is in an expanding phase, and we are currently looking for an additional Fleet Office Engineer to join our dedicated team.
   

  

 Welcome to the Braathens family
   

  

 Braathens is a trusted partner in ACMI services, delivering a seamless integration of operational reliability and your brand’s identity. With a proud legacy of Scandinavian excellence, we ensure every flight meets the highest standards of safety, dependability, and comfort. Drawing on decades of expertise and a proven reputation for precision, Braathens offers premium services that exceed industry expectations.
   

  

 Braathens operate with a steadily growing fleet of 21 ATR 72-600, Airbus A319, and A320 aircraft, engaged in long-term ACMI contracts with Scandinavian Airlines and Austrian Airlines, alongside charter contracts for Ving and Apollo.
   

  

 You’ll find our closely-knit and enthusiastic team at our headquarters, conveniently located at Hangar 5 next to Bromma Airport (BMA) and Bromma Blocks.
   

  

**About The Fleet Office**
 The Braathens Fleet Office is a dedicated team, providing Operational Engineering support to our Flight Operations department, whilst closely coordinating with other key stakeholders for a continues- and successful operation. As the main support function for the OCC team, we ensure thorough preparation and coordination of flight operations before handing over to OCC for daily management.
   

  

 The team consists of Fleet Office Engineers, EFB Admins and Navigation Database/Energy Performance Manager. The advantageous size of our team and close collaboration with key roles, such as Fleet Chief Pilots, Technical Pilot and NPFO, allows us to have a significant and positive impact across the organization.
   

  

 Required Qualities:
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you are result-oriented, adaptable, and thrive in a fast-paced aviation environment. You are a structured problem-solver with strong analytical skills who views challenges as opportunities. Your meticulous approach, strong communication abilities, and collaborative nature contribute positively to our dedicated team.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

  

* Flight planning and performance calculations
* Securing flight- and traffic permits
* Analysis of operational data (route evaluation, geopolitical factors, etc.)
* Fuel efficiency initiatives
* Managing flight ops related databases
* Interaction with regulatory authorities, aircraft manufacturers and other key stakeholders


 Required Qualifications:
   

  

  

* Completed ATPL theory OR experience as Flight Operations Officer (FOO)
* Familiarity with aviation regulations and standards (EASA, IOSA)
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to drive change effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.


 Meritorious:
   

  

  

* Experience from aviation operations (flight planning, operational support, manual production)
* Completed university degree with a focus on aviation-related subjects
* Experience using Flight Planning software such as PPS8, N-FP or FlightKeys
* Proficiency in MS Office


 We Offer:
   

  

  

* Travel benefits via MyID Travel after six months
* Vacation opportunities: Access to vacation rentals in Mallorca at self-cost prices for the perfect getaway.
* A supportive work environment with opportunities for internal career advancement and professional growth


 For questions, contact Joakim Albihn, Senior Fleet Office Engineer, joakim.albihn@flygbra.se.
   

  

 We look forward to your application, no later than 20 April! Selection and interviews are conducted continuously, the position may be filled before published end date.
   

  

 Check out the Braathens Fleet Office latest achievements on LinkedIn:
   

  

  

* https://www.linkedin.com/posts/braathens\_in-december-we-operated-our-first-flight-activity-7292843301919973377-QhUL?utm\_source=share&utm\_medium=member\_desktop&rcm=ACoAAA0kf8gBsb4FfT6lPCRDcXYcLcahZrrHC3Q
* https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jeppesen\_jeppesen-braathensregionalairlines-flitedeckpro-activity-7284629943697715200-6wBw?utm\_source=share&utm\_medium=member\_desktop&rcm=ACoAAA0kf8gBsb4FfT6lPCRDcXYcLcahZrrHC3Q


 Get to know us further: https://www.braathens.com/about-us/
